Ratings.comment: 2 months into the semester and not a single thing graded, all she does is lecture, she makes me feel dumb when I amm confused, and I am pretty sure she made fun of the way I talked one time. She makes me hate my major, don't take this class if its not required.

Avoid her if possible although it is possible to get through if you are well organized (she is not). Unclear instructions and deadlines everywhere, syllabus conflicting with assignments all over the place. She is overly meticulous about cheating/AI and probably accused like half the class, including me (I didn't cheat). A ton of textbook reading.

Absolutely overwhelming. I've taken a dense, senior level class that was condensed into a month and still didn't do as much work or have to process as much material as she gives. It's crazy! Don't do it to yourself.

don't recommend this professor. The amount of homework released every day (Monday-Friday) makes it nearly impossible to complete the assignments while retaining information. Her grading system is completely confusing. I reached out on multiple occasions to inquire about grading and each time her answers were unclear and not helpful. Did not

Stay away from this professor. Homework assignments are so time consuming and she does not articulate her expectations well. The instructions and questions are unclear which led to lots of confusion. She assigns readings, videos, or hw for everyday of the week which made this class hard to manage with being busy. Overall didn't even learn anything

If I could rate this professor a 0, I would. She slams your carmen with assignment after assignment and gives poor instructions. Her feedback is mediocre at best. She wrongfully reported a group project to COAM immediately without any warning or inquisition about her suspicions. Do yourself a favor & find another teacher to take this course with!!!

She does not articulate her expectations well. I never knew how we were graded for essays and participation, it seemed very arbitrary. Her Carmen page was an absolute mess so I had to constantly check it to stay up to date on assignments. You can do well in this class if you are willing to work within a disorganized class structure.

RUN FROM THIS CLASS. The professor everything. Awfully organized gives incomplete grades even though it states that homework can be submitted whenever. Simply run. The class is hard and the professor is terrible.

Modan is a very accessible professor and will extend deadlines to provide more info if students are still stuck on some concepts before a quiz. On pretty much all of the quizzes online, you can take them as many times as you want before the deadline. A difficult grader and will knock points off for arbitrary reasons, but you can just try again.
Useless discussion in class and she has never followed her schedule so we Always left behind. No feedback for homework and midterm. You won't learn too much in this class.
Don't take this professor. Gets off topic. Tough grader. You won't learn much in this class.

Do not take this class unless you want to become a teacher. That criteria was specified nowhere in the course description, but we spent the whole semester discussing things in terms of "how would you explain this to your students?" Her grading is also arbitrary, and if you try to ask her why she took so many points off, you won't get an answer.

I actually thoroughly enjoyed this class. Modan was fun and we participated in a lot of discussion. She can be distant and come off as rude sometimes when you talk in class but, for the most part, she is pretty relaxed. The material can be a little difficult and her tests are ones that you have to study for, but nothing too back-breaking.

Worst professor I have had at OSU. Flippant, rude, acts like you are wasting her time if you try and speak to her post-class (don't even bother with office hours). Most boring, dry class ever, she just lectures, material is lengthy and useless. Nitpicky grader- midterm is difficult, final project/final are easy.

She never really taught. Just sat there as we did discussions about what we read the night before. When a student would talk, she just nodded and made a smile which was far from genuine. For our final project, she asked us to incorporate one more thing into our project a week before it was due.

My reasons for vexation will surely not fit in 350 characters.  Long story short, somewhat arbitrary, nitpicky grading, rewrites everyone's final projects, ridiculously plays favorites, has a ban on technology in class, tells overactive students to not participate.  Consider yourself warned. That being said, it is a somewhat interesting course.
Excellent teacher.  Sometimes difficult to follow, but the subject material is very difficult, so that oculd be the issue.  Extremely knowledgeable.

This class was extremely easy for me but she, while not a BAD professor, was sometimes irritating and confusing. I felt like a lot of stuff she taught was very opinionated and it seemed like she got annoyed with the class sometimes. The only thing that really messed me up was when we had a sub teach one day and they taught everything differently.

A challenging but worthwhile professor. She encouraged discussion and prompted students to think beyond what they thought they knew. A very good class to take, it will challenge your conception of language as long as you keep your mind open and engage in discussion. Its a class that you feel like you miss out if you skip.

Professor Modan really challenged students to think for themselves, and the class was extremely interesting. I would not recommend it if you are lazy, but if you're willing to do the work, you can learn a lot from her.
The most painful class I've ever taken in my life.

fantastic instructor; she is very understanding, always prepared to offer additional clarification on the assignments she gives. Some of the class assignments are a little complex, but you will learn more & advance greatly. Her teaching style includes many group activities & peer reviews that also assist you in building your own personal character.
She was very nice, but not a great teacher. She is unclear with project instructions and does not explain directions well at all.
she is such a tough grader and does not want her students to get A
The class is not hard, but when u see the professor just start to think about how to escape.
never choose this professor
Easy course with Hard instructor
strictest professor ever seen
Just listen carefully, you should learn something.
Please don't take the course from this person, it made me so mad to talk about with, just see the tags and don't take the course from this person.
Just don't take the course from this professor, trust me.
I seriously suspect that all those positive comments about her were written by herself. Makes absolutely no sense.
Seriously?
I love her so much
My favorite professor in Ohio!!!
So nice!!!!!
The most wonderful professor I've ever seen! She is great! everyone in the class loves her, Take her class you will never regret

Professor Janyo is a kind lady if you talk to. However, her class requires strict attendance policy even though you come to class 1 min late and you will lose points. In addition, this class has a lot of assignments to do and she is very cautious about giving points to students in each assigment although this should not be a tough class.

The most wonderful professor I've ever seen!
She is great! everyone in the class loves her,
Take her class you will never regret

She is the most awful prof i have ever seen, I can not breath on her course, i often feel like i'm leaving this beautiful world after her class. There are too much homework, and each homework is soooo strict and difficult!!!!! And u will get a little credit!! Taking her course is the worst choice I have ever made!!! Please run as fast as you can!!!
She hates her students.

OMG
We have to spend so much time on that elective course, and the time for deadline is so wired, which was always due on Sat 12pm...
Really bad.
the best but makes you work for it

She's very nice and very passionate about what she teaches. The only assignments were a midterm, final, quiz and two papers. The workload is not heavy at all and shes a pretty easy grader if you make an effort. She wants people to engage in discussion but its not a requirement.

She's a good professor who loves what she teaches. 2 papers and one midterm (super easy) on the readings, but that is what the entire grade was based off. We read multiple short stories accessible on Carmen, and also two stories that we could either buy or find online copies of. Participation is based off the questions you answer in class

Professor Prinz is such a nice woman. Her class is really easy to get an A in if you just put in some work for the essays and midterm. She doesn't really grade participation but does grade attendance. Overall, she is just so amazing and you won't regret taking her class.

Professor Prinz is such a nice lady, we read a lot of interesting short stories in class, and had discussions, and the workload is little in this class. The only thing I would say is that she doesn't know how to use carmen very well, but it is understandable, and it did not really negatively affect my experience in this class.

Professor Prinz is a very understanding professor that genuinely cares about her students. Her selection of short stories to read was always an interesting read and the discussions were always intellectually stimulating. Very easy course, just make sure to follow grading criteria closely for papers, as those are most of your grade!

Professor Prinz is the nicest lady youll ever meet, and the class is pretty simple but by no means a waste of time. The books and stories are enjoyable, and she genuinely cares about her students and their opinions. The classes are almost entirely discussions, and no matter what you say shes just happy to see you involved.
Boring Class.

She seemed like a super lenient grader. Most people in my class (as far as I'm aware) got A's on their papers. She likes you better if you talk in class, and she's a real sweetheart and just wants to look out for her students.

Professor Prinz is nice enough, but she is entirely dependent on worksheets. They leave very little room for discussion, and Professor Prinz rarely has anything insightful to add to the conversation. While the class requires a lot of reading, you can easily get away with skimming SparkNotes. Book was a massibve waste of money; theyre all online.

Jessica is a good professor. She genuinely respects students opinions and loves to hear what they have to say, often mentioning things they have said in the past during lecture. Classes are either discussion or lecture driven. Two papers and two tests, both of which are pretty easy. If you do the reading and pay attention, should be an easy A.

Prof. Prinz gave a comprehensive course of literature of short stories, poetry, novels, and drama. I enjoyed her insight to the class and the way that she structured time based on discussion after reviewing the major concepts of pieces. Her writing selection was varied and interesting, and her grading on essays was fair. Taking another class w/ her

She is such a sweet lady! She really values student participation or just when her students try. If something is unclear or you need help with a paper topic, just talk to her after class- she is so sweet and understanding. Such an easy paper grader and exams are a breeze as well.

she is very understanding and appreciates and encourages feedback.  she is a light-hearted grader, and you can expect that if you try then you will succeed in her classes.  she likes to talk about art and relate it to lit.  it is great.  class discussions were mostly boring though.  but i would recommend as expectations are clear and feedback helps
Kind-hearted.  Not always prepared.  She really values participation, and the class is pretty easy.  I'm not sure I've learned as much as I would hope.

One of the easiest English classes I've taken! There's a wide variety of material, so I really enjoyed it, too. As long as you do the work and participate regularly, you'll be fine. You don't even have to read all of the books, honestly. This professor was friendly, a very easy grader, and very accepting of even the most abstract ideas!

One of the nicest and friendliest professors I've ever had. She welcomes alternative interpretations and finds the good in student comments. She grades fairly easily--show up and do the work and you'll be fine.
Do the work and you'll be fine. She is a pretty easy grader on papers, too. My second essay I wrote was not as good as the first but they both received A's.

Great professor. She really cares about what students have to say and fosters an environment that produces great in-class discussion. She is a pretty easy grader, provided you put thought into things. Builds a great classroom environment; it is actually enjoyable to attend class.
I had Dr. Prinz for both 553 and H590 and both were great. A very kindhearted person that exposes her students to some great texts.
love this guy

Amazing prof. Lectures are super engaging and he makes the material fun to learn. Very understanding and caring. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes, both of which are super easy and not harshly graded. One midterm essay and one final essay. Overall a great guy who genuinely enjoys the material he teaches and interacting with his students.

Really chill online class especially if you like film. Took less than 2 hours of my time/week other than writing a paper for the first project and a second paper for the final. Those were very simple and he doesn't grade harshly. His lectures are posted online so you can watch even if you can't make class, but recitation attendance is mandatory.

Professor Gardner was awesome, his lectures were always super interesting and he really seemed to care about his teaching and his students. It is kind of strange for this course to have a recitation, but I didn't mind. The assignments are straightforward, and there was a really great selection of films for this course!

Super engaging with his lectures. He tends to go off on a bunch of different tangents but I find that it makes him even more engaging to listen to. He is always super well prepared and it is very clear he knows what he is talking about. The movies we had to watch each week were great pics and he was able to teach about them super well.

Professor Gardner is a incredible professor. The course is lecture heavy but he is very engaging and it made learning the material enjoyable. There is a weekly quiz that is very easy with minimal effort and two papers that, if taken the time to complete, are easy as well. I would highly recommend this course to anyone.
His lectures are long, but are a joy to be in. He is so clearly passionate about the subject and his students. Highly recommend.

Hes a great prof! He talks a lot but I learned a lot from him. There were weekly quizzes and discussion boards, but they were super easy and didnt take long. I put minimal effort into this class and got a good grade. Also, he picks pretty interesting films for us to watch.

I'd take another class with Professor Gardner if I could--the reading is interesting, the films are (mostly) enjoyable, and the projects are lengthy but fun. I will say that he does talk in circles and covers little content in a long lecture, but I learned a lot nonetheless and didn't have to do a lot of work. Also you can't really skip the films.

Prof. Gardner is truly a great professor, and English 2263 was a fun class to take for one of my GE requirements. Attendance, honestly, was not a huge deal- but definitely go if you can- the lectures are fun. The films for the most part were interesting, but some were definitely not. Very easy discussions and quizzes but papers are time consuming.

Professor Gardner is a great teacher. The movies we had to watch were amazing and there were great lectures to go along with it. If you write notes and watch the movies you will get an easy A. Very entertaining class.

I took his Disney class and loved it. What an engaging professor that genuinely cares for his students and their wellbeing. He's been so understanding throughout the COVID-19 pandemic and I can't recommend him enough.

Jared clearly loves what he does and cares about his students. Sometimes he can get carried away talking about a topic for the whole class, but he was very nice and chose interesting things for us to study. Some classes could be a bit dry, but I liked Jared a lot as a person and I enjoyed what we read (even if it was a lot).
Loves what he's teaching and makes it clear what he expects from the class. A very big nerd and loves to talk about everything from football to comics to movies.

This guy is a solid professor. I'm not too interested in pop culture, but I will say he is an excellent lecturer. At the beginning the readings are annoying and long and you need to do them to do well on the quizzes, but once you get past the first half of the semester you're chillin. Pretty easy A, just do all the assignments and you're fine.

Recommended for all students in the health caregiver majors and fellow English majors. His selection of material gives a 360-degree view of all the perspectives of those affected by illness. I was introduced to genres I had no idea I would like.

His lectures are not regurgitated. He doesn't use notes. He is undoubtedly an academic expert in comics history and also a passionate fan. The assignments were enjoyable. This class was a great elective to take.

Jared is extremely knowledgeable and interested in teaching. "Pop quizzes" he'll tell you about ahead of time. Post slides and records lectures for those who can't attend, but does take attendance. Papers are straightforward. Exams are simple as well. Depending on your TA, you may not even have read the passages. Simply pay attention Great guy.

This class was painfully lecture heavy.  Jared is clearly a bright guy and very interested in the material, but he doesn't do a great job of facilitating discussion. Yet he wants to grade you on participation.... I tried reaching out throughout the semester and had a difficult time getting responses.

He's knowledgeable about comics & passionate as well, which makes lecture more fun. He's accommodating to all needs and easy to contact. His quizzes are hard, but if you read then you'll do well. He's kind of a tough grader, but just do your assignments on time & participate if you want a good grade. I loved this class and would take him again.
Not sure what class I was in. It was a few years back. Had to search for this woman's name. She is openly racist. It is very hard to imagine I was graded fairly.

Her assignment sheets are so vague and she expects so much out of her students without being explicit about any of it. She is also passive aggressive towards her students and is defensive over criticism-there was one time we did mid semester check-ins with her and instead of taking the criticism, she read it out loud and told us why we were wrong

Dr. Mitchell is very knowledgeable with the material. She is highly respectable in the classroom but is also hilarious. It is very easy to pass the course with flying colors, but you must read. Sometimes the reading is like 40 pages and that was terrible, but you will learn a LOT in her class
Took this class thinking it would be about fiction. I did not intend for this to basically be a political science class as well. She gets very political very often

Professor Mitchell told us on the first day that we should not take her class if we were struggling with our mental health. Sadly, her class was a GE and I had to take it. Professor Mitchell will love you if you have exactly the same world view as her. She seems to view different opinions as personal attacks. Not a bad person, but a bad professor.
Class was dominated by political rants. She seems to hate the world and OSU, very specifically. Very bitter.

I would highly recommend NOT taking for a GE. This class was "Intro to Fiction" but classes were dominated by Prof's extremely politically charged, irrelevant rants about race, sex, and often anti-US views. She's very nice, but this class had nothing to do with fiction, and everything to do with her personal opinions on the political climate.

Prof. Mitchell holds deep care for her students, and she even reached out to me when I was going through a rough patch. She challenged me in the best ways to be confident in who I am. I grew from her in depth look at definitions and carry her stories with me today. Her class was one of the most influential parts of my education.

Dr. Mitchell is very smart and a great teacher. The class is mainly group discussion but she usually leads the conversation and elaborates on points brought up by the students. The pop quizzes are easy if you read closely but the tests are very specific so be prepared to study.

Professor Mitchell is the hardest professor I have had at OSU. That said, she is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. Professor Mitchell forces you to look beyond the text and read between the lines of the works that she assigns. She will kick your butt, but she is the smartest and most knowledgeable person I have met at OSU. 10/10

Professor Mitchell is clearly very accomplished in her field and, thus, has a passion that shows. However, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO PUT IN THE EFFORT. Though this course is incredibly rewarding for those who are willing to work hard, slacking in this class will hurt you. Big time.

GET READY TO READ CHILD. This class was lit and I think you should totally take the class, but do not slack off even a little bit. DO NOT DO IT. Expect a quiz everyday over 40+ pages of reading. Deep thinking. Be open minded or drop the class. Seriously do not slack, she does not deal well with slackers. Also, smile. It never hurts.

I had the pleasure of having Dr. Mitchell for my African American Literature class. She makes you work hard, read and comprehend the material, but if you make your best effort, the course is fairly straight-forward. The content is very interesting as well. Every class has a discussion component, so be ready to take some risks!

Dr. Mitchell is the best professor I had in my four years at Ohio State. If you like to think and read closely (which you should if youre a college student), I highly recommend her class. No matter what, this woman is an amazing/inspirational teacher and you will be lucky to have had her in your life.

Professor Koritha Mitchell, while clearly accomplished in her field, cares more about talking about her own achievements than being interested in her students and their perspectives. I found her need to talk about herself distracting and irrelevant to the material. As well, she is unwilling to accommodate students who have registered disabilities.

Extremely knowledgeable, experienced, and dedicated to what she teaches. Also hilarious and cares about (and respects!) students when they put forth genuine effort. She tries to create an "intellectual community" w/heavy discussion, so if you can't deal w/participation avoid her. Reading load isn't unfair, quizzes are simple if you do the readings

Dr. Mitchell is one of the most knowledgeable professors I have ever had. She is intense at times, and expects a lot out of her students. If you just read and try your best to understand, you will do well in her class. She is very personable outside of class, and truly wants you to succeed.

Concerning attendance, you can miss days but she will dock you for it and wont be nice to you when it comes to grading you. However, you will not want to skip her AF-AMER LIT class. Its super interesting and she is one of the best profs in the department. She focuses her classes on seminar style and makes sure all are involved. Such a great prof.

While Dr. Mitchell expects a lot from students, she works hard to set them up for success. Quizzes followed every reading, so if you read what's assigned you will do well on a large portion of what is assigned. She is a tough but fair grader, and usually willing to help students outside class.

I took Dr. Mitchell's African American Literature class to get the required credits to graduate -- before this, I didn't really care. She is EXTREMELY passionate though, and succeeded in getting me to really engage the course matter. If you open yourself up to learning more about African American history, this class can be very rewarding. Awesome.
his lectures are genuinely engaging and make showing up to class feel easy, he rarely gives homework, and he is so clearly passionate about what he is teaching! i would recommend any of his classes

Genuinely one of the best professors I've ever had. Obviously cares deeply about the class (both the material and the students) and always makes you feel heard and appreciated. I've never used RMP before this and am only doing so now to give him 5 stars :)

Professor Knapp is one of the best professors I have had in the English department. He truly loves what he is teaching you and is eager to see you learn. His discussions are always interesting and I always showed up to lecture even as someone who chronically skips class. I highly recommend any course he is teaching.

One of the best professors I've ever had. The class wasn't exactly rigorous but he genuinely cares and engages with everyones thought, he's really happy to be teaching and it shows every single class. Just an all around great guy.

Professor Knapp is a great teacher! He is great at breaking down complex material to make it easy. For Middle English Lit, there are pretty much no assignments except for the midterm, final, and final paper. That being said, the class is EXTREMELY lecture-heavy. Everything you learn will be in class lectures so make sure to pay attention and attend
One of the best classes and professors I've had at Ohio State!

One of my favorite professors so far. He presents complex material in a comprehensible way that also allows the students to think for themselves. He is probably the kindest professor I've had. He's always willing to help, and his demeanor is very relaxed. His voice is great too.

This was one of the best classes I've ever taken, his choice of material gives a wide view of Arthurian Legend that will be helpful if you plan on going into the field and he is incredibly helpful and available when you need him. Highly recommended.
Great Arthurian legends class. A LOT of reading, but don't let it deter you from the class. Tons of fun.

LOVED HIS CLASS. His lectures (on Chaucer) were intellectually stimulating. He managed a good balance between lecture, class discussion and group work. His exam was challenging but very fair. I highly recommend this professor!
Really interesting and clear.

I thought the class was very interesting. It was a general, pre-English requirement class but I still thought it was intellectually stimulating- class was never boring. He made sure to address topics found in more advanced classes and gave constructive feedback on papers. I thoroughly enjoyed the class. He has a wonderful voice. =)

For some reason knapp never handed back papers--I wrote my final paper without ever getting my second paper back, just an email the second day of finals week telling me my grade. He seems really knowledgeable but I felt like no one in class knew what he was trying to say and he didn't seem to notice.

This was my favorite class I've ever taken.  Though he assigned 5 books they were relatively cheap and interesting. I'm keeping them just to finish reading them in my spare time. He's very helpful and is willing to stay after just to help you.  His exams are really fair and straightforward and he really gives you a chance to succeed on the exams.

Unlike any other prof I've ever had for any writing-based class, he never indicates what's wrong with any piece of writing; he just grades and hands it back so we don't know what was wrong with our writing in the first place. I wouldn't recommend him for 515 if you have no experience in medieval literature beforehand; he's too into it and advanced.

I loved this class . . . I already had a huge interest in Chaucer, but Prof. Knapp made him even more appealing.  Lectures were never boring, he's a very fair grader, his quizzes and exams are simple as long as you read the material.  Also, as a bonus, Prof. Knapp has the most gorgeous, deep, masculine voice EVER; it's a real pleasure to listen to.

Professor Knapp is by far one of the finest intellectuals I have worked under. As everyone on this list has said, he is remarkably trenchant and yet so lucid. If you can keep up with the reading, you will appreciate the extraordinary connections he makes b/w diverse intellectual schools of thought

One of the best teachers at Ohio State. He can make you understand difficult subjects such as Kant and Locke because he's just that good.  He's friendly and helpful, and even takes time after class is over to stay and talk with you.  His exams are lengthy, but are straightforward.
Knapp makes difficult ideas less difficult; he's about as clear as the day is long. Nobody gets any papers back on time, but nobody cares because he's so good at what he does.

Great professor!  Keeps you interested and well informed.  He knows what he is talking about.  Very clear. He also has a very deep and resonating voice when reading middle english that keeps you listening.
SHE IS AN ANGEL GO TAKE ALL OF HER CLASSES YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT 🫶🫶🫶🫶

Dr. Martinez-Rivera! This is a reading and writing-heavy class (U.S. Folklore Experience), but she made it fun. A lot of reading is necessary for the assignments, especially if you're not used to ethnographic writing. All of the assignments build up to a 10-12 page paper and a 7-minute presentation at the end of the semester. Great prof!

I have her this semester and she kept in touch when I missed assignments because I was having a rough semester and gave me extensions when I asked. Its asynchronous so sometimes its hard to keep up with the work and its a seven week class but its not hard if you watch the lectures.
Professor Neville is obviously an expert in her field. You will learn a lot from her, but she can be harsh. Sometimes it felt like she was not receptive to new ideas, but overall great professor.

Dr. Neville is by far the best professor I have had. While her courses are difficult with a lot of reading and writing, she is also understanding and brilliant. I plan to continue taking her courses because of how much I have learned.

Unless you're fascinated by the content of the course I would avoid it, as it's dry and very rigorous. Essay expectations are vague yet they're graded harshly, although she will teach you valuable writing skills afterwards and help you improve it for a better grade. The lectures are important to understanding the text but it's mostly lectures.

Professor Neville can seem intimidating, but she is by far one of the most brilliant professors I have ever had. Her grading is tough, but her feedback is extremely rewarding; better yet, she allows for redos based on the feedback. Her office hours are engaging, as well, and a great resource for assignments. She clearly knows her stuff.

Dr. Neville can come off as a bit harsh and intimidating on the surface, but she is one of the best professors I've had. Classwork can be difficult but her classes are the highlight of my week. Discussion-based seminars, plenty of interaction with both instructor and peers. Very funny and considerate, and will teach you GREAT writing skills.
Dr. N is very vague in her assignment guidelines AND in her advice and criticism. Doesnt actually give you any useful help when you need it and grades hard as hell. 0/10 do not recommend.

She's a good teacher and cares about students & material, but the way she structures her class can prove difficult. Lots of papers to write, lots of readings that may or may not be tough, and a big group project at the end with very little instruction on how to do it. She was lenient in how the class functioned though. Overall good teacher

I took this class because I am a science major (title is Science Technology) She made this class more about English and put a humanities perspective on it. A lot of people in the class agreed that it was unnecessary to have 5 papers, a midterm (10 SA, 2 essays), a final (10 SA, 3 essays), and a group project which there were no clear instructions.

very easy and interesting! It was about horror media. The reading was split into two (pages 1-50, pages 51-100) and then lecture 1 would be based off the first half, lecture 2 on the second, and then 1 quiz at the end of the week. If you're paying attention, you'll no good! He also tells you how to get the books and where to watch the movies free

Dr. Garcha was easily one of the best professors I have had at OSU. I had already read a majority of the books we were required to read prior to taking the course, but I was still able to learn new things about them, especially since his lectures were so fun. He is truly passionate about what he does and cares about your well-being.

He is the best English professor I've had. His lectures are engaging, funny, and insightful. He gives great feedback and is very understanding with attendance. I looked forward to his class every day!

Garcha is an angel. Easily the best English prof I've had. Lectures are great (I learned SO MUCH about both the texts and their historical context), quizzes and exams are reasonable, and grading is very fair. He genuinely cares about students & LOVES what he teaches. Take his class if you can! I loved it so much I didn't want it to end.

He's a great guy, and his class if pretty easy if you show up for lecture. You can get away without reading a decent portion of the material, since he goes over the basics of it and what you'll need to know about it for tests in class. He doesn't put his slides up on Carmen, so better make friends in class if you miss. Also attendance is mandatory.

Professor was fine; it was the class itself and the structure that sucked. I went in thinking we would be reading at least somewhat enjoyable texts like Wuthering Heights, 1984, Sherlock Holmes stories, etc. but it ended up being 90% really dry poetry. Lectures were boring an repetitive. Though it was an easy A if you show up and do the work.

Prof. Garcha is great! Very enthusiastic about what he teaches and is funny. Attendance is mandatory, only allowing 4 absences, so SHOW UP! Grade includes 4 quizzes (30%), a midterm and a final(55%), and participation. Show up, take notes, do the reading and study for the quizzes/ tests and you will get an A. Dont buy books- all can be found online

Prof Garcha is awesome. Very easy going and hilarious. British Poetry is, let's face it, boring. He made it fun and interesting. He tells you what you need to know, and if you're creative enough to go beyond that A's should be no problem. He is however a bit of a grammar Nazi.

Garcha has a great bubbly personality, and he's clearly interested in what he teaches. Brit Lit usually isn't my thing, but he made it pretty interesting. Go to class and learn his viewpoints, then regurgitate them later. Easy! You'll do especially well in this class if you like/are good at writing, because tests & quizzes are always short answer.
He was really clear about the material and helped me think about the readings and analysis in a whole new way.
I finally got to read twilight in his class! I love Princess Leia! It was so fun!!
In this class, you have to read TWILIGHT.  :(
One of the best english profs I have ever had, ever. :)
Loved his class, absolutely amazing teaching. Really knew the course material, and cared eenough about it to make me care too.
One of the best teachers i have ever had the chance of having.

Texts and lectures were both very interesting. Garcha is a cool guy who takes his time grading the minimal papers he assigns, giving tons of helpful tips even if it's an A paper. Despite the small workload I felt like I learned a ton. If you do the reading, show up to class and do half decent papers you should get an A.

Very fair grader - he gave constructive criticism on writing assignments, but didn't take a lot away from the grade. Quizzes are easy if you do the reading. Lectures seemed a little long at times, but also sometimes funny. He doesn't take himself too seriously and lets the class out a few minutes early. Overall, I'd recommend taking his classes.

I'm so surprised at the negative comments.  Garcha was the best I had at OSU. Finding an English prof (from columbia mind you) who is down to earth, funny, and intelligent is a rare find. Exams were fair, no surprises or tricks. Same with papers. You have no one to blame but yourself for not doing well in his class.

If you are familiar with the time period, don't take this class.  He never strays from his set ideas, to the point of the class being boring.  He attempts to win over the class by making joking comments criticizing himself and the time period.  By far the worst professor I had.

If you like to get points for small things like attendance, want most of lecture to be the lecturer up at the board reciting his ideas and not too much reading, then he's for you. I didn't particularly like him; I thought his ideas jumped all over the place and it was hard to grasp a single concept about what he was teaching.
awful. just awful. very unclear instructions and very harsh grader. offers way too many assignments with unclear goals.
Very disorganized modules, unclear instructions, and very nit-picky grading.
Extremely disorganized modules and way too many homework assignments for an online class.
Very tough grader throughout the course, required many assignments that were not graded. Gives lots of extra credit and bumps heavily by end of the semester. Very responsive in emails.

She grades very tough and for a class that's all about readability, you can't understand what her assignments are asking. She had to postpone an assignment because she couldn't explain it. Be prepared to receive poor grades for no reason, and do many assignments that don't get graded at all. Don't take this class

Just talks a lot for no reason. This should be an easy FAST class, but she does wayyyy too much. She talks about a bunch of stuff that does not matter and wastes all students' time. Please do not take her.

Cathy is kind. But this entire GENED class is so unorganized and incredibly hard to follow. For a 1 credit hour class I've spent way too much time on these unnecessary assignments. She did tell us its like a “pilot” course so hopefully it becomes more organized in the future.

She just forces people to talk and participate a lot. It seems very pushed and unnecessary. There doesn't need to be a Before Class, During Class and After Class tab with readings and videos before each 55 minute weekly zoom class for a 1 credit hour class. Talks too much, can be confusing, irrelevant info at times. Nice, caring but tries too much.
Senile.

She's really chill about grading assignments. Other english classes will make you read and write a lot but she doesn't at all. I didn't have to write a single paper in her class. She gives a lot of free points. As long as you show up, talk in class, and get stuff done you will get an easy A.

Overall, her class was super easy. However, she is very unclear on assignments and homework. Her carmen page is very disorganized and assignments were rarely ever posted on the calendar. She gets off topic a lot in class. As long as you pay attention and write notes on when things are due/ what assignment's are coming up you wont have a problem.

I don't recommend taking her especially for GENED. Her organization is all over the place and she places multiple duplicate assignments and then gives you a 0 on half of them and it drops your grade. She also has us do assignments based on ones that aren't even due yet. She keeps pushing everything back, college organization is important.

She doesn't grade correctly or fairly most of the time. Her assignments are all over the place and they don't match up. Most of the time we are reviewing an assignment that wasn't even due yet and we are told to make a discussion on it. It is just all over the place, organization is key especially in college and this class has none.

Dr. Ryan is a very nice person and genuinely cares about her students. She can be disorganized sometimes and it takes forever to get feedback on assignments, but if you put the work in, this course itself is not that hard and A is relatively easy because her grading is flexible and there are lots of opportunities for extra credit.

Dr. Ryan meant well always and really cared about students. Her principles of teaching are great, but the execution of those is mediocre. We collectively felt like we often didn't know what was expected of us, grading took a LONG time for little feedback and most points earned all fell to the last week of the semester, which was so stressful.

She's helpful and caring overall but still can't deny the class is very confusing. Talks way too much about stuff off topic and give little instructions on assignments. Uses a different grade website which made things more complicated. Doesn't update grades after semester ends which made no room for grade makeup. Runaway when you still can!

Very disorganized and rarely had thorough descriptions of assignments, leaving the entire class confused almost daily. Uses a grading system that isn't carmen which leads to even more confusion and difficulty and doesn't update grades. If you have to take this class, try to get another professor.

Dr. Ryan is the nicest professor Ive had. She genuinely cares about her students and is super flexible. Its not super organized but allows for work to be done after the due date. There is no rubric and her main focus is students learning and improving. Not a bunch of writing and lots of reflection.

No one in class ever has any idea what is going on. There is a group chat with people in my class, and each and every day people express their frustration for not knowing what is happening in class. Nothing is explained. You never know what work is due or when. This class is the most unorganized class I have ever taken. Do not take this class.

Overall, Cathy Ryan is a good professor and is willing to work with you if you have any issues. However, she can get off topic and isnt extremely clear on grading criteria. She is a non traditional grader and is willing to help you if you show effort.

She is a bit disorganized but will explain if you explain what it is you're confused about. "Non-traditional" which I like since she offers lots of extra credit if you don't do so well on an assignment. She will have you participate and participation is a major thing in the class. She is very accommodating.

If you can change her class do! My classmates and I didnt know what was happening at all in class. We would ask questions and she wouldnt answer them. And she talk too much, well have classwork to do and shell tell a story that takes up the whole class period. I hated the class and that book is pointless asf, dont buy it!

Dr. Ryan is very disorganized and is a "non-traditional teacher." Grading criteria and assignment requirements are never clear, and we literally did not get ANY grades for the entire semester until the last day grades were due. Class is pointless, but she calls students out who don't show up. And, you have to buy her self-made textbook. EC is given

Personally, I would not take Prof. Ryan again because she gets WAY too off topic and she confused my entire class. You will not know your final grade until the end of the semester. The class itself is pretty easy though. Dr. Ryan's teaching style is very non-traditional.

Cathy took over our class in the middle of the semester and was a great instructor. She uses a unique grading system called Gradecraft and it is like an interactive gradebook. It may seem daunting, but she gives you lots of opportunities to revise work and get a better score.

Prof. Trzinski expects a lot. The class is very reading heavy with a discussion board post and either a quiz or paper each week. She is a tough grader (I still got an A overall) and offers little feedback when she takes points off. For a level 2000 English class, this course is tough. One positive thing about her is that she returns grades quickly.

I had to ask for clarification on several of the quiz questions/essay prompts because they were unclear. She took off an unfair amount of points for small mistakes. I had an A up until the last assignment, which dropped my grade to an A-. She refused to allow any corrections even though a lot of the class got low grades. Too serious for a GE.

This class was very difficult in my opinion. Very time consuming, a lot of reading and writing which I expected. Unfortunately, she is a very harsh grader and her feedback was often not helpful in my case. I had a large tank and the end of the semester due to very harsh grade on my final, and she did not allow for changes or revisions.

She is a very hard grader but her feedback does not reflect it. some assignments are worth a ton of points but only have three categories on the rubric so one wrong thing will result in like 15 points off. there is just a lot of room for error with her. as an online class, she does not do anything extra to help actually teach, just a short video.

The class itself was a fair amount of work. Nothing too bad but definitely a lot of reading and writing. She gave a lot of valuable feedback. Not too strict of a grader but you will have to put in effort to get the A. Overall, good professor, and I learned a lot.

Professor Trzinski replies quickly and always gives thorough feedback on assignments. But, the class takes a LOT of work and she grades pretty strictly. Not the class to take if you're looking for an easy summer one.

Gives clear instructions and helpful feedback. As long as you follow the assignment guidelines,  (which are pretty straightforward and easy to understand) you'll do fine. Learned a lot. Would definitely take another course with her!

She gives a lot of assignments but with a lot of the assignments she does give valid criticism which I respect a lot. The readings that she picks out are very interesting but this definitely should not be a second-session course. However, I do think she is a good teacher and if you follow the directions of the course you should be fine.

Professor Trzinski expects a LOT of reading but is also understanding when asked for extensions. The class was tough at first but my grades improved as the semester went on and I incorporated her feedback. Not an easy A but not too hard of a class either :)

The rubric for her assignments are vague and could easily drop a grade even for small mistakes. There is no room for error on the essays its either you did good or bad. For a level 2000 English class it shouldn't be this difficult to get a good grade.

Samantha gave amazing feedback on all of my assignments and would reply to my emails quickly. There is quite a lot of writing, which is expected from a writing course. Overall, she's one of the best English teachers I've had!

Professor Newsad is so kind and helpful. He makes class enjoyable with his humor. The work is very simple as long as you follow instructions and actually do them, but if you have any confusion Professor Newsad will answer your questions almost immediately. I would 1000% take his class again.

Amazing professor! He is very funny, keeps you engaged the best he can, and gives great feedback. There are two papers and one final project. A few small assignments and reflections sprinkled in. He truly cares and is excited to teach. Highly recommend!

Very vague in all of the assignments, but honestly was a good thing. She doesn't grades grammar and lets you do rewrites. The class is a waste of time but sometimes she will give REALLY easy assignments in class for extra credit. Also cancels class a lot for extra credit assignments. She is also very understanding. Did not learn much but easy A!

Worst teacher I have met. She always said I can rewrite my assignments to get a better grade. However, I really if she revised or not. She never upload your grades. Do not believe her words that "you can get A" and " you can get extra credits if going to writing center". I went to writing center for three times. Then, what I get is nothing.

Favorite teacher freshman year! About 7 essays throughout the semester. Was a bit disorganized at times but even gave the entire class extra credit for staying, after arriving 10 min late. Gives you an idea of what your current grade will be during conferences (about 3). Let's you rewrite papers to improve your grade up till the end of the course.

The worst writing teacher I had ever seen. The grade she gave is very unfair, even though people from the writing center said I can get A. But she gave me C. And she changes her syllabus every week, so we never figure out what she wants to do. Just remember, never take her class if you want to graduate!

Very respectful and caring professor. Understands that the value of English is not just your grade, but the skills that you learn outside of the classroom as well. Isn't picky like most Eng1110 profs and will give you the grade if you put in the effort.
The definition of a lazy teacher is Cathy Ryan. She is very vague on assignments and does not offer the students much help or feedback unless you constantly nag and ask her for it.

She gives you a rubric with a timeline and dates for essays/homework but fluctuates very often, always further out though on the due date. Really open minded and just allows you to write, truly grading on whether you understood the prompt or not, not so much grammar. Really really good class and professor.
The worst teacher I have had at OSU yet. Failed to report grades on assignments, never replied to emails, and forgot about meetings.

Do not take this teacher. She is unorganized and fails to properly report grades. She likes to boast about herself a lot and uses class time to talk about herself or past students. Save your money! Pick a different teacher

Dr. Ryan is a phenomenal professor. She is always energetic in class. Her lectures are interesting and hilarious. She gives great one on one feedback and is understanding of the students' individual needs. The readings in the class are very interesting. The assignments are thought provoking but not too difficult to complete. Highly recommend her.
Great class and very fair.

Easy Grader. Many small homework but they are doable. Very nice human being and very friendly. Don't skip class, you'll miss a lot. Very kind teacher. Always tries to help, but rarely does. She was always excited and very fun to listen to, but her directions are so very very vague. flexible with deadlines. Lets out early. cheap book.

Great, very easy teacher. Most people had to do long research papers for this class, most of our papers were fun topics and a page long, with the exception of a short research paper at the end about If Christopher Columbus was a hero or villain. Very easy to get an A as long as you just do what you are told.
Definitely an interesting class and my favorite professor.  Deadlines aren't exactly known but other than that great class.

Mrs. Ryan was a really nice teacher, and this class is easier than most freshman english courses. But, she is not clear about due dates and no one ever knew what the assignments actually were. You have to write a lot of papers but they are very short. Hard to get an A in this class unless you are really good at writing already
Very vague about assignments. Might as well throw away your syllabus, because she won't follow it. Easy class though.

Honestly the best professor I have had in all of my academic life. Her one fault is that she can be somewhat vague and confusing when giving assignments, but, overall, the class and the grading system are very easy. I got so much out of this class, too. Not only did I learn basic english concepts but I gained qualities that I can utilize in life.

She is pleasant, however she is EXTREMELY unclear and no one really ever understands what the assignments are and exams, while they are take home, are all essay and very unclear. i would not recommend her.
She tries, but is very unclear. I wouldn't recommend her if you're trying to really take something out of an intro english class.

Cathy Ryan is a great professor. She is such an easy grader. She is also a really interesting person. Her assignments are fairly easy, though the directions are sometimes vague. She will let you out of class early. The only book reqired cost $12. Take CR! You won't be disappointed and it will be really easy.

Fairly easy grader. Book is super cheap. Your midterms are over the Shawshank Redemption and Erin Brockovich which you watch in class. Her only issue is that the topics you write on are very vague. You'll find yourself wondering what the actual assignment is. Plus side is that none of you papers are over 3 pages long. Cake walk.

Very kind teacher. Always tries to help, but rarely does. She was always excited and very fun to listen to, but her directions are so very vague, and her deadlines are always pushed back. I recommend taking her class. She's confusing, but 110.02H is very easy. You'll hate the lack of clarity, but love the extremely easy workload. It's worth it.
Amazing class. Always lets you out early, super cheap book. Lots of papers, but short ones and easy grader. Directions vague but always updates you with e-mails. Loved the class. Definitely take her!

Professor Ryan is an amazing teacher! She grades easy and is always willing to review papers before turning them in. She promotes creativity and most of the papers were 2-3 pages compared with non-honors english 110 classes writing 10 page papers. Our exams were over the movies Shawshank Redemption and Erin Brockovich. $15 book required. Take her!

Easy Grader and very practical teacher. half the time we were out of class 45 minutes early and she pushed back deadlines to assignments. She requires us o write a lot of papers but theyre all 1 to 2 pages. She always kept us informed for whats going on in class each week through email. Her directions tend to be very vague but she grades easy

Amazing teacher. I hated English  until I had her as a teacher. Easy A, barely spend any money on books except for a book she makes with student models for you to reference to. I would definitely recommend taking a class with her. Wish I could have taken 367.02 with her--that class is hell.

Dr. Ryan was a great instructor, very helpful and easy to approach. She will give you feedback on all of your essays before you submit them, which is helpful. The class itself is easy, but she makes it interesting and fun.

Amazing teacher. I hated english classes until I took her class. She is very encouraging. Only had us write short papers compared to my friends who were writing 10 pagers. Only needed to buy a 15 dollar text from her so saved a lot of money compared to other classes. We watched movies which we wrote out midterm and final exam on. Would recommend!
Worthless! That class was the biggest waste of time. If you want an A in English take her. Just hope your one of her favorites.

ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS! Easy A, but the $35 at the begining of the quarter is criminal, because she can't account for more than $5 a student. No one should be allowed to ask for money from students on top of what we pay in tuition w/o reason. Good to know the university did something about it when my class complained *rolls eyes* (OSU did nothing!)
She is a very easy grader, although she is quite vague, overall though, I'd take this teacher over any other because we can take any direction we choose, which keeps things interesting.

She made us write at least 2 papers every week. She made us pay 35$ at the beg. of class and she only used about 5$ per person (she won't be doing that anymore because we turned her in). She's easy to manipulate. She had no coherency/consistency to the class.
The assignments never made sense, but she was really cool and let us re-write stuff whenever we wanted to.  I say go for her.

Veyr easy; you could revise anything.  One problem I had was she asked for $12 from each of us for "a cd of our class info" and a "pizza party" and then we got all of 3 pizzas, which is like $30 max, and with the price of a blank cd that's like $2/person maybe?

We played games, ate pizza, and watched movies.  The class was fun and it was relatively easy to get an A.  She wasn't always clear on her assignments, but she accepted all revisions. Definitely get this professor!

Absolutely worthless professor. Also big into having students write checks to her personally for class use. Don't do it. Writeit only to the english department because she can't back up the amounts she gets with the amount she spends. All over the place in her teaching style and had a very weak cirriculum.

She is horrible. She never explains anything clearly. We didn't read a thing, just watched two movies and played a game. There was no finlal, only a six page paper of your choice. Very easy but very boring!
doesnt explain ANYTHING. but allows you to revise all your papers. you can pull off an A with her. just turn things in. no books, no readings, just writing. class is a joke. we watched two movies :]
Very nice person!
Sure you had the option of rewriting your paper, but had she been clearer, there wouldn't have been a need.  She definatly shouldn't be an example for future teachers.

As long as you did all your assignments on time and did all her extra credits, you should be fine.  Our class had pizza, played games, and ever took some classes off.  Make sure you nail one paper early on and she will like you for the rest of the quarter.

I dunno what everyone was talking about, Cathy was awsome, she was really easy and accomodating...she gave checks and check plusses and you could ALWAYS revise for a better grade. We got let out of class early a lot, and we hardly had homework...and we played games in class ...I thought she was awso

Seemed to like me - I felt sorry for those she didn't.  Picked on people in class.  Throw away the syllabus - dates change constantly, you're better off guessing what day they're due.  Got an A...  but then again, she liked me.  Avoid at all costs.
No Comments
Very knowledgeable writer, good at reviewing and sharpening skills.  unclear course objectives and multiple revisions of syllabus added more confusion than necessary
Has a good syllabus in beginning of quarter but doesn't stick to it....very unclear at to what assignments are due...reviews papers and very helpful...easy grader

Gives clear instructions and helpful feedback. As long as you follow the assignment guidelines,  (which are pretty straightforward and easy to understand) you'll do fine. Learned a lot. Would definitely take another course with her!
