short, easy quizzes at the beginning of each new play. option of writing a few short papers or one longer paper. midterm and a final that are pretty harmless if you actually show up to class and listen-- which is easy b/c he is a great & enthusiastic lecturer. he keeps things laidback and interesting. i highly recommend him.

Prof Farmer is a very good professor.  I never really liked Shakespeare prior to this class, but he made the material very interesting and relatable.  Lectures were not boring and I enjoyed listening to his take on the plays.  However, he is a tough grader on papers, and you will have a midterm AND final. I highly recommend him

Straightforward class, tests not difficult if you do the homework. Essays require a lot of thought and consideration. His enthusiasm for the subject is contagious, and it makes the class more fun than you'd think Shakespeare should be. Fantastic class.
He's overrated but pretty helpful with his comments.

Prof. Farmer is the least pretentious person in the English department. He is so humble and is truly teaching because he wants everyone to love Shakespeare as much as he does. I've never had a professor so willing to work with me on my papers outside of class. He's also written me countless letters of recommendation. Definitely a jewel in the dept.

People said he’s arrogant or pretentious but he’s not at all.  He’s just incredibly intelligent and knowledgeable. Fair grader & taught more about the writing process than my 398 professor. Makes incredible effort to meet with and/or talk to you outside of class if you need help.  My favorite by far.
Farmer is a smart guy, but he can be something of a windbag.  I'd take another class with him over say Highley.
He's okay by me.

Farmer is really cool.  I felt like I was learning from him.  The class was hard for me because I don't know how to write about film, but thats not his fault, duh.  I DO recommend him for this class and presumably for 520.  If he's pretentious, its b/c he is smart, so let him be.  If you're smart too, it will be okay.
Works extremely hard at meeting with you and goes out of his way to be available.  Very smart, enthusiastic, helpful, and not at all arrogant.
He's not awful, but he is arrogant.  I can see how he'd turn people off Shakespeare.
Avoid if you can!
The guy was pompous and arrogant. DO NOT take his class unless you LOVE Literature or like to hear people talking just to hear themselves talk. I liked Shakespeare a lot more BEFORE I took this class

Very smart. You will learn a lot of interesting and new things about Shakespeare. He's very nice and helpful. He's willing to spend as much time as necessary to make sure you understand and how to make papers better. I HIGHLY recommend his classes. He looks like Andy Dick and often twirls his hair which is really amusing.

He's a fine professor, but I wouldn't say that he's the dynamo that other people have written about.  He clearly knows his stuff, but his delivery sometimes comes off as a guy trying too hard to be liked.
You have to go to class and participate.  He's really smart and helpful.  As long as you study and do the work you should do fine.

Took shakespeare and film with him just because it fiit my schedule..hated shakespeare, LOVED the class. Took 520 with him becuase he made class so fun and interesting. I've never heard a bad thing about him!
One of the best.
What a great professor.  So enthusiastic and inspiring. He always goes out of his way to  help in anyway.  Extremely fair, and I would take his class over again. And yes, very cute.

Such a great professor.  I was kinda weary about taking this Shakespeare class, but he made it so interesting and you can feel his passion for it.  Make sure to take lots of notes so you can do well on the exam.  I never skipped a class because I loved it so much.  He's witty, cute, intelligent and just an awesome professor overall.

One of the best professors I have had. He is passionate about Shakespeare and wants to share that with you. He makes himself very available to you. He is a tough grader, but his critiques of your papers are always very in-depth and succinct. Great professoe. Plus, he's kind of cute :)

Best professor I've had in my 3 years here. Goes out of his way to help out and very approachable in office hours. Loves to meet with you and hear your ideas and has truly helped me share his passion for Shakespeare. Lots of reading but manageable. I'm going to look for his name and take his classes as much as possible in the future :)
Great teacher, great class.  actually made me like Shakespeare!  Great lectures, keeps 'em interesting and stimulating and very fair exams.
Great teacher.

This class was okay. There was a high workload especially if other classes you take have a lot of homework. she was a good professor but just make sure you really pay attention to everything given to you. Honestly, I was confused the whole 8 weeks of the course and still got an A so take that as you will lol its hard to do bad grading is easy.

Professor Romines is an excellent English professor. She gave good feedback on assignments and papers. Most importantly, she was straightforward to contact and responded pretty quickly to emails. There were around three assignments to do every week, but they were very manageable. I recommend her if you are planning to take English 1110.01.

Her class was great! There is a lot to get through and do, but she was really good at teaching concepts and providing feedback. I would recommend her to anyone who has to take an English class for gened.
I talk to my other friends who are also taking English 1110.01 with different teachers and they're surprised by how many assignments I have to do during a week. Lots of homework in this class

I took this class online with no lectures, and it was an easy A. She cares for her students and tried to offer good feedback, and there were many opportunities for peer review throughout the semester. If you needed help, there were ample resources available, and she was usually quick to respond. I recommend her.
I took this class online and she was a very easy grader but had a good amount of work each week. There was something due every Monday Wednesday and Friday and some of the time it was big projects.
The most understanding and flexible professor. She really cares about her students and grades very fairly. Definitely recommend!
this was the easiest class ever and if you did have a question she was there to respond. plus the gifs in her assignments were fun
Great class. As long as you do the the work it would be hard to get anything less than an A. Prof Romines is very understanding and gives you help when needed. Very straight forward class.

Professor Romines was really awesome! She is not a very harsh grader and she is always willing to help when you ask for it. Very nice and accommodating, lots of essays but if you enjoy English this is such an easy class. Her assignments are very clear, and I never felt nervous to ask for help.
She's an extremely nice person and a very easy grader. There is a good amount of work in the class though, usually three assignments per week.

Professor Romines is a funny, caring, laid back professor. The work in the class is very easy and her grading is even easier. You basically spend the whole semester writing a 5-page paper and creating a slideshow presentation, but you do it in easy bite-sized pieces. Highly recommend.

Professor Romines is AMAZING! I took her online class amid COVID and she was flexible and her class was very engaging. We spend the entire semester preparing for a symposium on a topic of your choice from the semesters topic, mine was socioeconomics in America. Very organized and effortless! There was homework every week, but it wasnt difficult!
Pretty chill class. Do the work, listen to the feedback, do well.

Prof Romines is an amazing lady also the best professor I've ever met in OSU. I crewed up the first two drafts of my final project but she was always patient there and ready to help me. I couldn't survive this course without her feedbacks, which were were really valuable and inspiring. Strongly recommend.
Great class online very helpful and stays up to date on emails to answer questions
Professor Romines is a very nice teacher. She is patient and willing to help students with questions. Take her class if you have the chance, work hard and you will get a good grade.

Great teacher, go to class write the papers and you will be fine. Give effort, she cares a lot about her students and will do her best to help you. Her approach is to give feedback and you correct, not do your paper for you. Overall a great professor, sometimes feels like to much busy work, but that is expected with an English class.

Professor Romines provides a very easy class, it's a little boring at points but overall not a bad class. She's got a great personality and loves to teach which brings enjoyment to the classroom. I think the material is what made the class boring, not her. It's an easy A if you show up to class and write all the papers. Btw that's all you do...
Tough but fair. Willing to meet with students to explain things from class.  I learned a lot, but you definetely have to earn your grade.

She's a great professor with a lot of energy!  Class is both enjoyable and interesting, and I learned a whole new method of writing.  If you don't understand the prompt for the papers at first, stick with it, and Angie will definitely lead you in the right direction!  If you have the oppurtunity or choice, pick this professor over anyone else!!
No Comments

She rarely responds to emails, has lots of papers to write, took this class during COVID-19 in which she didn't have lectures and wasn't lecture-heavy. Last day of class sent everyone a long email about her as a professor and brought up someone's deceased mom passing away, It was highly unprofessional during a pandemic. Hope she changed since.

The GE workload exceeds expectations, took many hours/week,surpassing major n minor classes.She rushes tru material,cramp projects till the last day.Quiz are frequent,hard,strict grading,vague rubrics. respond email late/nvr,hindering timely feedback onhomework. Also, assignments r graded late, making it hard to incorporate feedback into future hw.

Expect to wait a month before receiving any grades back. Heavily emphasizes drafting thorough peer reviews but rarely leaves any feedback other than "Good Job" (makes you wonder why grading takes forever). Lectures were meh. The comprehensive exam is made by the department so READ THE TEXTBOOK THOROUGHLY. Honestly, take another professor.

I really enjoyed this class and the way Katie teaches. The final exam is difficult so make sure you read the book!! Pick a topic you enjoy because the entire semester is based on that topic, including researching, several lengthy papers, and a final 5-minute speech. Easy class and not a tough grader!

I feel like I learned how to give better presentations. This class does have a few essays but they build off of each other. Katie is involved and kind. During each lecture she prepares us for upcoming assignments by reading all the guidelines! Just know that you will most likely have to do a final speech that is around 5 minutes LIVE to the class.
doesnt respond to emails whatsoever

She's a pretty great professor. There are quite a few "major" assignments (3 papers, speech, slideshow presentation, etc), but they weren't really hard and she is by no means a tough grader. She responds really quickly to emails too! The only downside is lack of feedback on assignments. She fills out a rubric but rarely leaves comments.
eh. shes bland. dull general feedback but if you follow rubric youll get an A on all writing assignments. make sure you study the book for the comprehensive exam.
Katie is a good professor. There are a lot of papers in this class, but don't stress because they aren't that bad. She provides example papers and it really is helpful!

While I used the textbook, I'd say for the most part it's not necessary to succeed in the course. As others have mentioned, it's a lot of small papers leading up to the final one so my recommendation is picking a topic you really like at the beginning. Katie does tend to talk really fast during lecture, but she's good other than that.

I was very nervous to take this class due to the speeches we had to give, but how she does them makes it very easy & not nerve wracking at all. She emails back very fast, & is always willing to help. She gives very clear & concise feedback which is VERY helpful throughout the course. Would love to have her again in the future!

Katie is awesome! Shes super chill and very approachable. This class has a lot of small papers leading up to a final paper. Overall, if you put in the work, its an easy A. Theres a textbook but you dont really need it because she goes over the readings in lecture

Great class! She was willing to work with me, even though I miss a lot of class. Exams and papers are not too hard. Read the textbook and take notes-- you'll be fine. She is NOT a harsh grader, so if you bomb the exams, you can still come out with a good grade.

Katie was a good choice for COMM2367. Super easy A if you actually put in the work. Quizzes and exams are online but are HARD! There are a bunch of papers in this class (writing class) but she grades them easily. She's super nice. Ended the class with a 98%

The class I took through her was just a GE but it was way too much work for that. She's a really harsh grader and you have to do a ton of stuff every week. She's nice, but it's a very demanding class.

Jill is a great person, but as a professor expects way too much for a class that is just a gen-ed. We read a lot in this class and it's semi un-doable if you have any other classes. She is the toughest grader I've ever met, but then you get the feedback and it says, "great job." Okay professor, but too much workload for a Gen-Ed.

Dr. Galvan is an important professor who promotes discussion and study of current issues that are woven throughout literature and poetry.  Her lectures are thought provoking, interesting, and informative.  She is funny and often self-deprecating.  If she's teaching, I'm enrolling in her classes.  She is memorable among the many.
I compare every lecture instructor to her since taking her class. She is extremely intelligent and knows what she is talking about. She was very well spoken. I highly recommend her classes.

I found Professor Galvan to be super nice and a great lecturer. The only reason I wouldn't take this class again is it requires previous skills like close reading. The whole class is what you read in-between the lines. Pop quizzes are random and require serious reading to ace (no skimming). Participation is seriously graded so raise your hand.

Pop quizzes are very easy IF you read the material you were supposed to read. They're summary questions but you wouldn't be able to find the answers on Sparknotes. Exams are graded pretty nicely. They are based on the reading you've done. Lectures are participation based. She is overall a great professor and makes you think outside of the box.

You sit in a lecture where she may or may not talk about everything you had to read.The projects and papers were not difficult but the exams were the worst. Be prepared to have to memorize who wrote what and why (exact titles and names) for every passage you read. Don't take if you are not good at memorizing a LOT of material.

Dr. Galvan will take time to meet with you after class, and seems to be really passionate about the material she teaches. The class isn't too difficult as long as you're willing to put the effort in. The essays are difficult for some and easy for others, but they aren't long and you can do them at your own pace. I really enjoyed the course.

Intro to Fiction with Dr. Galvan was much more difficult than I had anticipated. Coming into this class, I was expecting fantasy/science fiction type novels. Instead, Dr. Galvan assigned books that I wouldn't even consider fiction. Attendance to class is MANDATORY...assigns somewhat difficult pop quizzes based on the readings+good amount of essays.

Dr. Galvan really helps you grow a lot as a reader/writer, but she makes you work for it (so don't take her class if you're looking for and easy A). She's really kind and makes time to meet with you. There are big essays/assignments that are stressful, but you just have to put in the work. No tests, just papers and quizzes. Lots of reading.

Prof Galvan is such a caring sweetheart! She gives amazing feedback and really wants you to succeed. She encourages good discussion in class and deep critical thinking about texts. With the papers, be sure to schedule one on ones and get her feedback on your draft to get a good grade when you submit it. A bit of a tough grader

This class included three 2 page papers, a midterm and a final, a final project, and reading for each class. The readings weren't super long, and all the essays can be done at your own pace. Dr. Galvan facilitated really good discussion and did a great job explaining key concepts. She gives good feedback on essays, and inspires deep thought.

Class discussions were super helpful and paying attention really helped with the tests. There were just a few poems to read for each class. Everything's pretty chill bc you can plan when to do your writing assignments. Guidelines for later assignments and tests aren't out in the beginning, but she gives you adequate time to prepare.

Dr. Galvan delivers amazing lectures which teach you how to properly close-read any text and find the deeper meaning behind an author's diction and overall work. Her class was structured in an easy to understand way, her essays prompts were reasonable and interesting, and as long as you read the texts and went to lecture the exams weren't hard.
Dr. Galvan is a gem! She achieves an excellent balance between lecture and discussion that makes you feel both like you're learning a lot and contributing to the overall knowledge gain as well.

I really enjoyed Dr. Galvan's class. Her lectures were confusing sometimes since she just speaks and writes down a few terms on the board. However, if you do the reading and take good notes (write down everything) it's possible to do well in the class. She picked great pieces of literature to teach and was incredibly passionate about the material.

Dr. Glavan is alright, however, she's pretty unorganized. The syllabus changed during the semester and sometimes I had no idea what to prepare for lecture. Also, for a low level class there's a dumb amount of reading. That being said, as long as you usually read and go to a decent amount of lectures, her class rewards you.
Very confusing, never knew what she expected on papers and seemed to change her grading criteria all the time

Very excited to teach, passionate about material. Picks very relevant and influential literature and covers the books in a way that can spare you the reading of them if you pay attention. Lecture attendance is not mandatory, recitation is. Two close readings, two exams, one cumulative. Very cute and very friendly - if that matters to you.

Readings and the course theme were interesting. However, this course was highly unorganized. Reading assignments were given extremely late to the students; there would be instances where there were 5 days until the next class, and she would post the assignment the day before class. Also, grading was inconsistent and papers were returned super late.

She was late almost every day except for 2 or 3. The exams were okay if you read it all but there were many irrelevant readings. The class was supposed to be about Oscar Wilde, but many readings weren't his works. Also I had a really hard time participating in class. But the lateness was the worst part because it felt so disrespectful of our time.

Late to 95 percent of our classes - not exaggerating. Generally disorganized, changed syllabus multiple times. VERY tough grader, especially on things such as discussion posts. I really had to make extensive study guides to do well on exams. Tests you on insignificant details, not major concepts. Relatively engaging, but dominated the lecture.

She teaches Victorian lit (and this was a graduate class), so there'll be a lot of reading. I didn't find her disorganized like other reviewers; I thought her discussion style was very open to feedback and straightforward. I haven't seen her essay feedback yet, but I'd definitely take her again.

Professor Galvan is a friendly person, but her class was unbelievably difficult. I've taken quite a few analysis heavy English courses but it felt impossible to figure out what she wanted. The reading isn't bad and there were minimal assignments, but her grading is nit-picky and vague. The exam content was too much for the time allotment.

I have taken two of Professor Galvan's classes now.  Normally, I pull B+/A- in every class, but I pulled two C's in hers.  Her classes are a great mixture between lecture and discussion; however, her grading is outrageous. She grades papers with the loftiest of expectations, and her exams are impossible if you aren't used to them.  OFFICE HOURS!!!

Galvan was by far my favorite professor I've ever had in college. You must attend to pass, and she sometimes gives pop quizzes, but if you read the assignments, its basically give me points because they're super easy. Class participation is a must, and the class is based around her lecturing and students participating so it's easy. LOVE HER

One of the best professors I've ever had; very informative, knows what she's doing, and is able to explain everything in a sense that everyone can understand. She makes you feel bad when you don't participate, not because she pressures you, but because she's just so adorable and you can't not talk. Talking is also easy.

Lectures are decent, if not hard to follow. Harsh grader. This isn't necessarily bad, as long as the professor offers constructive comments allowing the students to improve. Though she did offer plenty of paper comments, efforts to rectify criticisms were met with the same grade and different, even contradictory, comments.

A wonderful person, brilliant and clearly knows her stuff... but not a good professor.  Grades way too hard, is often times ambiguous in class as she goes off on daily tangents stemming from a teacher's pet's insights or whatever other hoopla, and does not engage the class well; rather, you will listen 90-95% of the time.  She's also very, very hot

Great at communicating the course material and providing assistance where needed. Creative in the sense that she was able to take material I would have otherwise considered boring and turn it into an enjoyable experience!

If I could describe Professor Galvan's class in one word, I'd go with balance. She balances lecture with class discussions perfectly, with just the right amount of structure. She also balances close readings of primary texts with integration of secondary scholarship. Actually reads and reflects on responses. Incredibly smart. Take her class.

At first I was a little intimidated to take her class, but as soon as I started, I loved every moment of it. She clearly explains everything and if you have a question, she'll be more than glad to answer. If you really care about your work, she'll really care about you. She is extremely helpful. Loved her class!

To me, atmosphere is a vitally important element of any class. She makes her students feel as though they want to participate, and the result is great discussions. Although its true that she wants the interpretation you discussed in lecture on the exam, she makes that perfectly clear plenty of times. Tough but very rewarding class.
Very good professor. She is very knowledgeable and is very willing to help students. I learned a great deal from her.

Professor Galvin was GREAT.  She is intelligent and engaging.  Her material is top notch and very relevant to the discussions.  I only wish I could have her for all of my classes.  She is tough and does take attendance.  As long as you keep up with the reading you will do well.

Bad at returning papers/quizzes, won't put comments on late papers. Dwells on certain topics and you don't finish discussing the books. Interesting, smart, engaging, kind,always willing to help on papers. No midterm, Long final, very uninteresting prompts, nitpicky grading temperament (critical, but inconsistent on what difference A&C writing is)

Interesting lectures, nice person, I enjoyed class. Sometimes hard to understand. Hard grader--gives lower grades if she doesn't like paper topic & always wants more details/examples. Final was ridiculously long but fairly straightforward questions. Easy quizzes. Learned a lot but take her only if you're willing to work.

She kept the class interesting and she was very friendly, but unreasonable sometimes. On papers she always pushed us to "dig deeper" and it seemed like she was always making things harder than they needed to be. On the final she had us do WAY too much writing for the time we were given: 3 small essays plus 16 questions of at least a paragraph each.

Jill Galvan is by far my favorite English professor at OSU. She is so knowledgeable and insightful, but also extremely interested in hearing students' perspectives and ideas. I disagree 100% that she would lower a grade for not agreeing with the interpretation. If you seek her help you will definitely do well. Super personable and encouraging.
Hands down one of the most interesting classes I've taken. She is an awesome professor. It was fairly difficult, but she is very helpful.
An incredible professor. Difficult and well worth taking anything she teaches.

Always an entertaining class, I am always glad to attend class.  Great for anybody who enjoys reading fiction.  Great selection of subject matter.  Only bad part is she sometimes doesn't seem to understand the point I am trying to make in a paper or in class, meaning my grade is lower :(

Prepare for a B. She knows what she's talking about, but doesn't accept different interpretations. I've never gotten below an A in any English class until this one. If you can find someone easier, go for it.

Can tell she knows her stuff, but rarely accepts ANY other interpretations in class - seems okay with different opinions in papers though. Ridiculously hard grader in tests and somewhat cranky on papers. She tells you exactly a text means and leaves little room for other opsions.
She is a nice teacher, but a difficult one. She is very hard to please! You learn in class, but you must be prepared to work a lot!

Overall, a good experience.  Definitely a "breath of fresh air".  Encourages conversation, but balances it out with a decent amount of lecture.  Beware of the student who likes to hear their own voice, as she won't cut them off...

Professor Galvan is intelligent without being condescending, and although she may almost faststidious at times, her meticulousness is actually something most writers could learn from. She is very encouraging in her feedback, but she is also great at identifying weak spots and asking the right questions to help students in solving them.

English departments are plagued with pretentious, boring, unattractive people. Jill Galvan is a breath of fresh air. You can usually gauge how much you have to listen by how close you sit. The discussions can be good if you want, but you can also space out for a couple hours. Be wary of her tendency to linger too long on a stale topic.
No Comments
No Comments

Though her 'pop' quizzes were very predictable, they didn't make up for the fact that she expected a lot out of her students. This isn't a bad thing- however, she is not clear on what she wanted in many of her assignments, and classes tended to be redundan

The toughest grader I've had in awhile, but I learned more in that class than in any other. Writing in the furnace was hot, uncomfortable, and discouraging sometimes, but definitely helped shape my writing to be more coherent, cohesive, and much tighter. Hard class, but my improvement in writing was definitely worth the B.

Mrs. Galvan is really boring, though attractive.  She also isn't very helpful and expects expertise at the end of the ten week term.  She needs to lighten up a touch.  The hotness gets you through the first week and a half, but it's only downhill after that.

She is a very nice person and allows for interesting class discussion, but she is not particularly helpful in the writing process. Even after attending office hours you are not clear what you should be writing.

The hardest grader I've ever had.  She'll make comments on one paper about "what she wants you to focus on in your papers," then on the next paper she'll criticise something completely different and not care about the prior comments.  And expect  no help in her office hours, either.

She was great!  Really let people speak for themselves.  She made a great environment.  She got the most class participation I've seen.  Also, made things very clear.  Semi-hard grader on papers, but not bad.  Very nice, too.
she ruined what could have been a very enjoyable topic. i will avoid any class she teaches from now on.

Yeah she's hot but often difficult to follow.  She has a rapid fire way of teaching with so many different ideas that its hard to figure out what she wants you to take in.  She's often nit-picky and seems to feel a need to reinforce her intellectualism by using as many obscure words as possible.
No Comments
boring, tough grader, yet nice person.
Although she's hot, she has no personality, and has no real interest in helping students.
No Comments

The professor is extremely unorganized. She is a sweet lady but I not sure why she was teaching this course. I did not learn anything which is a shame because I am interested in this topic. Everything is last minute and she is not good with technology. Group projects were given without any rubric or description

Although Professor Surek-Clark is clearly passionate about the subject and a super sweet person, she was not tech savvy at all and it became frustrating over the course of the semester. She would post things extremely last minute and there were so many things that I would see on quizzes that I felt like we never covered.

Clearly a nice person and knows a lot about linguistics but unorganized with class materials, barely gave any info on the exam until the night before, questions on exam are either easy or unnecessarily confusing, hard to get responses via email; not sure why she's teaching an asynchronous/online class but it's not fun

Professor Surek-Clark was a kind woman, and would often joke in class. I found the subject matter interesting, but the class organization was kind of all over the place. She interacts with students a lot, so if you participate she will get to know you.

Clarissa is the sweetest lady! Knows what she's talking about- sometimes rambles and makes you forget what you were supposed to be learning. Her quiz questions can be confusing- but she's super understanding and will change grades within reason. She's a lot of fun and brought treats for us sometimes! Class wasn't hard- just need to pay attention.

She was the sweetest prof ever, but was disorganized and behind on grading. Assignments/directions were unclear, and often posted with little time to complete them before the due date. She would say she would post assignments, study guides, etc, but never post them. I would still take this class, just be ready to be assertive and ask her things.

Clarissa was an incredible professor! She cares so much about every student and shes very flexible. She encourages creativity and her lectures are entertaining and enjoyable! Im tempted to take more linguistics classes because of her. Shes hilarious and wonderful!!You rock Clarissa, I hope someday Matt Damon notices you!!

No rubrics, no guidelines for assignments, went to every class, did every assignment, read every chapter but completely bombed homework assignments. Homework was super hard and often had nothing to do with what we learned in class. Communication was also lacking. Very nice funny lady who knows her stuff but doesnt teach what she knows very clearly

Had him for 3031 and he was great. Very clear grading criteria and assignments were not too bad. A lot of writing assignments but he makes them doable. Overall, kind professor and a non-stressful class.

Amazing professor. Very caring, funny, and easy to talk to. You do have to write a handful of papers and reflections, but the laid-back grading criteria and rubric make up for it. I would retake this class over and over if it were with him.
Easy A. Need lots of writing but clear grading criteria and loose grading. Finishing all assignments will guarantee an A, almost full marks.
Best teacher I have had so far at Ohio State. Super nice, flexible on deadlines, and grades pretty easy on papers. If he does a 2nd year writing I'm definitely taking him.
Eduardo is a great professor. He will aways help you if you need it and give you a lot of extensions if you need it. Would definitely take again.

This class is required for all incoming freshman if you do not have AP credit SO take Professor Mabilog! He is amazing! So respectful and helps you through the entire course. Truly learned a lot from him and enjoyed his course. Just show up and do the work on time and you will have no problems with the class.

Spriggs was an amazing professor all semester. As long as you read the modules the assignments are not difficult and he isn't a tough grader. Majority of the work is group work with a large group project on the end, which isn't hard because it's a compilation of all the work throughout the semester. He truly cares about his students.

Professor Spriggs really wasn't as bad as everyone paints him. I will say I think he could be more clear with what we wants to grade your work on. A lot of the times our group was left clueless but overall the class wasn't hard. You are graded on a semester long project with a group you are assigned. He does care about his students.

He definitely wants you to succeed! I had so much fun in this asynchronous class this semester. Reading and watching a lot of movies is just the nature of the course but the weekly discussion posts were always interesting. There are a few weekly assignments but nothing too extreme. He creates weekly videos but they're sometimes late.

Dr. Spriggs was awesome. I wasn't really that into the class, but he made it bearable because of how helpful and patient he was. Most of the class is group work, and if you get a fun group that actually gets the work done, you will get an A in the class. The material isn't all that difficult, it can just get kind of redundant at times.

Professor Spriggs is a great guy who really cares about his students. His class is almost all group work based upon a semester long project. If you get a group with people who care about the class, then you will have no problem getting a good grade.
Nice, interesting class

poor class theme, strict grading by instructor, far too much work for an intro course. I am displeased to say the least. She expects you to write perfectly cohesive papers as an intro student. Peer reviews suck in my opinion and did not help whatsoever. She also took forever to grade our work because she was busy. AVOID AT ALL COSTS IF POSSIBLE.
The comments she leaves on papers make it so you have to start over. No clear grading criteria.

I LOVE her, she's the best. If you're a science major and already taken the typical bio/chem courses, then this class is a BREEZE. Nonscience majors do good too. it's all basic stuff. ppl had computer difficulty during Midterm 1, so midterm 2 was online, open-note... was amazing. She cares and understands this is a GE course so it's not too hard.

All of the assignments were super doable and very rare. Her lectures were kind of boring, mostly because they are so long. The material seems much harder than it actually is. I thought I was going to need to drop the class but it ended up being my highest grade this semester. She is also helpful if you have a question after class or need to email.

Leslie Newman was fine and this GE course was not too hard, but still a little harder than I expected. I just felt like I had to fall asleep during every lecture they were so boring. The hour and 20 minutes could not go by fast enough.

Professor Newman is a very good professor. She has very good slides, and is engaging with the class, using demonstrations. She is very kind, and we were graded on quizzes, reflections, 3 exams, and a final project. The class is a must take with one of the gen ed requirements, and I would recommend it for anyone who is interested in sciences

Dr. Newman was so good and understanding! Her lectures are entertaining and the tests are fair. Many extra credit opportunity and you can drop your three lowest quizzes although they are all online. Highly recommend taking her class!!

PHR 2420 is a great class taught by Professor Newman. Exams were easy. Quizzes were open note and the final was also open note. Not a tough grader whatsoever. The top 4 quizzes were kept out of the 7 or 8 we did, which was very nice. Had extra credit once that boosted my grade up super high and kept it high all semester. Very chill professor.

Such an amazing professor. She tries her best to make sure the class was prepared for the exams, and would drop a few questions so everyone got a higher grade on the exams. She also drops 2 quizzes. Super easy and interesting class that is great for fulfilling your GE requirement. Take her!!

Dr. Newman is an amazing professor! She truly cares about teaching and her students learning. She is very nice, kind, and inspirational. The course itself is also very informative and interesting. The class itself has little homework, only a few quizzes, and 2 exams that are manageable. Plus, she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities.

My favorite professor so far! She was absolutely amazing, and her addictive drugs course was very interesting and not difficult at all. I would take her course again and recommend everyone to take it. There was little homework throughout the semester, she provides lots of study material, and she even gives multiple extra credit opportunities.

Dr. Newman is an absolutely amazing lecturer. She's able to describe extremely complex information in a simple and understanding way. I highly recommend her Drug Culture and Genetics: Otzi to Ozzy class. I learned so much.

Dr. Newman is by far the best professor I've had at Ohio State so far. She teaches in a simple, yet engaging, way. She makes me look forward to a class at 9:35, which is saying something! She's just a great professor and a great person overall.

Dr. Newman is one of the nicest professors I've ever met! She is super understanding when it comes to workload. PHR 2420 has very little to no homework. The lectures are super informative, interesting, and relevant. Dr. Newman does a great job of promoting learning without stress. Highly recommend this class for the new Historical GE!

Professor Newman is a great professor. Class is interesting even if you have no experience with the topic. Very few homework assignments and tests are open notes. The lectures were very entertaining and easy to follow. Would highly recommend.

I loved Professor Newman. She is very supportive and understanding. She also doesn't assign a lot of homework ever, and when she does it should take 15 minutes max. Her lectures are optional but I highly recommend going because she is a very interesting lecturer and very passionate about her job. Exams are also open note.
She is super nice during and after class. She wants her students to do well. The exams/quizzes are a little confusing but they are open note.

Great professor she is open to help in ways that are accessible and convenient for students. The class is very interesting and she makes it easy to understand. No homework and weekly quizzes but everything is open note. Class was very fun and informative.

Dr. Newman is such an amazing professor. I had her last semester for PHR2400. This time, I took her new class, and I thought the topics were really interesting.The quizzes and exams were a little difficult, but they were open notes. She responds to emails very fast and is very helpful in answering questions.

I took her new class PHR 2420 - Drug Cltr and Genetics, and it was an awesome experience! The information she covered was so interesting and she is incredibly knowledgeable. The test and quizzes are a little hard, but easily managable. Please take this class! You will not regret it!

Dr. Newman is not only a great professor, but an amazing person as well. She is very helpful when you have questions and explains the lectures well. I found the class very interesting and would definitely take another class with Dr. Newman.

Dr. Newman is one of the kindest professors I have ever had. She is always super accommodating, accessible, and knowledgeable about all the topics she teaches. Tests can be difficult but she offers plenty of extra credit.
Such an easy class but it was actually very interesting and useful. Definitely take this even if you aren't a pharmacy major. It was great!
Great class! Shes super nice and helpful. Midterms can be a little difficult but not terrible.

Shes a really kind teacher that gives amazing feedback on writing. Shes always an email away and her online recorded lectures are simple and fun. Take this course if you need a second year writing class.

Super sweet woman! Loved her class. Quizzes were easy and based off material in class. Lectures are interesting and insightful about all kinds of drugs. The big paper is super chill and she is really thoughtful about your grades. Love her! Would take again!

Probably the easiest second writing class you can take at OSU. Dr. Newman does a good job of making the class interesting and fun. I can't think of another class where Snoop Dogg would be quoted. The workload is easy, and if you put any effort into it, you'll get an A. You'll lose points if you skip class too much, especially on presentation days.

Super easy class. One midterm, one presentation and one 5-page paper. Put in minimal effort and you'll get an A. Dr. Newman is really nice and a good presenter, but be prepared to get bored by the material around week 10. Good choice for a second writing course.

Great professor. Cared more about students learning the material than the grades. Very easy class to get an A in as long as you show up for most of the classes. Very willing to work with students to ensure that they get the best grade possible.
She is amazing. If you put in effort, it is an easy A. She is also really interesting to learn from because she is super intelligent.
Dr. Newman is amazing. Class is beyond easy, but I actually learned so much from it.

Easiest writing course I have taken. She is really laid back about everything and our focus was on marijuana. The interesting topic makes the writing assignments very easy and there's maybe one short (1 page) assignment every other week. Then a PowerPoint on a marijuana related topic of your choice, a poster and a 5 page research paper.

This class was SO EASY. A few homework assignments, a research paper due at the end, and a speech. This class is meant for pharmacy majors but anyone can take it. Just turn things in on time and you'll get an A.

Luke is a nice and knowledgeable person however, his organizational skills are lacking. He does not use rubrics and does not effectively communicate what he is looking for in assignments. Quizzes are posted at the last minute and focus on minor details, which makes them challenging to study for.

Of course it is reading heavy, it's an English course. I found heartburn where there were no rubrics for papers and the first few tests we were given minimal guidance for what would be on them and it was detail oriented. Luke is a kind person, just doesn't understand when you don't. Difficulty 4/5 because of the content matter- some hard to follow.

I took Intro to Shakespeare as an online asynchronous course. All of Prof. Wilson's lectures were both high-quality and available in both video form and as written pdfs, and the written versions contained the same information as the videos. For me, this was incredibly helpful and made the lectures much easier to refer back to later. No rubrics tho.

Doesnt seem to like teaching all that much, he wants people to engage in discussion but if no one has anything to say he will pressure the class to talk because in his words its hard teaching all day. If your late for class points will be taken off your grade. the class isnt hard as far as grading goes hes not a harsh grader if you make an effort

He is a good person. Smart. Caring. However, as a class, we had a bad experience. Very little detail when papers came up. No rubric or any idea of what he was looking for. Very few directions as well. His planning skills are just not there. Very heavy reading too (watch out for the sonnets reading). But he worked with us if we had any troubles.

Prof Wilson wasn't all that bad. He taught well and was very knowledgable. We had 4 quizzes, 3 small papers, and 2 larger papers. Not a really tough grader- but I feel he only thinks of "one" way that the plays go. He's not entirely open to interpretations that aren't parallel with his. He WANTS to know what you think- but sometimes shuts you down.
Great and engaging lecturer. Participation is totally voluntary and not graded, but he'll make you feel bad if you don't say anything. He'll really get you to think.

Professor Wilson is a great professor. His class can be very difficult if you don't read the plays and listen to the lectures. If you do both of those things you will pass and the class will be very easy.

Professor Wilson was a great Shakespeare professor. His classes were asynchronous so we were able to watch his lectures and recordings, instead of attending class. You do need to listen to the lectures in order to do well on the weekly quizzes. There are 3 papers in this class as well on top of the weekly homework, discussion boards and quizzes.

Prof Wilson was great! I learned a lot about Shakespeare from him, Id love to have him again. He brings up a lot of very interesting information in lectures. Hes a chill guy, and he gave me extra time for assignments when I needed it. Highly recommended!
Dont take this course if you are not crazy about learning British Literature. Online midterm and quiz are really difficult.

DON'T take this professor. He never tests you on the required reading material, he mostly tests you on his opinions. for example, "which of these is MORE right in MY opinion?" The midterm was online and many people still failed it. I will most likely be ending with a B, but barely. Many of my friends are looking at C's or below.

Dr. Luke Wilson is inarguably, undoubtedly the best professor I've ever had.  Although he may be a little hard to crack--as he can come off  a bit like a jerk--he is actually very concerned with what YOU think. He doesn't like it when you just stare & blink at him--be prepared to say something. But he does care a lot about the material & YOU.
Probably one of the worst professors I ever had. Makes things way more difficult than they need to be. Avoid this prof if you can
One of the best teachers I have ever taken a class with. Really knows the material he is teaching. Makes lectures/discussions engaging and interesting.

You've gotta really love Shakespeare to take his Shakespeare course. I thought I did, but I was mistaken. Thus, I was bored for a good portion of classes. It's a lot of reading, but you can skimp on it since he doesn't call on anyone randomly. The class is discussion-based, and those who talk a lot will get credit for it in the final grading.

Professor Luke Wilson has been my favorite at OSU thus far. He is helpful, fair, understanding, and very funny. I learned a lot from his class & enjoyed everything along the way. He brings the text to life & is amazing at leading discussion. He actually made me feel GOOD about my work and discussion comments. I liked the positive reinforcement.

He's super nice and, unlike what others say on here, i could write an essay in less than two hours and get an A on it. Also, even though attendance is mandatory, if you have a good reason for missing (even if it is mental health not just physical) he's cool with you missing and won't dock you points you just have to let him know.

This course wasn't all that hard. He is more than willing to help you understand some of the difficult material. I managed to get an A with a fair amount of effort. His grading is fair and not as tough as others on here say.

Honestly, he's a nice person but he bored the crap outta me by the lectures! You only have 1 essay but still..I never got that back! If your up for reading 200 pages in 2 days then be by guest..but I would take another Shakespeare class with another professor

He's tricky. Seems easy at first, but his grading will own you (unless you're used to a 94 being the lowest possible A). However, he's knowledgeable and not too bad to listen to - you'll acquire a lot of working knowledge about the subject matter, which is a helpful thing to have if you're an English major.

Dr. Wilson's class is far from easy, but it's extremely infomative. I went into his class knowing very little about the 17th century, but came out quite knowledgeable. I highly recommend this class, but only if you're ready for a tough prof.

He knows what he's talking about, but like a lot of English professors, he's terribly disorganized and quite pompous.  As far as grading goes, expect a B on pretty much everything.    Definitely not the best Shakespeare/Elizabethan prof the English department has to offer.  Take some classes from Highley instead.

Really interesting, high energy guy.  Prof. Wilson kept the conversation in class interesting and overall is a good teacher; however, he is a really hard grader.  I could not get higher than a B+ on anything - it made me wonder what qualified as an A paper.  If you like shakespeare even a little, you will like this class.

Very knowledgeable person - but REALLY tough grading.Was difficult to figure out what he wanted.Very challenging essay prompts but I learned a lot. Participation not required-but he'll bump you up half a letter grade if you contribute.Emphasizes form and content,and is interested in your initial comments about a piece, so just elaborate on those.
Dr. Cariello was great!
Dr. Cariello was a great Professsor! I enjoyed being in his class.

Dr. Cariello is so funny, and he cares about the content. He is super casual, but in a good way. There was a lot of reading, but it was usually classic novels like Catcher in the Rye, so it was enjoyable. Take his classes.

Absolutely loved English 1110 with Dr. Cariello! Funny and caring teacher, always willing to work with student's circumstances. A good portion of the work was take-home but he always gave us opportunities to revise. 10/10 would recommend!

For context, I took 1110, the easiest English class at the university (for GE) because I hate English classes. Dr. Cariello treated it as he should have, as an easy GE. There was little work outside of the main essays, and as long as you don't completely disregard the class you should get an A. I absolutely recommend him for a fun and easy GE.
Super easy with almost zero work outside class. 60% of the grade is with two take-home essay exams, the rest is completion/attendance. Funny guy, would 100% recommend for any gen eds.
interesting readings, very nice & caring professor.

Dr. Cariello is the best professor I've had at Ohio State to date. He is hilarious, relatable, and makes lectures interactive. He is approachable when you have questions or need feedback on assignments. Dr. Cariello tells you what you need to know and has clear criteria for assignments. He is an amazing human being and anyone is lucky to have him!

I loved this class because of the professor, and we barely had any work. We had to write 250 word reader responses every week, but those were very easy. We only wrote two papers all semester, and the only book we had to read was Catcher in the Rye.

Matt is a really good professor and I 100% recommend him for English 1110.02. He is very nice and even funny and he gives you lots of feedback and plenty of time to revise the main projects/paper. Attendance is taken but not included in your grade.

Dr. Cariello is great! I took his English 1110.02. We focused on one novel, A Lesson Before Dying. Most of our work in the class revolved around that. We read the book and did an essay and presentation on it.The work was pretty easy and he's a professor that wants his students to succeed (pretty easy grader if you actually try on the assignments).

Loved Mr. Cariello. The class was very chill and he made lectures very interesting. We only had three essays to write and one group project---all of which were very easy. He gives very good feedback on your essays and is always accommodating/lenient with deadlines.

Matt was honestly my favorite professor last semester. We spent the whole time reading a book (theres a free pdf version online) and only had 3 major projects that werent too difficult. Hes great at giving feedback and telling you what he wants to hear. Overall, fun professor and a fun class.
Professor Cariello is a chill and funny teacher who truly cares for his students. There were few assignments, and was willing to provide good feedback if you ask.
Dr. Cariello does a great job of keeping lectures interesting and being flexible with due dates. Just a few longer writing assignments and plenty of opportunities to get feedback.

Very Understanding Prof who cares about his students and does his best at giving ample time to turn in assignments. Allows for assignments to be turned in after due date and is willing to work with you individually.

Cariello is honestly a great guy- every semester I look to take a class from him. Overall fun, and engaging lectures- but occasionally they can feel dry. He really cares about the students and English. He has very few grades; going to class, and three exams.

One of my best professors at OSU. I am an engineering major and I always looked forward to going to class because I knew it would be interesting and fun. One of the funniest and most thoughtful people I have met. Class is not hard, just listen and take your time on the essays and you'll do fine.

He assigned 3 readings and 3 take home exams the whole semester. During the class you do have to actively participate and sign into the attendance. His lectures were very easy though. The 3 exams had options where you could use what the books were about or had other options so you didn't have to read if you don't want to. Highly recommend!
Phenomenal teacher and person. Hardly any work, easy A, and every lecture is informative, entertaining and all around fun. He's truly an excellent teacher.

Matt is the nicest prof I have ever had. He is so accommodating and flexible. Grade was determined by attendance and 3(ish) papers, tho you just had to write a max f 14pgs through the whole semester, so you could choose which papers to write if you wanted to write long ones. Nothing had a due date. He emailed me to ask where I was once. Love him.

C. Had an injury during the semester I had him that disrupted the class schedule, but the class still proceeded smoothly. He is an easy grader, (as long as you turn something in) but I still learned a lot about the class subject (prespectives on education).

Dr. Cariello really cares about the material he is teaching. He is one of the most understanding and flexible profs I've ever worked with (as long as you communicate well with him). Definitely recommend this course!

Prof Cariello is super chill and nice. He works around your schedule if you ever have anything conflicting with class/exams. There are only 3 exams and they are all take home prompts that you get the whole weekend to finish. Exams are super easy, and he prepares you really well for them. You also have to buy like 3 novels but no textbooks.

Professor Cariello is a such a funny and caring guy; he really just wants you to develop your skills rather than grades. Very easy GE; just three papers for the whole class. Would definitely recommend

He's really nice. He cares more about your future and you succeeding and growing as a person, than giving you a bad grade. Would take again. I suggest Intro to Poetry with Cariello for anyone who needs that GE. You will find that he will make you appreciate poetry. Great teacher, inspirational class.

BEST PROF EVER HAD took as an easy Lit GE and literally all you have to do is go to class thats what he grades on is attendance did all my hard class' homeworks in this class EASIEST A YOU'LL EVER GET!!!!!

Class is super easy! I hardly showed up to class and got an A and I was a graduating senior majoring in business, that should tell you something. No due dates which is kind of nice. Only thing he grades are exams which are take home. You have to create poems through out the semester as well but he grades them for completion. TAKE HIM FOR EASY GRADE

Dr. Cariello was the chillest professor ever. He is SO smart and knowledgable, and so funny and relatable. No exams, just take home papers for exams and a creative writing assignment. He is a tough grader though

By far the best class ever. We wrote one essay in 1110.02H. Our theme for this fiction writing course was adaptation of fiction into film. He was more concerned we learned how to write better so he graded on improvement from rough draft to final paper. We also made a movie at the end as a class by adapting a short story to film of our own creation

I really enjoyed Intro to Poetry. There were poems you were assigned to read before class, but you didn't have to read it. The lectures were laid back as you discussed various poems. The exams were take home papers analyzing a poem that were assigned on a Friday then due by Sunday night. However, he wasn't strict at all about deadlines.

Matt is a great guy. Intro to Fiction is an easy Lit Gen-Ed without a lot of work. Short readings to do before class which are discussed with him or in small groups. Grades are three essays which serve as exams  and a creative writing assignment. The assignments are not difficult but require you to think critically and read deeper into the stories.

What a guy! He funny especially around election time. This class was great, a ton of fun, he makes you want to come to class. The short stories he assigns are fun and easy reads. He's an easy grader but you'll be interested in what you write about.

Matt is an awesome professor! He's totally willing to help students if they ask for help. The class was really easy and he told everyone that if they put the work in, they'd get a good grade. There was only two short assignments, one essay, and one group project all semester, so take this class if you're looking for a stress-free GE.

Prof. Cariello is a great lecturer; he has insight into many different realms of literature, much of which is incorporated through the breadth of the course. His sense of humor is very college-appropriate, and I appreciated his incorporation of his own short stories into the curriculum. Essays are easy with very relaxed formatting. Easy and fun!

TAKE INTRO TO POETRY. Easiest credit of my life. He's such a nice guy too, really cares about the subject matter which makes you sorta care too. No homework or reading required. Great class, plus he's hilarious.
Genuinely interested in having his students learn and is just really easy going. He has fun with his students and is really funny.

Okay so he has no due dates. Ever. Which is kind of confusing for a lot of people but once you get used to his style of teaching, the class is a breeze. He will teach you to write papers the way he likes them and if you can pick that up then you'll do great.
One of my favorite professors at the university. His class was very interesting and fun, and he's hilarious.
Great professor. Gives good feedback. Won't let you fail if you try.
A great teacher and a really cool person.
Awesome proffesor. Helpful. Really hot. Nice beret.

He was awesome, really understanding of other time commitments (turned in my first midterm a couple days late with no reduction in grade), and chose mostly interesting stories. Two midterms and a final, 3-4 pages double spaced, and a 2 page creative writing assignment which I enjoyed. Would recommend.

My favorite professor! Actually taking another of his classes this semester.  Incredibly intelligent and relaxed. He always has interesting ideas and insights into the literature we read. If you need a lot of structure, though, this is not the professor for you.

One of the best teacher's I've ever had. His goal is for you to get an A.  He won't just hand that out, but he'll let you rewrite essays until you achieve the A grade. Great teacher. Great guy. Would DEFINITELY take a class of his again.

Incredibly knowledgeable guy.Happy to help outside of class, and lets you rewrite until you get an A. Very flexible with everything, very personable and friendly. Happy to talk with students. I'm about to take my third class with him. Highly recommended.

I love creative writing, but his class made me start thinking of it as hard classwork to get through. The prompts that he gives us can be a bit uninspiring. He doesn't follow the syllabus at all and is disorganized. If you want an easy A, take his class. But if you want something with a bit more structure, look for something else.

Technically 367.03. This class had never been taught before Professor Cariello stepped up to the challenge, but as a result, it was incredibly disorganized. I feel like I learned a lot, but at the same time, the final goals kept changing throughout the quarter. It needs more structure; hopefully Professor Cariello can provide that in the future.

Easy A. The assignments are basically completion points and only include reader responses to classmate work and 4000 words of creative writing by the end of the class period. Cariello is fantastic at facilitating class discussion. I feel that I have become a more detail-oriented reader and writer as a result of his teachings.
One of the best English teachers I have ever had! Very relaxed, very chill, but very knowledgable. His classes are really easy and he grades extremely fair.
Great class!
Relaxed, intelligent and an overall good guy. One of the best English teachers I've ever had. I strongly suggest taking as many of his classes as possible.
Very relaxed teacher. He'd assign essays and wouldn't really care if you turned them in late. Very open to class discussion, and overall nice guy/good teacher.
He gets a pepper for putting up with some horrendously boring stories. Also, willing to help outside of class.

One of the most boring teachers I've ever had in an English class. There was little class discussion. Most of it was him reading papers other academics wrote. Once for 45 minutes straight. Seems like he teachers from a script. Nice guy, but wouldn't take another class with him.

he has and amazing amount of knowledge about j.d. salinger....the class got a little out of hand at times almost nonsensical.....however it was entertaining and the final project wa prett sweet i learned so much
He was okay, but if you have another option for the same class, you'll probably learn more by not taking his. He is a good writer, but not a great teacher.

If you have a choice between 2 sections of the same class and he's teaching one of them, pick his section. He's funny, intelligent, and relaxed about deadlines, but expects a good level of competency.

Extremely helpful teacher.  Very understanding of issues I was having.  If you're looking for an intro to English he's a good prof to have because he's trying to get some of his stuff published.  Good to talk to if you want a career in English.
No Comments
Good guy. Readings he picked were pretty good. He was pretty convinced that no one could be as smart as he is. He also gave me**** for being in honors.
Great teacher, though I wish he had more control in keeping some order when everyone starts talking.  Other than that, he's a great teacher, wish I could schedule more classes under him.

Good prof, really knows his stuff, great sense of humour.  No complaints with this guy that couldn't better be directed at The Fates or God: things like assignment timing and workshop scheduling issues.
Most of the in-class assignments were fine and helpful, though his organization was poor.  Of three papers due in the quarter, two were due in the last two weeks.  A nice guy though.

This guy is smart and professional but defintely your average english teacher.  My only complaints are that he only gives about 24 hours from the time the assignments are handed out and the time that they are due, and he also fails to return papers.
Wonderful teacher, nice guy, I learned a lot from him!

Shaun was a great professor. The class consisted of a good amount of readings and quizzes that went along with most of the readings. Quizzes were ok, you just have to make sure you pay attention when reading. Shaun really cares about his students and made an effort to answer your questions/concerns as soon as possible! Would love to have him again!

He's very nice, but a bulk of the grade is made up of three papers and the feedback he gives is just criticism, did not feel constructive at all. Considering the class was filled with non English majors, his nit picking of our essays just felt unnecessary.
Dr. Russell is awesome! He is a hilarious and caring professor, he really makes an effort to get to know his students and gives great feedback.

Dr. Russell is an amazing teacher! I had him for a in-person 1 hr freshman seminar course called Music and Social Justice. The class was very easy and fun-just a simple weekly discussion board post, one presentation, and one final paper. He's very funny, grades leniently, and really tries to get to know his students. 100% recommend.
Great professor. You always know exactly what is expected of you. If you go to class and submit quality work on time, you will get an A.
He was a really cool professor and it was an easy class as well. There is a decent amount of reading, but you only really need a basic understanding of the stories to get a good grade.

Dr. Russell is an incredibly nice and charismatic professor. There are a lot of readings and quizzes, but if you do the reading you will do well. Just make sure to attend class and at least skim the readings and it should be a pretty easy and fun course!
This class is an easy A if you actually do the readings and read the assignment sheets. He is a fair grader and a good teacher. I definitely recommend taking his class!

Dr. Russell is a genuinely good person, and very caring for his students. Throughout the semester I could always reach him through his email very easily, and the assignments were very fairly graded. I never felt that my marks on a given paper were unexplained. He is very lenient with attendance, and his class was overall very enjoyable.

For this course, DO THE READINGS! At first, quizzes will be difficult. But, you will learn what he wants you to pick up from the poems and certain information. We wrote 2 papers for this class and both were easy and good feedback was given. The midterm will be stressful, but just make sure you study.
Dr Russell was amazing, and certianly my favorite professor I've had at OSU. He's a very caring person and far-beyond helpful when it comes to feedback with papers. Highly recommend to everyone.

A great professor always came to class excited to teach and made the class very enjoyable. He is also passionate about his job and it shows in how he treats his students. He is always willing to work with you and makes the class easy
A genuinely good professor who clearly wants all of his students to succeed. All of the assignments are outlined very well during the class times, but it can be quite repetitive during the lectures.
If you pay attention in class and look at the assignment sheets it's hard to go wrong.
The only professor that I have had that genuinely cares about his students and their mental health. Not a very difficult class. Amazing professor

Russell is hard without any reason to be. His comments appear to be focused on things that ultimately don't make a difference to the paper at large. There's nothing valuable I learned from the class and I'd recommend skipping this professor if given the chance.

I liked him personally but he graded a lot of my papers pretty harshly all things considered and I know for a fact I am a good writer. All that did was make me spend much more time perfecting my work. It did not transform my writing at all. And this class did not change my writing. Nonetheless I didn't really mind him.

so chill. so easy. one group project but it was fine. two other long projects as well. communicates well. module discussions were graded easy as well as the writing projects. clear rubric. overall really nice guy and easy class

Took this class for a foundations credit, but I actually really enjoyed it! He was super flexible around finals and really good at guiding class discussions and projects. Plenty of work days, so other than some readings there isn't much to do outside of class.
Genuinely learned a lot from this class about disability studies. Very caring and helped when needed.
Loved Prof. Temple! Her class was so fun and allowed students to apply their own experiences and interests in gaming to their work. Would 10/10 recommend this course!

very easy and interesting! It was about horror media. The reading was split into two (pages 1-50, pages 51-100) and then lecture 1 would be based off the first half, lecture 2 on the second, and then 1 quiz at the end of the week. If you're paying attention, you'll no good! He also tells you how to get the books and where to watch the movies free

Dr. Garcha was easily one of the best professors I have had at OSU. I had already read a majority of the books we were required to read prior to taking the course, but I was still able to learn new things about them, especially since his lectures were so fun. He is truly passionate about what he does and cares about your well-being.

He is the best English professor I've had. His lectures are engaging, funny, and insightful. He gives great feedback and is very understanding with attendance. I looked forward to his class every day!

Garcha is an angel. Easily the best English prof I've had. Lectures are great (I learned SO MUCH about both the texts and their historical context), quizzes and exams are reasonable, and grading is very fair. He genuinely cares about students & LOVES what he teaches. Take his class if you can! I loved it so much I didn't want it to end.

He's a great guy, and his class if pretty easy if you show up for lecture. You can get away without reading a decent portion of the material, since he goes over the basics of it and what you'll need to know about it for tests in class. He doesn't put his slides up on Carmen, so better make friends in class if you miss. Also attendance is mandatory.

Professor was fine; it was the class itself and the structure that sucked. I went in thinking we would be reading at least somewhat enjoyable texts like Wuthering Heights, 1984, Sherlock Holmes stories, etc. but it ended up being 90% really dry poetry. Lectures were boring an repetitive. Though it was an easy A if you show up and do the work.

Prof. Garcha is great! Very enthusiastic about what he teaches and is funny. Attendance is mandatory, only allowing 4 absences, so SHOW UP! Grade includes 4 quizzes (30%), a midterm and a final(55%), and participation. Show up, take notes, do the reading and study for the quizzes/ tests and you will get an A. Dont buy books- all can be found online

Prof Garcha is awesome. Very easy going and hilarious. British Poetry is, let's face it, boring. He made it fun and interesting. He tells you what you need to know, and if you're creative enough to go beyond that A's should be no problem. He is however a bit of a grammar Nazi.

Garcha has a great bubbly personality, and he's clearly interested in what he teaches. Brit Lit usually isn't my thing, but he made it pretty interesting. Go to class and learn his viewpoints, then regurgitate them later. Easy! You'll do especially well in this class if you like/are good at writing, because tests & quizzes are always short answer.
He was really clear about the material and helped me think about the readings and analysis in a whole new way.
I finally got to read twilight in his class! I love Princess Leia! It was so fun!!
In this class, you have to read TWILIGHT.  :(
One of the best english profs I have ever had, ever. :)
Loved his class, absolutely amazing teaching. Really knew the course material, and cared eenough about it to make me care too.
One of the best teachers i have ever had the chance of having.

Texts and lectures were both very interesting. Garcha is a cool guy who takes his time grading the minimal papers he assigns, giving tons of helpful tips even if it's an A paper. Despite the small workload I felt like I learned a ton. If you do the reading, show up to class and do half decent papers you should get an A.

Very fair grader - he gave constructive criticism on writing assignments, but didn't take a lot away from the grade. Quizzes are easy if you do the reading. Lectures seemed a little long at times, but also sometimes funny. He doesn't take himself too seriously and lets the class out a few minutes early. Overall, I'd recommend taking his classes.

I'm so surprised at the negative comments.  Garcha was the best I had at OSU. Finding an English prof (from columbia mind you) who is down to earth, funny, and intelligent is a rare find. Exams were fair, no surprises or tricks. Same with papers. You have no one to blame but yourself for not doing well in his class.

If you are familiar with the time period, don't take this class.  He never strays from his set ideas, to the point of the class being boring.  He attempts to win over the class by making joking comments criticizing himself and the time period.  By far the worst professor I had.

If you like to get points for small things like attendance, want most of lecture to be the lecturer up at the board reciting his ideas and not too much reading, then he's for you. I didn't particularly like him; I thought his ideas jumped all over the place and it was hard to grasp a single concept about what he was teaching.

What is funny is that some of the negative reviews are true--Garcha likes to hear himself talk, he likes his own ideas and he has specific rules that he expects to be followed.  Get over it.  All in all, he's an interesting lecturer, helpful with assignments and expects good work from his students.  He also doesn't assign much reading which is grea

Don't listen to other recommendations. Has illegible writing, his lectures are a mess of incomprehensible and unconnected ideas. He is sensitive to everything--no tardiness, participation, and loves to hear himself talk. Doesn't really offer help or give feedback before new assignments. Self-Involved. Has favorites in the class.

Given the course description, I was a wee bit nervous.  Prof Garcha is actually very down to earth and takes an interesting approach to the material.  He wants to see his class succeed.  Extremely recommended :)
Extremely Helpful!
he is one of the best teachers in the english department. funny as hell and he will keep your attention and make whatever he teaches interesting
He is extremely engaging and down-to-earth.   Good sense of humor.
Fantastic! Second time I had him and I took this class just because he was teaching!
Absolutely the best professor this school has to offer.  He's smart, interesting, interested, extremely helpful and has a great personality. I can't recommend Garcha enough.

Awesome prof! Always dressed well (which deviates from the typical stuffy college prof stereotype). His lectures were always fun. He is a def one of the best profs I have had and makes the material interesting. He is also very thorough grading papers so you really get good feedback (and he's nice when it comes to the final grade). TAKE HIS CLASS!
Don't question him in anyway and you'll be fine
One of the best profs I've had.  Conveys ideas really clearly but he's also open to students' ideas, and gives good feedback on papers.  Great sense of humor.

He is a great guy that obviously cares a lot about his teaching. He assigned 4 interesting novels and we had a total of 3 short papers, so the workload wasn't too much. His sense of humor and quirkiness made class rather entertaining. Definitely would take another class from him.
He is one of the best english prof's i've had. he is very knowledgable and has a great personality/sense of humor. The class was easy if you attend regularly and take notes.

I would strongly advise all incoming graduate students / aspiring majors to take his class. He actually identified problems with my writing, and was extremely forthcoming. Unlike everyone else who'd saddle you with unmanageable reading load, he will cover limited material, but do so very meticulously. I sure hope he becomes a full professor

you can tell he really cares about his teaching and his students, and he's not full of himself like other clever (and not so clever) professors.  also he dresses very well.  (emphasis on recitation attendance was disporportionate to its value--draconian policy for missing even one recitation)

I really do like professor garcha himself; his sense of humor and easy going nature is amazing. however, mod brit lit he teaches became very dry after the 5th or 6th week.Lot of readings focused on feminism or related subjects. Take Prof. Garcha, just be happy and aware of what he is teaching

One of the best classes I've taken -- in fact, I miss it.  I actually looked forward to every class for the sheer entertainment value of it...Prof. Garcha has a fantastic sense of humor.  Take the class!
Smart feller

One of the best teachers I've taken; He made victorian poetry interesting and funny; great sense of humor and very clear at explaining difficult and boring poems; I would highly suggest anyone taking his class, even if you're not into english

I liked him although not really the British Literature he teaches.  He is really funny at times and I enjoyed his far out explainations of poetry.  I don't think he liked me too much though because I did miss a lot of class (typical in a topic I'm not too interested in).  It was nothing personal Professor Garcha!  Still, thanks for the B.
he's a very good professor,  he makes really funny jokes and he's very down to earth. i'd recommend him to others.

This guy was awesome, very down to earth and hilarious.  Also incredibly psychological about the literature and it was so interesting.  He didn't really lecture, we got to discuss a lot of interesting stuff.  Also there were no exams, just 3 papers and 3 EASY quizzes. TAKE HIM!
