Prof. Garcha is my advisor and I've taken three classes with him.  I've found him to be funny, entertaining, and always willing to help. He grades fairly strictly but is always fair - meaning the grade you get is the grade you deserve.  He's one of the best profs. I've had at OSU.
he's awesome and is actually really funny
Great professor.  He made funny jokes to break awkward silences during class which was highly entertaining.  He really knows what he's talking about and it shows.
DUDE WAS PRETTY COOL AND ACTUALLY MADE OLD DEAD BRITS WHO WROTE ABOUT BORING STUFF SEEM INTERESTING
Entertaining and funny
No Comments
No Comments
He's a funny guy, I enjoyed his class.  He grades a little strictly, but that's no reason not to take his class.
No Comments
Really cool young professor! Very funny and made class interesting.

The class is highly organized,with approximately 3-4 quizzes per week and 3 tests,one of which can be dropped.Each quiz corresponds to an episode, accompanied by a lecture that thoroughly explains the material, as well as a non-graded homework assignment. Watching the lectures is essential for understanding the material and succeeding in the class.

By far the easiest A of my entire college career. I watched like two of the lectures and still came away with an easy A. Don't have much to say other than that. For me this won't be a super memorable class but if you just want an easy A this class is for you.

Participation is *heavy mandatory* in this class, which is fine as long as you don't have SLDS accommodations which she will do her best to avoid accommodating, and be virtually unreachable. The class itself is participation heavy with a lot of reading. I mean, a lot. I had to take it for my major, or else I would have dropped it.

Tried very hard to persist through this class with the benefit of the doubt. Mostly a discussion class, did not feel like a safe environment to spitball ideas (shuts down people harshly when had to participate). Though the content was good, it was an aggressive style of teaching with extremely harsh grading. Class started at 27, ended at 9 people.

Prof Renker was very knowledgeable and passionate. This class was difficult and had a LOT of reading, it was manageable as long as you don't procrastinate. You take one quiz each week based off readings. She gives a choice between an exam or paper for both the midterm and final, and listened to our feedback about too much reading and cut back.

Renker's class is all about participation and an in-depth study of Game of Thrones. There is daily quizzes which are super easy if you do the homework, and the exams are an easy 100% if you attend lecture and pay attention. She counts participation in class so be ready to raise your hand. An excellent professor and I enjoyed it!

You will not regret taking Professor Renker's class. You have to participate in everyday in class, and I know that sounds very scary, but you will actually want to participate! It is a lot of fun! All the classmates get involved and it's really interesting to hear everyones opinion on things and you don't want to miss out! She makes it very fun!

VERY attendance-heavy class, so be prepared to go, but Professor Renker is so amazing. The material was already interesting, but she teaches close reading in a way that makes it so much more engaging. She really challenges you to dig deeper into the material. I'll be taking another class with her next semester!

Took for my Literature gen ed, and was one of the funnest classes I've ever had. The most painless way of getting this, and you get to watch Game of Thrones. The only reason I didn't get an A was that I just forgot a couple of daily quizzes. The quizzes and tests are ripped straight from lectures/discussions. Good energy and fun community in class.

I took her class on Game of Thrones. Great class! If you show up and attempt to learn, you will get an easy A and actually learn a lot. Exams test exactly what we did over class, so you have to be active in class, but as long as you are, the class is enjoyable, easy, and you'll learn a lot

Professor Renker is amazing. I took her Game of Thrones class and it was one of the most fun classes I've ever taken. Don't get me wrong- it's not an easy A. But, Renker is extremely clear in telling you what you have to do to succeed and giving you all the tools you need to be successful. One of the most thoughtful teachers I've ever had.

Shes awesome! I have her for Intro to Fiction (ONLINE) game of thrones class because of COVID. Asks us our opinion on how exams should be structured. Make sure you are attentive in class !! and doing homework questions with transcripts, easy quizzes if you do so. Very clear on what to expect on exams. Very cool and informative. HW not hard.

She was great! Had her for the Game of Thrones class and it was a blast! She pulls so much meaning and depth from the show, is a fair but not overly easy grader, and she will push you to deeper analysis. She is also big about participation (If you have a chance take this class!!!!)

I am taking Elizabeth Renker's Intro to Fiction, on the show Game of Thrones for my GE lit credit, and the class is a delight. For homework, you just watch an episode before each class and answer 5 questions. Then in class, you are quizzed on the homework questions for credit. Just pay attention, watch the episodes, and show up, there are 2 exams.
Very tough grader but has helped me a lot with my writing and analyzing of Tv shows

She grades tough to push your writing but she is also willing to help you. For the midterm and the final, we could choose between a test and a paper. She is clever, receptive of students' input, and she is genuinely concerned with your success after her class. I am definitely better of for having had her as a professor.

She is  specific in what she wants and how she wants you to write. She says if you meet with her in her office she will help, but after doing that I still received B's and C's on assignments. If your style of writing is different than hers, you will not pass. After 4 years with an A in every English Class, I am disappointed in her teaching.

Prof. Renker will push you harder than you've ever been pushed before, and you will be a better reader and writer at the end of it. She sees the potential in her students and does everything she can to draw it out. You'll only be unhappy with your grade if you don't give her your all.
In a large lecture, Renker is able to individualize almost every student.  Her lectures are entertaining and the exams are fairly easy if you go to class and pay attention.

Elizabeth is a great teacher and an authority on the subject. She is very clear, concise, and to the point. The class is easy if you show up, take notes, participate, do the reading, and study. There's no surprises and the subject matter is actually very interesting.

She's absolutely brilliant. She knows her stuff, but presents it in ways that make sense to her students. Works with students to make sure they understand, and won't move on until they do. She tells you EXACTLY what to expect for exams, so everyone does very well. She helps you do very well in class, but I also actually feel like I'm learning!

Dr. Renker's classes are very difficult, but if you use her as a resource, she will transform you as a student. The time I spent in her office made me a vastly better writer and critical reader. I gained more from her class than from all of the rest of college together.

I took this class as a Maymester class, so we only met for a total of 33 hours and I fell in love with her. Not just her as the intelligent, invested English professor, but also with the class: Alternative Music and Poetry. I've never been so excited to do homework in my life. Her and I still correspond regularly. It's not easy but it's worth it!

Professor Renker is smart, witty, and for those of you who can't keep your hats on, her course(s) aren't for you. She's by far one of the most passionate and knowledgeable faculty in the OSU English department, and will challenge your critical and analytical skills. Her honors seminar was challenging and hands-on, especially for grad school prep.

Renker is hands down my favorite professor. She is beyond passionate about the material. She managed to captivate a lecture hall of 100+ people on a weekly basis. Her teaching style demands you really focus on the reading and do some critical thinking. Now I can't help close-read everything I read/watch. Take Renker if you actually want to learn.
She seems intimidating at first, but she is very helpful, and truly wants students to succeed.  With that said, she is a tough grader, and expects you to try, not just slide by.

Took in SP '11; Renker is a little intimidating and sometimes a little too vain in her ability, but she's an excellent professor. My writing definitely improved because of her, and she's brutally honest, which some may see as negative, but it honestly helps. She's also got a pretty good sense of humor, which is fun. A little tougher but worth it.

I had Elizabeth for an undergraduate 19th century honors research course. The course and the professor seemed intimidating at first, but Elizabeth is very helpful, incredibly intelligent and passionate. Admittedly she is a tough grader but she is more than willing to help students who ask and put in effort and she improved my writing drastically.

Prof. Renker's class on Moby-D allows English majors to dive deeply into Melville's famous novel without feeling overwhelmed. Her enthusiasm, approachability, and vast knowledge of the text make her a remarkable professor who brings out the best in all of her students. Take her class and be prepared to grow immensely as a reader and writer.

Professor Renker is the toughest grader I have ever had. You only have three papers to write, and two of them can be revised and the grades averaged.  Sounds good, right? Only if you have no other classes, are ready to have your papers reduced to nothing, and your soul crushed. If time and GPA matter, don't take her.  If they don't, by all means.

Easily one of my favorite professors at OSU and probably the best eng teacher i've had.  Challenges you to think on your feet, but doesn't have a touch of condescendence one usually finds with professors this intelligent.  She is genuinely interested helping students learn and helped me become a significantly better writer.  Go to her office hours!
The readings were a little dry, but we got to do daily quizzes to keep our grades up. She is a very tough grader, but there are only three papers. Fairly easy class.

One of the more challenging English teachers I've had, but in a good way. It is possible to do well in this class, but you have to work for it.  Do the readings for each class, and participate in class discussion.  For the papers, you are allowed to turn in revisions, and Prof. Renker will give you great feedback to make this process easier.

Professor Renker will challenge everything you ever thought you knew about writing. I can honestly say I have learned the most about how to improve my writing style from this class. And as the others have said, GO TO OFFICE HOURS! Take her class, if your're willing to work. You won't regret it, and you will learn a lot for this intelligent woman.

One of the most constructive classroom experiences I have had at OSU to date. Renker skillfully weaves class discussions (that include ALL of her students) to synthesize both her expertise and our understanding into vastly effective instruction. She also allowed us to use online versions of texts to save $, which I seriously appreciated. MUST TAKE!

Professor Renker challenges her students to reach beyond their academic comfort zones and become "detectives" in research.  Her clarity of communication, breadth of knowledge, and sincere interest in teaching make her an extraordinary professor.  Absolutely take advantage of her office hours and contribute in class discussion.
This class was the hardest and most rewarding class I have taken at OSU.  Make sure you speak up in class (she is very willing to listen to suggestions) and GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS!

Take this class! I took her Indie music & poetry and I didn't miss a class. She's one of my favorite teachers so far. She gives great feedback on papers and they aren't that difficult. The final project was a great idea! She really listens to any recommendations from students as well.

Professor Renker is amazing.  She was extremely willing to meet me outside of office hours each week to help me with my papers.  Here I am, a senior, and I finally know how to write a paper the proper way.  I was intimidated by her at first but she won't embarrass you at all like other professors.  Go to her office hours and talk with her!
Dr. Renker is a really great professor!!! She expects a lot, but is willing to help. I learned a lot from her about being a better writer and literary thinker. I would recommend taking her class!!

Take this class. Not because it's easy - not the case - but if you're truly interested in learning about poetry. Renker will help you write better academically while still allowing you to be creative and have a voice of your own in your papers. I worked harder & did better in all of my classes because of her fantastic criticisms.

Best professor I have had at Ohio State. I have never learned more in a class than with Renker. She is difficult and expects a lot, but the she is an excellent teacher and by the end I was writing better and understanding poetry/etc. One word: Incredible.

This was the only way I was ever going to make it thru Moby-****. She is a Melville scholar and knows her stuff. Such an interesting class. Quizzes each class definitely helped me keep reading. She is absolutely incredible. Take any class that she offers, you won't be sorry. She's the bomb!

She is what I always expected college professors to be like. She demands your attention and makes it crystal clear what is expected of you in her class. She will help you in any way she can; will make appts outside of office hours. Awesome professor. She will teach you how to write college papers the correct way.

Prof. Renker will definitely challenge you. She demands that her students be engaged in the class, and the class is better for it.  If you're prepared for it, you'll be rewarded in the end.  560 was a brilliant idea for a course. You'll never find another class that lets you videoconference with an actual rock star. Take a class with Prof. Renker!

she is so insanely smart!every class was really exciting (except for it being at 9:30 am...) i'm so glad that she was my teacher, she cared so much and did some many awesome things for us like a video conference with the lead singer of he national! she is a very hard teacher though, but i think she really wants hard work from you in return for hers

Great class. Tons of fun, you work hard, but you learn a lot. The teacher pushes you for answers, and helps you find them. She is engaging, ecouraging, and fair. I looked forward to going to this class and was sad when it ended.
Poetry of Alternative Rock music--really cool concept and really cool class.  Little bit pretentious, but still very interesting and fun.

Very engaged, very enthusiastic, very committed teacher. The class was difficult, but never intimidating. She takes student comments to heart, integrating them into class, and was very interested in student opinion. Great professor, I learned a lot and enjoyed every bit of it.
My best prof at OSU so far.  The class (560) is certainly not a breeze, but it's one of those classes that you actually look forward to going to.

She is very arrogant.  I was turned off by a lot of the material just because of her condescending attitude toward the class.  I felt like she used the syllabus and lecture to show off her extensive vocabulary...I get it, you're smart.  Congratulations.  There are FAR BETTER profs out there and I recommend anyone but her.

Very possibly the best teacher I've ever had and I don't say this lightly.  She was very hard though.  Took an interest in the class and the students.  She did research if you asked a question she didn't know the answer to.  She was nominated for a distinguished teacher award as well.  If you want to actually learn something go with Renker.

she puts on a front that she will be really harsh but in reality is one of the most approachable and nicest professors i have ever had.  she likes to put people on the spot but will work with your answers to inspire lively discussion. her class was engaging and made poetry interesting- something i never thought could happen!

I was one quarter away from graduating and she wrote a comment on my final assignment "I might want to consider changing majors"  I still graduated and 3 years later I have my Masters! Glad I didn't take her advise!
No Comments
No Comments

Opt out of taking this if you're looking for an easy A.  Lectures are boring and she likes to randomly call on people and ask questions.  Sure, this is a good idea in a smaller setting, but the majority of kids she pick on have no idea what's going on so it's a total waste of time.  Also, she's a tough grader.
class covers a lot of literature so u really aren't going to get into any of it.  She is okay. Easy class as long as you go to lectures.  Exams are very straight forward.

very abrasive as a teacher and I was intimidated by her.  When you volunteer to answer a question she always asked a bunch of follow up questions that really put you on the spot and eventually make u look stupid. very strict grader, the average grade on papers was a low C. but she is thorough and clear, and she is a good prof and u will learn a lot

So enthusiastic and always willing to help her students! Even if she was teaching a subject I wasn't interested in I have no doubt she would make you excited about it.  She's extremely kind, sweet, and very encouraging, she helped me improve my critical writing and appreciation for poetry!

You will love her.  She obviously puts in a lot of work to prepare for her classes.  There will be no surprises on any test or quiz.  Class goes by really quickly, too.  Plus, as other's have noticed, she is a great dresser :)

E-Renk was pretty daggone hot, and though she was tough, she made my writing better and actually taught me how to do a proper close reading of a poem.  She's one of the "finer" teachers in the department--"finer" having a dual meaning.
Pretty great class. She's hard sometimes (i.e. paper grading), but always genuinely interested in what you have to contribute to class discussion. Learned so much; defnitely worth the B in the end.
She actually made me look forward to analyzing poetry... if you have the chance, take her class.  She's pretty sweet.

Best in the Department. Stimulating, excitable, and interactive on an equal plane. There are no wrong answers -- everyone should be speaking up in her classes because she acutally listens and thinks, unlike many other instructors.
She's OK...I mean, she can be quite tough at times, but she's always clear and makes you come to class.

she was an amazing teacher. she challenges you and makes you think on your feet, but in a positive encouraging way. she is extremely helpful and helped me improve my writing a lot. she loves what she does and it shows and rubs off on the class.
She miraculously somehow got me to appreciate poetry - I was actually was excited to write my final paper!  Excellent instructor, and stylish dresser too.
Love this woman.  Such a blast and so intelligent.  PLUS--she wears cute suits from Express.  What more can one want from an English professor?
Excellent teacher!  I learned so much and felt publically challenged to support my arguments, but never felt embrassed.  She is supportive always and cares for her students.
She is very helpful.  I learned so much from her.  She helped me improve my writing so much!  I highly recomend this professor.
Very helpful, challenges students and herself in every class.  EXCELLENT!!!
She isn't good about returning e-mails, but she's an EXCELLENT teacher!  Sweet..
Excellent professor. Makes you think on your feet without embarrassing you.

Very easy grader, if you make an effort you'll get full credit. Lots of small group discussions in class and had us go around and close read lines of poems every class which was kind of annoying but she's really nice if you don't really understand
Professor Higginbotham made this class more than enjoyable with her kind personality and enthusiasm. I recommend her for all majors!

Had her for intro to Shakespeare, super cute human and definitely cares about you understanding the material whether you have studied Shakespeare before or not. Definitely recommend taking this for a Lit GE. Just keep up with readings on sparknotes and youll be fine.

She is very passionate about Shakespeare, which makes the class more interesting. The class is super easy but many lectures were theater based with activities where you walk around the room. There is a lot of assigned reading but I can honestly say sparknotes will get you through it without having to read the actual books. Easy english GE

While she is by no means a poor professor, her class is at times insufferable. Lots of juvenile group activities where you walk around the room and do theater excercises. All plays are read outside of class on your own and are barely interpreted in class. Comically easy A however.

Assignments and projects had unclear expectations and then were graded very harshly. Professor took an extensive amount of time to return grades and this caused difficulty completing other assignments. When feedback was finally delivered it seemed to be inaccurate and petty justifications for points being taken off. Lectures were not engaging.
Great! Only complaint is that we often didn't get to discuss everything we wanted to and she went really over time sometimes.

Professor Higginbotham has been my favorite professor so far. She made me actually LIKE Shakespeare! Definitely take her if you get the chance; she cares about what you learn, and teaches in a way that is easy to understand and is entertaining. She let me re-write a paper three times because she believed I could do better than I was. She's the best

Professor Higginbotham was really good at teaching Shakespeare. She has you do line-by-line analysis of plays and goes around the room and it gets really boring quickly, but it's an easy class if you work.

I had her for a freshman seminar this fall and absolutely LOVED her.  She's interesting and fun and encourages a very relaxed discussion atmosphere.  Small weekly assignments but grades easily.  Attendance was mandatory but everyone enjoyed the class and likely would've gone anyways.  If you can I highly recommend taking one of her classes.

By far my favorite professor at this University. She is the nicest  professor ever and so accommodating. She is easy to get in touch with. She does tend to ramble on a bit to compensate for a lack of participation and awkward silence, but she is just awesome. She will literally help you with anything and does what she can so you get a good grade.

Although attendance is mandatory, doing so basically ensures you an A in this class. You also need the book... but what do you expect from a Shakespeare course? Jennifer was such a nice, funny professor and I wish I could have her again. She really knows her stuff. A 5-7 page paper is assigned but she grades pretty easily.

Very good teacher. Obviously very interested in the subject matter. Pushed me to extend my thought process about Shakespeare and Shakespearean culture. I very much enjoyed her enthusiasm, it made it very easy to decide whether or not to show up to class consistently.
A very easy teacher, but not much learned.

She is the absolutely best person in the world. Classes for fun because she was really passionate about the subject, and she truly puts her students' best interest to heart. If you can, take her class. It's not too hard to get an A either.

An amazing instructor. She makes class fun and has a passion for the topic that is motivating. She's a total nerd for certain things and it makes for an engaging experience. I feel like she really improved my writing.
Will work with you at whatever level you're at, to help you make the class match your needs.

She is a great teacher! We had great discussions and really easy reading quizzes.  We turned in papers to get a preliminary grade and then revised them for almost our entire grade. It would be hard to not get an A if you put any effort in whatsoever.

She was wonderful! The course material was engaging and fun (we read mystery novels!), and she was really great at connecting what we read with different schools of literary criticsm. For essays, we got initial grades and then a chance to revise them, plus we workshopped like crazy. I learned a lot and had a good time--definitely take her class!
She was amazing. Somewhat of an easy grader, yet still left very helpful comments. Class was as entertaining as a Shakespeare class can get. I would definitely recommend her!
No Comments
No Comments

Passionate about her area of expertise and genuinely engaged with the students in discussion.   Helpful grader with lots of essay comments. Rigorous reading, but light on the assignments.  Her soft voice could use with stronger projection in class.
She was an incredibly accommodating and caring educator. She clearly had a deep compassion for her students and their learning.

The class is supposed to be an introductory English class. However, the coursework was overboard. She took it upon her way to make her students feel like they were walking on eggshells. There wasn't any freedom in this class. She will give you a completion grade if you do the work. However, she will take away your grade, if you don't attend class.

This class can have a lot of work, but Prof. Buuck is always willing to help. I got so much out of attending office hours before each big assignment was due. My class was small and very relaxed. It was a fun class to take that also helped to expand my portfolio.

Very kind, and a delight to talk to. Gives well constructed, fast feedback. MAJOR HEADS-UP: In her 1110, your first major project's research question will determine the rest of your class. Choose something broad and easy to research. Only bad part of this class. Other than that, highly recommend. If you have to interview someone, choose her.

I loved having Professor Buuck! Her class can be overwhelming at times in terms of assignments, but I don't think that's her fault and she does her best to accommodate based on your needs. She is probably my favorite professor I have ever had at OSU! Could not recommend enough.

One of my best teachers at OSU so far. She really cares about her students' well being above all. Every assignment you can negotiate the due date. She gives feedback on work slow, but if you go out of your way to office hours she'll always be prepared to help where you need revision. A lot of submissions, but each assignment is easily achievable.

By far one of the best professors that I've had at OSU. She is easy going and very understandable. I've never liked English, but she made it fun and the workload is manageable, unlike other classes that you have to put in 10+ hours a day to get homework done. If you buy into the class it'll be fun, just do the work. HAVE FUN AND GOOD LUCK!!!

Prof. Buuck is easily one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. I love attending office hours. She gives excellent feedback, allows for revision credit, and is always there to help you through your drafts. The beginning of the semester is front-loaded with work, which you'll appreciate once everyone else starts dumping assignments on you.
Do not show up late for even a second.
SHE IS AMAZING and straight forward from the beginning.

She is a down to earth professor that is friendly, but don't be late to her class not even for a minute because she will count that as being late. I cannot stress myself enough but to READ THE SYLLABUS AND FOLLOW IT! She takes that seriously, if you don't follow it you will get lost. Beware though DO NOT SIGN any agreement she hands out.

Professor Buuck taught Business Writing this semester and is probably one of the most caring people you will ever meet, yet such a hard grader. I have taken over 90 credits at this point and have never run into someone who is so unwilling to work with you about changing a grade because of such a simple mistake. Attendance is a must.
One of the most caring professor at OSU.
Ms. Buuck is one unique professor. She cares about every students and she likes to give feedback.

There was a lot of papers and reading to complete throughout the course. The book we read was unbelievably dry. Her personality and the energy she brings to the classroom more than make up for it though. Overall it was a great class.
Great teacher, she is very passionate!

Great teacher. Was out of school nearly 10 years and she had her for my first English class. She will give everyone in the class personal attention but if you need more help and go to her office hours, she will do all she can for you. Highly recommend and really enjoyed her class

Mrs. Buuck is such a great teacher! She cares so much about helping her students and does everything she can to see them succeed. This class has greatly strengthened my writing skills. I had so much fun learning and improving throughout the semester! SUCH A GREAT TEACHER! highly recommend taking her classes!

Mrs. Buuck cares so much about her students and does everything she can to help them succeed. This class has strengthened my writing skills and I had so much fun learning and improving throughout the semester! GREAT teacher! Highly recommend taking her classes!

I took her for fiction writing II and thought that she was overall very positive. At the same time, she was helpful and was constantly offering feedback. she was highly interactive with students. The course was not easy though; she gives A LOT of assignments. Perhaps a little more than was comfortable. But overall, 5/5. Great class.
harsh

She is a very fair professor. She gives great feedback on assignments and is more than happy to help outside of class through email. She also gives extra credit sometimes. I would absolutely take a class with her again.

Professor Jamieson was extremely accessible, especially for a fully remote class. She gives clear feedback on papers, and is very understanding and flexible on grading and finishing assignments. There are some group projects but as long as you respond to discussion posts and keep up with assignments this is completely manageable.

She was a great English professor. She provided clear instructions for assignments and was accessible outside of class anytime. She responded to emails very quickly and was super helpful in explaining things. She actually cares on how you do in the class, makes sure everyone is doing well. She is a pretty tough grader so make sure to put effort.

She gives good feedback and responds to emails really fast. Although sometimes her answers are a little vague, but in the end your assignments are on your own anyways. Her grading is fair and there weren't very many assignments and they were all pretty easy. Definitely the best 1110 professor!

Professor Jamieson is great, she is available for advice on assignments and always gives good individual feedback. Two main projects and weekly discussions but she provides a lot of time for us to work on them and gives us the resources to do well and ask for help. She is also very organized and everything you need is available on Carmen.

really chill class. she gives a lot of time to work on assignments, and she responds to emails extremely fast. pretty easy grader overall, there's a couple of pretty big projects that are worth quite a bit (but again, she gives a lot of time to work on those). super organized as well, posts a lot of reminders/tips and is so sweet.

She is a great professor however her bigger projects do require a lot of work and can be time consuming. She's good at replying to emails especially if you need to clarify something. It's great to have extensions on deadlines for smaller assignments and she's aware of holidays and other student complications.

Dr. Nixon is awesome. EZ class. Three main writing projects. There are some short writings and discussions here and there, but if you hate English, take it with Dr. Nixon. I probably 60% effort and ended with a 99% in the class.
Harsh ratings, won't give you feedback, extreme amount of work, highly not recommended!
It's a terrible online class experience; she doesn't personally give you any input on your drafts at all!

She tries to do her best with an online format. She gives good feedback, and is a really energetic person, and generally a fast responder. She is generous with due dates and extensions, and she understands a students workload and organizes due dates well. Fun class overall, and an easy A.

Dr. Nixon was a great english professor! It's tough to get used to her carmen set up, but she answers emails super fast and is eager to help. She's not a tough grader even though there's a lot of writing to do. I totally reccomend!

Dr. Nixon is very kind and gives extensions out like candy if you just ask. Very understanding and her assignments aren't necessarily difficult. The hardest part of this course is understanding how it is setup on carmen- it's very confusing at first. All essays and assignments count towards the final project so make sure you do them!

Dr. Nixons class was set up pretty confusing. I had to email her a lot and check with other classmates so often just to understand the exact point of each assignment. Weekly checklist states A LOT of reading assignments, but to be honest theyre not necessary at all. Class is mostly just 4 big papers, if you choose a good topic it isnt too hard.

I had Prof Nixon for an all online class. She was really helpful and there was a lot of work, but everything worked toward your final paper. You might think that the work is stupid, but everything had a purpose to it. She took into account how students were struggling with covid and made our finals pass or fail, which helped a lot.
I loved this teacher! She was very nice and understanding towards students. You could tell that she wanted every student to get a good grade and helped everyone to the best of her abilities.
She is nice and supportive on my work and I can say that without her I cannot even finish my final work since I wasn't doing it in right way. Thanks her a lot!

This professor is doing nonsense thing! She asked me to rewrite my essay twice just because she didn't tell want I need to achieve at once! Now I have less than a week to write a final essay! It is killing me!
Bunch of busy work so much effort required for basic grades. Way too cheerful. Definitely has favorites.

Really great teacher. She genuinely cares about her students and is very forgiving grading wise. She looks more for comprehension and analysis in the papers written than having page and word counts. A decent bit of work needs to be done for the papers, but even the ones that seem irrelevant are solid practice for the final paper. NO EXAMS!
She's nice. Just prepare for paper then you'll be fine.
She is considerate and willing to help

Dr. Nixon is a super bubbly, bright professor. It is exactly what you'd expect out of an English class - Writing papers & analyzing sources, so don't come into it expecting anything less! While sometimes it felt a little film-studies heavy, the class made me a better writer. You're going to be totally fine if you do the work for this class.

This professor always likes to assign nonsense homework and make us read or watch nonsense movies. Always those few students make response in her class and her handwriting is really hard to recognize. But the good thing is no midterm or any quiz. All we have to do is a final paper.

On numerous occasions I have emailed her with no reply. Her syllabus doesn't match what she says in class. We have to watch dumb movies and answer things like "What repetitions do you notice?". I'm not even sure what that means. We also have to write 500 words a week on absolutely nothing. She's very nice but her assignments are ridiculous.

Shes a wonderful and the kindest professor ever. Always optimist, bubbly and fun and smiles a lot. Classes can be awkward at times, but it is very relaxing and somewhat fun. No tests, just a single research paper for the semester. The bubbliest professor ever!

The class was super easy, but also more helpful than I thought it would be. It was nice how Professor Nixon was always super bubbly and happy - it really made each class have a more social and relaxed feel. Things weren't always clear to begin with, but when you ask, she will go above and beyond to help you understand what it is you need to know.

Nixon was awkwardly happy all the time and was overall okay. Her office hours are the best way to get feedback. This class was writing one paper over the course of a semester, so the work load was usually either  a lot or none at all for a given week. You don't use the textbooks a ton but you should have them, check to see if there are pdfs online.

Im not happy at Elizabeth's grading  It was an easy A but I felt that she barely skimmed our papers and didnt give any feedback at all    I felt that this class was a waste of time and i didnt improve my writing I would rather have had a harder professor but it helped my gpa so i cant complain

Nixon is one of the nicest professors ever! The class was a lot of readingwriting at times, but not too much. The books we were pretty interesting and fun. She is super smiley and bubbly. Loved her class!

She is rather giggly and smiley but a super nice lady. The class is super easy, and I thought she made the material more interesting and had us look at online articles that were very relevant and interesting. However, after a while the class got monotonous.
The most annoying human being. She has a nervous giggle after every. single. sentence. No help at all, requires enormous amounts of reading between classes and unclear in assignments.

She's nice and smiles A LOT. The semester is spent working on one huge essay, so make sure you choose a good topic that you want to spend a lot of time with and like! She's super confusing with due dates and assignments in general. She told me my essay was good all semester then a few months in said it was wrong & I needed to talk to her...
The class was basically writing a long paper and presenting it. Keeps postponing due dates which made students unmotivated. She doesn't follow the syllabus. cancelled class for a week.

She cancelled class a lot, which was good with me, but she never ever explained when things were due. She just expects you to know. She is 100% correct all the time and she will repeat your correct responses and claim them as hers and tell you that you were wrong. GEH

ehh... she was ok i guess. kinda mad that she had us go out an buy a book called Revenge of the Cockroach People that we never even touched - waste of time. and she'll tell you you don't need to do anything to your draft, then dock you like 20 points for no reason on the final paper. overly happy all the time and bobs her head constantly.

Awful. The class was unorganized, she canceled class all the time, would never actually explain assignments before their due date, and will never email you back. I also still haven't received several assignments back yet which are needed for the final portfolio which is due today....
Great class, with some of the best literature selection I've had so far in college. interesting book and relevant to class and life.

she was all in all a nice person, but she was way too overexcited for very boring things that had nothing to do with math.  we spent the entire quarter covering "how to criticize a critical analysis". also, she would look over your drafts and tell you that you didn't need any work done, and then give you a B- on your final draft.
Very helpful and kind though sometimes her class might not be very interesting (though she is very enthusiastic about english which is always a good thing)
Amazing Professor! One of the best I have had.

Professor Ramsey is an extremely caring person, and she is very funny during lecture. She really did change the way that I write, and she made me a much more confident writer. Her feedback makes you know exactly how she feels about your work. If you have to take an english course, I recommend Mrs. Ramsey.
awesome

She engages students in discussion really well; makes a boring class interesting. Genuinely cares about students, English, teaching, etc. Has a good sense of humor and is really straightforward. There were 3 papers + mandatory volunteer experience, which was actually okay. She extended deadlines for papers depending on where we were at as a class.
Great instructor, very helpful with feedback and a great sense of humor!
Very nice and fair. Made a boring class interesting.
Very helpful and fair. She is a fun person to be around.

Class itself is fairly easy although the big paper can be tough, but she is a fair grader and very helpful. If you go to her or send her a question about your paper she will help you! Made english tolerable and she is just a really cool lady

Rebecca seems very kind. But her papers are ridiculous. And so much not needed course work that stimulates nothing in my brain on a learning aspect. I have gained nothing from this class besides headaches and bad paper grades.

The papers are way too long and her grading is very tough. All her course work is about liberal propaganda. I do not care for that but I am truly worried the school would hire someone for this much coursework in a gen ed. 8 page papers are ridiculous when students have many other classes. And the papers are not fun topics at all.

Unreasonable grader, stresses the importance of peer feedback but does not give timely feedback herself on major projects. She takes a month to grade each paper while you have other assignments in her class due - makes it hard to improve when you don't know what your grades are when you're still turning in work.

The problem is that, for me, it took forever to understand the way she was trying to teach. In this particular class, she was using "issues of concern" to teach students how to write with rhetoric. The idea is to use something that the students care about to motivate them to learn about rhetoric. She never explained this to us!

I read reviews for the business department page and should have listened. Extremely tough and unreasonable grader. Does not give clear instructions and generally doesn't seem to like her job. Avoid taking her if you can

I love Siders personality. He's hilarious! But he's a really tough grader! My major is criminal justice. Disney movies aren't my thing AT ALL! Trying to find sources and stuff like that only adds to the pressure. I don't want to do this presentation in December. Long story short, while I love his personality, I don't wanna take his class again.

Prof Siders has high expectations for his students! Tough grader and is honest about your work. He makes class fun and he is relatable. This class is very demanding but he makes it manageable and wants you to succeed. Go to his office hours for guidance. He responds to emails fast and you can tell he cares. Good Choice!

Professor Siders was easily my favorite professor at OSU thus far. He is very laid back, and will even roast you if you deserve it, but he also actually teaches you how to write and extract key points from works. He is a meme. If you meme and care about the class you will have no problem and enjoy every second of it. Best English professor ever.

Prof Siders is the best English teacher I have EVER had. He never failed to make the class interesting and fun! He always had a joke up his sleeve. Classes were discussion based which made the class a comfortable setting, allowing people to contribute to class regularly. I honestly learned so much and would definitely take his class again!!

Professor Anderson was a fantastic teacher. Lectures were engaging, feedback was plentiful and useful, and she is very understanding. However, know before you go in that the class has nothing to do with business writing. It's a semester-long collaboration project with Ohio Sea Grant/ Stone Laboratory that involves research and experimental design.
Great! There is a lot of reading, but not bad at all. Very helpful and interesting.
Good professor. Spend enough time to study and you will get good grades. Great reading materials and discussion for every module. His feedback is very helpful for students to improving their writing.
We read two novels and one nonfiction book, along with several poems and short stories. The lecture and materials were always interesting, powerful, and comforting.

Professor Ponce was a great professor. We went over so many different topics throughout the class, and he always made sure to have an open discussion. I was also sick for a majority of the semester so school became pretty difficult, but he made the content accessible and answered any questions I had along the way. You should take his class.

so sweet! his wit is next level, make sure you sit near the front of the class because he can be a bit soft spoken, but it's so worth it for his jokes. reading is a must for this class, as depending on the day it's either discussion based or lecture heavy. fun material, fun guy

Ponce is very intelligent and cares about your writing. For someone who doesn't enjoy writing, he made the class interesting for me. He always created interesting conversation and he grades pretty straight forward.

Ponce is an absolutely incredible teacher. He is wonderfully articulate, and has introduced me to so many levels of analysis -- from writing technique to sociopolitical issues, he's so well versed. He is definitely soft-spoken, but you will adjust. He always made me laugh, even when his jokes were a little dorky. You WILL read a ton. Worth it.

Created awesome syllabus, heavy on reading early in semester but easier load by the end. Very smart guy, provided great insights into readings, esp. engaging long history of black literature with present-day race issues. Too many small-group discussions, but overall, excellent class. Two papers.

Joe is one of my mentors in graduate school. He has a razor-sharp mind and always offers incisive feedback. I appreciate how he can point out the shortcomings in my work without making me feel stupid. I'd highly recommend him, particularly to grad students working in U.S. ethnic lit. P.S.: Don't try to sound pedantic; he will call your bluff.
would not recommend.  use your $ to learn something in a different class.

Soft spoken but you get used to it as the class goes on. Extremely smart and well-read. Understanding, considerate and fair. Expect to read what you're assigned and you'll do well. Liked him so much that I am taking a class next semester for fun. He's not too bad to look at either.

Is a well-read prof. for one, but he pushes a lot of reading on students. had to read a diff book every week. Also class assignments were boring. would have just liked to have class discussion. instead had to do tons of in-class exercises. even if workload is unbalanced he is still pretty helpful. grades fairly, perhaps even generously.
Good instructor, and did a good job of structuring the class so all of the reading built on it. I think he's doing a doctoral in far east lit, so he might put that kind of twist on things.

Bad stuff: soft-spoken and unable to be heard if you're a back-of-the-class sitter. NOT clear on important assignments like the FINAL PROJECT. Good stuff: overall, a great teacher. Enjoys teaching and willing to help students. Super-knowledgable, approachable, witty, and cool. Take him if you get a chance.
So dreamy and smart
He really engaged with the students in class discussions.  His lecture style was good.

Pretty good professor. Makes jokes that aren't funny followed up by "Just kidding." Eventually gets funnier when you're used to it. Class discussions were always fun. The final for the class might've been the easiest test I've taken in college, though the midterm was harder than expected. Also wrote short papers with prompts given by the teacher.
great!
Funny and engaging. Very willing to offer advice and guidance. Take advantage of office hours to get to know him. Wants to hear what his students think. One of the best English profs I have had here.
one word=boring
great teacher - very hot too!

The best professor I've had thus far!  As long as you do the work, it's not hard to do well in his class.  He's very helpful and easy to talk to.  Do not pass up the opportunity to take a class with him!!

He is very interested in the topic of the class, definitely knows his stuff and in turn makes others interested also.  Extremely helpful too.  It seems like the English department finally got it right when hiring him.
Very nice and knows his stuff.  Seems passionate about african american lit.  Very easy to talk to if you go to office hours.
No Comments
Class honestly sucked. A lot of reading. Quizzes are given and worth 10% of the grade, which adds up. I would not recommend

Prof. Schotter was really interesting and funny, lead good discussions, and you can tell how much he loves film. You definitely have to come to class and participate to do well, but it wasn't too hard and I learned a lot.

I wouldn't say Jesse was fantastic; he was just ok. It was good in the beginning watching classic Hollywood movies, but towards the end of the semester, it transitioned to avant-garde stuff that I had to sit through. Attending his lectures aren't optional if you want to pass and be prepared for quizzes.

Not a bad class if you have a good recitation leader. Movies were old, some black and white, different languages, silent, etc so if that's not your thing you will be bored. Overall it was fine for a GE but you could find a more interesting, easier one. Had to watch a 2+ hour movie each week to do well on weekly quizzes, plus 2 essays and a final.

I wouldnt take this class unless you really like obscure films or films in general. I thought I did coming in but these films werent the kind to sit back and enjoy you really have to try to understand them. Def a film class full of film students

Prof. Schotter is a nice guy and a fair teacher, though a little boring. This class was super easy but a lot of reading. A pretty big part of your grade is from participating in the class discussions which I didn't mind. If you genuinely like English and reading, you will enjoy this class.

I had Jesse for Intro to Film. Easy class if you take notes in lecture and watch the films on the syllabus. Professor is a little opinionated, but if you are not too passionate about the subject it shouldn't bother you.

I had Schotter for Intro to Film, and it was great. Your homework is to watch movies, plus some textbook reading--you don't it have to do, but it helped me understand material. No midterms, just weekly quizzes. His lectures are detailed & clear, and he is clearly passionate about his class. He always asks for feedback and works to answer questions.
Great professor, great class. Anyone who says the class is graded too hard - it isn't Schotter, it's his TA's.  Just go to class and office hours to have them review your papers and you'll be fine.

All he is is a lecturer. TAs do grading. He is very passionate about film though and that made learning the material all the easier. Some may be able to get away with not reading the textbook, but I found it a lot easier to understand if I did the required reading. Quizzes are extremely easy if you just watch the movies.
He was one of the most boring teachers at OSU. He is a hard grader and assigned more work than my upper level classes.

Prof. Simmons is a very knowledgeable and caring teacher. She's an easy grader- as long as you do your work and show up to most of the classes, you'll get an easy A. Her lectures are interesting, and she has a great sense of humor. I sometimes go to class just for her British humor lol. Overall 10/10- would take again.
Clear expectations for class, participation and attendance not mandatory but important. Assignments not too difficult, easy grader. Good GE class.

What a sweet and knowledgable woman! Dr. Simmons is a wonderful prof that really cares about the success of her students. On more than one occasion, I emailed her with questions and went to office hours and she not only helped me, but also took the time to ask me about my other classes and goals. I'd highly recommend her!!

I feel blessed to have had simmons as my teacher for a british literature course. English is not for everyone and I think she understands that. It is a general education class and she treats it like one unlike other GE professors. It is very easy if you take brief notes and study a little before quiz day and exams. She is really funny as well!

It's impossible not to get an A in her class. Just read and show up to class if you want a good grade. She has a great sense of humor and super accommodating. Only downfall was how she handled finals week. We had a quiz, a paper, and an exam all within a week so it was a bit overwhelming especially with other finals going on. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
She is awesome. She is so witty and smart and interesting. Thumbs up would take again. She made British Literature awesome
Amazing professor.  Amazing person.  Easily the best professor I've ever had.

Clare Simmons has the rare and much loved gift of being a clear, concise, and rather easy teacher while also being able to work through material with a generally critical eye. Granted, in survey courses this is the goal. Lots of extra credit and very clear goals make her class, while not super fun or inspiring, easy and worth taking.

She gives very straight forward PowerPoint presentations and pretty easy tests as long as you're paying attention in class and taking notes. Everything is pretty clear cut, no surprises from her other than the weekly pop quizzes.

This class was an easy A. You don't even have to read all of the readings. Simply show up to class and do well on the case briefs. Clare is an easy grader, willing to edit your papers before you turn them in, and allows rewrites on every assignment. She is very nice and helpful and clearly wants students to succeed.

I would highly recommend Prof Simmons for any Lit class. I find most of them boring but she did a good job at keeping it interesting and humorous.  She is very helpful and accommodating - you need to do your work but she grades pretty easily and accepts all opinions in class.  Good class, good prof.

Professor Simmons took a potentially intimidating/boring subject and made extremely interesting and fun.  Assignments are light compared to many English classes, and grading is VERY fair. Class atmosphere is relaxed and her lectures are funny and thought-provoking.  She is exceptional. She's taking a sabbatical until next fall, so take her then!
Prof Simmons is a blessing to the English dept.  She is very intelligent, funny, and a sweet heart.  And British!  Take her class and you will not regret it! :)

LOVE HER!  If only all of osu's english profs were like this.  She's funny, approachable, and tries hard to make the class interesting.  even better-she's a nice grader and accepts late work.  it's a shame the honors dept hogs her for all of their classes!
She made class fun and interesting. Always extending herself out to help students. Definitely a seminar based class where she and the class all actively participate on the same level.
I LOVED this class.  I thought I would hate it but she really made it interesting.  Plus, the class was always laughing.  I would definitely recommend Professor Simmons to anyone I could.

I love Professor Simmons!  She was so nice about everything, always willing to re-examine our syllabus and if things got a little much she'd give us extra time, etc.  Very understanding and funny. fun class!

A truly wonderful professor.  She was the reason I decided to remain in the English program (I've changed my major 3 times). Professors of her caliber are rare, and you'll be lucky if you have one or two more professors like her.  Highly recommended.

I adored Prof Simmons.  To be honest, some people hated her though.  Usually it was just because they couldn't get into the material, but those people weren't good with English anyways, right?  Simmons loves to help people, always has good insight when you ask for help, and had plenty of unusual, cool information on all sorts of things.  A true gem

Very helpful, she is always willing to make time in her office if you need help on a paper or something. She is a fair grader, but she is tough, there is no slacking off in this class. Also, she will not give a big reading load when a paper is due. (how sweet)
fun class, she doesn't mind getting a little off topic sometimes, but i learned a lot. good, dry sense of humor. tough but fair grader, she knows her stuff. generally a classy british woman.
Very dry humor. Witty.  Looked forward to her class.  What else can you ask. Fair grader, seems to care a lot about student success.
hilarious, if you get her sense of humor (i don't know that a lot of students did). very helpful--always willing to meet up to talk about questions/paper issues/etc.
Very good Prof. Very insteresting to hear all of the "dirt" on the authors we studied.
She loses a point on "clarity" for being a Brit, but is one of the best teachers on the OSU faculty.  Had a blast in her class, and would recommend her to anyone who asked.
GREAT PROFESSOR....she always took the time to make sure you understood the material as well as brought food on movie days...what could be better??
As a professor and advisor, she is EXTREMELY helpful and also witty

Best professor I have ever taken. Does not beleive in "due dates," and as long as you have all of your assignments in before the end of the term you'll be okay. Extremely understanding professor, too. she understands the modern day struggles that most students go through and is very lenient.

Professor Halasek is great! She gives great feedback on assignments, which really helps you know where to improve for future projects. She responded to emails quickly and seemed like she really cared that her students were successful. I would highly recommend!

Prof. Halasek is such a passionate teacher! Her constructive feedback and encouragement were invaluable in improving my critical analysis and creative writing skills. Her contagious enthusiasm for her subject matter made even complex assignments accessible and interesting. approachable nature and engaging. Highly recommend taking a class with her!

I couldn't stand her methods class for literature any longer. I only lasted a few days. It was clear to me that the class was full of activism. We watched a torturous video we had to inquire about afterward, and she was smiling throughout those eleven minutes. Expect his from most classes in the humanities, they tend to be politically charged.

I would give her zero stars if I could. If you respect yourself as a human, do not take this class, especially online. She will post assignments very late and then expect it to be due the next day. And then she will have the audacity to grade it very roughly. Avoid her at all costs.

She is a nice and knowledgeable person, but she wasn't necessarily a great teacher, but that didn't matter since the class was extremely easy. We only had like 5 assignments all semester. There were readings and lectures every week that I didn't do and still got a good grade. She isn't very good with technology either.

Didn't do any of the readings, spoke only a few times, and got A-/B+s on the two essays. Class followed the syllabus for each week but the grade breakdown was NOTHING like what she put in the syllabus (no presentation happened even tho it was in the syllabus?? ONE online disc board) and was genuinely confused on what affected my grade.

She is a nice woman and very knowledgeable/passionate about film! Very open-minded. My only issues were getting her to respond to emails and her critiquing my own opinions about the films. Never responded to any emails. Another one is that she never grades assignments. She graded the day after final grades were due.

Not a good professor to have in college. She did not grade a single of the few assignments all semester and ignored everyone's emails. She then told us if we had done the work for class we had an A in a notice on Carmen. She graded the first paper right before the last one was due. We had no idea what to expect because of her lack of feedback.

Dr. MacPherson gives amazing and memorable lectures; she is literally a sponge for information and communicates it in a fun and engaging manner. Some of the readings she chooses are challenging, but I love that she pushes us to really think. She definitely has a sense of humor, which is always appreciated. She is also extremely giving of her time.
Awesome prof! She really helps you succeed in class and actually makes class discussion fun! Id recommend her for any course, she really knows her stuff and I was looking forward to all the lectures.

ENG 2261 is an easy literature GenEd requirement with Sandra. We were graded on midterm, final, participation, and two papers (one two page paper, and one four page paper). I had an A in the class, but don't know my percent because she didn't put in grades. I raised my hand in almost every class, and got B+/A- on papers, A on midterm.

The class is graded on daily participation and an essay and the final paper. That's it. She's a medium-tough grader-- for example, I usually get A's on papers and she gave me a B+ (not a huge difference but like put more effort in these papers than other english class papers).

She's really nice & approachable, but also passionate about the course. Her lectures aren't too bad, but they get boring. She is however terrible at grading assignments on time and never responds to her emails. For finals week, she assigned both a paper and the hardest exam I've ever taken, which was too much for a week span on top of other finals.

She is a teacher that will look out for you. I forgot to schedule my test through accommodation services at my university, and waiting too long, past the deadline. She went out of her way to give me the same accommodation, although she had no obligation to do so. Her class was fun, informative, and she loved passionate work and eager students.

One of my all-time favorite professors. She may be a little unorganized, but she is extremely intelligent. She inspires you to share your thoughts in class and is extremely inspirational. If you're interested in theory, particularly feminist and gender theory, I highly recommend her. Her lectures are always engaging and very complex.

She is terrible at grading on time and is incredibly ambiguous in class. I didn't get my midterm back until after our final. Her essay prompts are unclear, and rarely have a definite purpose. She also loves to discuss the history of sexuality in the English culture because she believes it is directly related lit--prepare yourself.
Extremely knowledgeable and well read. She is very willing to extend a helping hand to any who ask for it! Loved her class!

One of my favorite professors of all time. SO knowledgeable... on everything, yet somehow doesn't make you feel dumb. Very chill, too-- I was late on three of my assignments (by only a few days) and she didn't mind/ it didn't affect my grade. Plus the class itself was AMAZING. I'd take ANY class she taught if I weren't graduating :(

She was definitely one of the best professors I've had in the English department. She's really funny, extremely knowledgeable and interesting to talk to. The work load in the class was pretty light too. I highly recommend taking a class with her.

Biggest complaint: COMPLETELY Disorganized. Late to class at least 5 times, not prompt in grading/feedback, & often forgot upcoming assignments. Very knowledgeable of the material, but fell short with getting me to understand it. Never knew what to expect when it came to her attentions in grading. Overall, a professor that takes a lot of patience.

Worst Professor I have ever had. She uses no visual aids (writes random, incomprehensible words on the board). Doesn't respond to emails. Class is fast paced, difficult to follow, &often boring. Prof often gives inaccurate info as well. Hard 4 quizzes, take home midterm, 2 papers, final. Im an English major&it was still awful I don't recommend her!

Amazing teacher! Will guide you through rubrics and encourages creativity, so you can make any of the 3 Major Projects anyway you want (as long as you hit the bullet points). Super caring and you can have a great conversation with him. Also if you don't want to talk about English you can get him to talk about anything and take up some class time.
He was okay i guess, a couple long projects but overall easy class

didn't speak up then, but he was married (at the time, idk about now) and asked me out for coffee "to talk about my work." I got straight A's in his class prior to this, and after I said no, I never got higher than a B after that. Unsure if it was related but definitely felt off and unfair.

In writing papers I was given very negative and hateful feedback which really discouraged me. The feedback was very cruel and harsh and did not provide me with beneficial feedback to help me succeed in the course.
EASY A!!! He is friendly, and his classes are really easy. You only need to hit those specific criteria for each project, and you will get a solid A. I Definitely would recommend him to my friends.

Misha was AMAZING. I usually engaged in class, and spent more than a bit of time goofing off, but it was so easy to just relate to him as another person. 10/10 would take any class of his if it would fit in my schedule
never take his class never!

Great guy, but rambles a lot. The course is centered around writing a research paper at the end of the semester. Throughout the process, he is often unclear on what exactly he expects from students as far as assignments go. Overall, not a bad teacher to have for this GE class.
This is like the best professor ever he is so awesome.

If I could rate him a 0 I would. When I tell you guys that his class was harder than all my science classes COMBINED I'm not joking. Hard grader and SO MANY ASSIGNMENTS. The way he criticizes you and your papers is absolutely unnecessary and his reasoning for it is "too make you a better writer". If you need english as a pre-req DO NOT TAKE HIM.

he was my favorite professor ever. he is very clear on what he expects. he even lists outs every single thing you need in your essay and how it should be played out. there is really no way you should get less an a B if you do what he asks and edit your papers. he is also really funny and great at teaching English in general.

cool professor, lets students think for themselves and makes the class have a funny vibe to it. Always writing a paper but if you follow the steps how he explains then it should be easy. Can be an easy A but could also fall to a C. Have to stay on top of things.
Professor McCormick is a fantastic instructor. If you enjoy taking English classes, you're going to really like his classes. He's passionate about teaching and really cares about the students.

Paul is one of my favorite professors at OSUN. I feel like he really pushed us intellectually and he was a pretty honest guy. He also brought us donuts when we turned in our research papers! I could tell some people weren't interested so if writing isn't your thing, you may wanna try to find someone else
Paul was a very passionate professor.  English courses are not my favorite, but after having him as a professor, I look forward to next years courses.

Paul is great! He is always ready to help students, and if you go to his office hour, he will explain it in great detail. Also, He is willing to repeat it if you don't understand. If you are international students, it won't be hard for you to attend his class. He can see the effort you made on this class. 4 paper will be written, all have drafts!!!
I took a business writing class with him, and he was fantastic!  Funny, smart, and cute!
Paul is great!  He keeps things interesting and he's great one-on-one.
He's very hard to follow sometimes and can be a bit single minded, as in it seems that English may be the only important thing on the planet.
He knows what he's talking about but sometimes speaks on a different wavelength.  If you don't like English avoid him. But if you do, you'll really enjoy him.
He's Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrreat! Yippie.
He's willing to help, but he really doesn't.  He is very confusing and the readings had NOTHING to do with class.  He never explained anything clearly.
Paul is very helpful and nice...he always makes time for his students.  And he likes cats like me!

Very project heavy. If you satisfy the checklist you will be fine but it can be hard to find what she wants you to do. Never felt like I had a clear understanding of what I was supposed to be doing. Also turn in your stuff on time, she doesn't allow late work

Readings are useless and unnecessarily wrong. Don't buy the textbook. She gave me a 65 on the final pretty randomly. Got 100 on major project 1 and 2 which saved me. Follow a checklist. Doesn't matter if the quality of your work is bad as long as you satisfy the checklist.

She is very caring and accepting of personal conflicts and due dates. The class is very project and paper heavy, to a fault. She can be a tough grader and assignments are sort of ambiguous. However, I would take her class again.

She is nice don't get me wrong. But for a 7 week course this class was insane. You have 2 papers a week, 4 peer reviews, and so many readings. I will say the discussion posts aren't bad because you don't have to respond to classmates. You have to pay for a mandatory book as well that is highway robbery to only use for 7 weeks.
She was super helpful and every assignment was extremely straightforward. A lenient grader too. Would reccomend Art Education 2700 with her.

I would not recommend  taking this class with her, she is very disorganized and it is hard for your to get any feedback from her and would not respond to emails. you would lose grades without even knowing the reason, i've heard other instructors give way less course work too so I would stay away
Stay away
awful
The professor is hard to give feedback unless you try. Highly recommended for taking the professor's class, if you want your GPA not so high. Good luck!

She is an extremely hard grader, if you do not meet her specific expectations you will just get a 0 there is no in between for grading. I would spend hours and hours reading and working on the homework just to receive 0's. For a GE class this was insane to me. I would not recommend, you will be stressed out.
Awful professor, probably the worst professor I've ever had at OSU.

Highly recommend this GenEd for the themes. A fully online class and everything is laid out you just have to do it. It is a lot of reading which is hard but if you stay on top of it, it isn't too bad. You can tell she loves teaching just through her short videos. Its discussion posts each week, each unit a longer assignment (3), and final project.

Dr. Winstead was very kind. She was very lenient regarding extensions and she provided opportunities to re-do assignments that you struggled with. You also get to watch iconic movies like The Shining and I Am Legend (for free!). Make sure you stay on top of the reading, and you'll be successful in this class.
She is such an engaging and caring professor. I 100% recommend taking her class!

I really enjoyed this course, I thought it was super interesting. The assignments and workload isn't bad at all, just weekly discussion posts, short lectures, readings, and film viewings. This class was online, but Professor Winstead seemed lovely and really into what she was teaching, as well. I would definitely recommend this course.

The class was pretty easy, although the TA I had for this class graded a little harder than necessary for a GE class. Like she was taking points off for unnecessary reasons I feel like just so the class was taken more seriously (that's what I at least thought). Anyways, I recommend.

Dr. Winstead was the sweetest lady! The class was a breeze with the exception of my TA that took the fun out of it. Dr. Winstead herself was very responsive and caring and made the class as unstressful as she could. She is super kind, just wish her TA's had the same energy. Bethany Geiger is the one to avoid- tough grader and passive aggressive.

She gives good lectures, I will say that. But she makes this class too hard for what the class should actually be grading. The assignments for "comprehension" are more about "are you creative in this weirdly specific area"?  Would NEVER take again. I'm a creative writing MAJOR and I think this is the most annoying set of assignments I've ever had.

She is very approachable and her course materials were interesting. I had her for a second session class, so it felt a bit rushed. However, I think that was more due to the class being only a half semester long. There were no essays, only discussion posts and worksheets to complete every week. The final was a creative project! Her grading was easy.

100% my favorite professor I've had. Professor Winstead is SO caring of her students, a very fair grader, passionate about women's literature, and is quite funny, sweet, and adorable. All of our weekly lectures and assignments were interesting and stimulating. I even signed up to take another course with her next semester! Take a class with her!!!!

Enough good things couldnt be said about Professor Winstead. She is extremely caring and passionate about the content she teaches and forms a bond with each of her students through personalized feedback on all of your assignments. Weekly quizzes are a bit specific at times, but she is truly a gem

I am not interested in english at ALL but Karen made it reasonable - she is very passionate & bubbly. The class also didn't require that much reading at one time. Pretty easy A if you show up, take notes, take the quizzes, do assignments, & go to recitation. Not a hard class by any means, but it won't be a total blast if you don't care about ENG.

Karen is my favorite professor that I have encountered during my tenure as an English major, and I'm now a senior! Her lectures are FASCINATING! If you don't show up, though, you won't pass as her lectures are what quizzes are based on. If you miss lecture though, she'll meet with you either during office hours OR whenever you can meet her! 11/10!!

Took her Chaucer class. She is definitely passionate, but the way she grades is rough. Weekly quizzes with super specific questions make up a large majority of grade; the only way to get the answers is to take detailed notes in class because she doesn't post slides. Definitely very passionate and caring though (very flexible on late assignments)

Her prompts for assignments/projects are vague, she provides no specific rubric but then gives out poor grades with only personal comments. Doesnt allow revision, doesnt posts slides online. Lectures are repetitive and boring.

Took vampire literature. Maybe it was my own fault for not being as interested in vampires as the rest of my class, but by the end of this class I never want to see or read another vampire story. There is a quiz every week and many weeks her questions were worded to trick you. On quiz she would ask about books (like twilight) that Ive never read

Of my favorite professors I have taken at Ohio State for my BA of English, and I'm a senior. You show up to class and you get all of the answers for the quizzes, she is flexible with all of her deadlines and you can write about almost anything, and she grades your essays within 2 days. Very passionate and loves to listen to students' opinions.

This was a grad class,  so this might be useful for a smaller audience. Karen was one of the most compassionate profs I've had this year, and her feedback is super positive if you put in a little effort. She's very willing to work with you and flexible on project ideas. I'm not a medievalist, but I'd recommend her!

Dr. Winstead is the best! Does not care about stupid minor details; she wants you to know the big picture things, which is really helpful for an English class. I learned so much, but it didn't even feel like a chore. Show up to lecture and you get the answers to the quizzes. Fair grader.

The class was all about monsters in literature and Professor Winstead's lectures were thorough and interesting. There was a lot of reading and film watching, but the workload was light with short weekly quizzes and an online final. If you can't keep up with the reading it's easy to get a lot of information from the lectures.

For 2201 just show up to class and take notes and you'll ace it. The quizzes and final are verbatim from the lecture notes and are easy enough to google if needed. There are 5 papers but those are TA graded, just don't be an idiot and you'll get at least 7/10. Especially lenient on the final paper. No attendance but you won't pass without it.

She was very passionate about the subject material and clearly knew what see was talking about. The class itself was interesting and she had thought provoking lectures. Her problem is that she is a very tough paper grader. If you have to many grammatical problems then your paper will be an immediate D. Otherwise HW and Quizzes are generally easy.

She was very passionate about her subject matter and offered stimulating insight into both the films and literature and possibilities for comparative analysis. Can seem a bit pretentious but, feel she just tries too hard sometimes. She does like to talk, but offers opportunities for students to respond, with a failure on the students part to do so.

Prof. Winstead really has a passion for what she teaches, and it shows.  She's interesting, and the entire class was SUPER easy until the final--out of the blue, it was extremely hard, poorly-written, and lots of us struggled.  Overall I loved her though.  I'm taking another class with her.

You can tell she's very passionate about what she's teaching. Lectures can be somewhat boring but she does her best to keep you interested. She makes sure students understand before moving on and even points out some topics that will be on the weekly quiz. Expect to get a lot of emails asking for notes because a student had to miss class.
Prof. Winstead is a fantastic teacher. She has a grasp on the material well beyond the scope of the class, and was somehow able to make Medieval womens lit interesting.

Dr. Winstead is an amazing teacher. The Arthurian Legends class she teaches is really fun and she is clearly an expert.Class discussions are interesting and help you understand the material. Not too hard just a bit of work. If you read the books you'll be fine. I just love her-- she's very funny and I very much enjoyed her class.
