I didn't like the books we read and I didn't understand what she wanted on our papers. We just sat around and talked about sex most of the time (one of THOSE professors). I got an A, though - so I think it was easy.

I would recommend this class to anyone. I was nervous at first about this course but Angel made me feel confident in my writing skills and prepared us to complete assignments and we had good discussions in class. You have a discussion due each week which got a little tedious but this is a 4 credit hour course. 4 essays and a final group project.

Professor Evans was a great educator and you could tell she really cared about getting us excited about writing. Assignments were not considered late until after 24hrs after the due date which was really helpful. Really liked this class and would recommend it to anyone.
Evans ensures that you are well informed on assignments (there are 4 essays to write). She is willing to know your personal life and makes the environment feel full.

Dr. Bogen is an amazing person and instructor. I took her class for a GE requirement, and I am so happy I did. She is so easy to talk to, and very understanding of circumstances. Minimal homework, and a few papers. Very reasonable for a GE english class.

I loved this class!! I took it to fulfill a GE requirement and went into it expecting it to be boring but Anna's curriculum was engaging and interesting. The group discussions were centered around real-world topics and were interesting to learn about. She is very caring and understanding of each student's individual circumstances as well.
I had her for the general education seminar and she is a very sweet and caring lady. She grades late assignments and gives full credit and the class is overall very easy.

Lauren is a very kind and knowledgeable person, who made this class very interesting. Our grade was mostly made up of small reading quizzes over the books we read and a handful of papers, which were all graded very fairly. She was always very helpful and accessible with any questions or accommodations as well. Would highly recommend!

I had a difficult semester and got very behind in her class, she was sympathetic and didn't take off points for late submissions. As long as you read assignment instructions and follow them, you can get 100% in the class.

The best professor I have taken till now, she gives us a chance to revise our papers after submitting them and offers extra credit throughout the course, she gives full points on any assignments which are not part of the main papers and excuses us for a late submission.
I had a tough semester and she never took late penalty

Shes honestly super nice and understanding. This was a hard semester for me and I turned in a lot of of late work, but she never gave me a penalty for it. Very easy to communicate with and sends a nice message at the start of every week.

Megan is sweet and she cares about her students. The class is mainly group work, but she's always available to give feedback. Was the class super interesting? Well, is business writing super interesting? Actually, focus on independent group projects and student presentations made it more bearable than it would have been. She's a good person!

I had the unfortunate experience of having Kerns for both business writing  and professional writing . Both classes were nearly identical in their dryness and content. Megan is the least compelling professor I have ever met in the English department. You are almost guaranteed an A just by showing up, but even that is easier said than done.

The class wasn't difficult, as it's a writing GE course the grades come from all the paper assignments. Class time was spent mainly discussing readings & peer editing, class always seemed to be led more by students than by professor. She is nice & gives help if you ask, but she didn't really teach that much

You know how some instructors aspire to inspire, while others are just 'there'? She's one of the latter. She's not difficult, but that's because she didn't teach. She read directly from powerpoints prepped by someone else. She wrote poetry as the class read aloud. Students were treated like kindergarteners. And she took months to grade anything.

He is certainly one of the best professors at OSU. Professor Davis really cares for students and wants them to succeed. The readings can sometimes be challenging, but he explains them in great detail and is fantastic at teaching. Grades are mostly exams, but they're not hard because he clearly states what you need to know...just take good notes!

Though there is a lot of reading, this man deserves a Nobel Peace Prize. Favorite professor at OSU. Well-versed, great vocabulary, and interesting lecturer. Attendance is graded, but he's flexible and understanding. Gives hints during lectures about exams. I wish I took his class in person because he genuinely seems so cool! Choose him!!

Highly recommend taking professor Davis. His coursework is challenging and thought provoking and I feel I gained a lot from this class. I am normally not a fan of sci-fi but loved the readings in the class and the discussions. There was a good amount of homework (normally readings) but not an excessive amount which I appreciated.

Professor Davis is very intelligent and does a great job in teaching the class. The only grades are from the four exams we took throughout the semester and those are based on his online lecture videos. Exams aren't hard, you should easily be able to get an A or B as long as you watch the lecture videos and take notes.
This is one of my favorite classes I have ever taken at OSU. Professor Davis is a caring, intelligent, and articulate professor that stands alone in his openness to ideas and discussion.

I've taken a class with Professor Davis twice now, and I truthfully wish he could teach all of my classes. He is really wonderful at challenging you to consider the impact your education has on humanity generally, and really cares about your well-being and learning capacity. He challenges students to make up their own minds and helps them do so.
An engaging and up to date professor.

Professor Davis is awesome. I hate to say this but I started and completed every project on the day it was due, and got A's on all of them (that being said I like to write). Just read the books he assigns. Super chill and understanding. I'd grab a beer with him.

Pretty chill guy and straightforward class. Lots of group projects which he ended up having in place of quizzes which he gave time to work in class, no need to have to work outside of class in that respect. It is a literature class so you have to read but he applies the material to a lot of things outside the text and has interesting discussions.

When I saw that Prof. Daviss section of 3372 was listed as climate fiction, I was intrigued, and I was not disappointed. We read 5 books in the semester and had a lot of discussion on larger themes + implications of ideas discussed in the novels. Hes very flexible in terms of in class assignments. I highly recommend this class.

I signed up for this course ready for Harry Potter, and instead got climate fiction, end of the world dystopia, don't look forward to your future planet because there won't be one. It was pretty heavy and wasn't very literature focused, despite having a few novels that we had to read. Do not take if you have anxiety.

Do not miss your chance to take a class with Tommy Davis before graduating. His lectures are amazing and super informative and we had so many interesting discussions about the anthropocene and environmental humanities. I feel like I learned more in this class than in all my other classes combined and gained a new outlook on the world.

Honestly the best professor I've had thus far at Ohio State. I've taken three classes with Prof. Davis, and I can honestly say that no other professor even comes close to him. He has a genuine passion and personality built for education, learning, and revolution. If you wanna know what the last comment means take his courses.

He's one of the best professors I've had in four years as an English major. He's really helpful with materials (and general life advice) and always listens to students.  Lectures are interesting and you can tell Davis is engaged with the material. He's really bright and socially conscious, too.  I wish I could take more classes with him!

Professor Davis is one of the most caring professors I've ever had -- he extended paper deadlines and provided sources if necessary. Initially I was not interested in the course topic, but his lectures and humor changed that and it changed my passions in literature and in life. Seriously. He's interesting, clear-cut, and no nonsense.
Absolutely fantastic instructor.  Course was literally life-changing.

Really interesting class. He's super helpful and knows his stuff; also has a good sense of humor. Class was never boring! Would recommend to anyone interested in modernism. Probably one of the best instructors I've ever had at Ohio State.
Super helpful super nice guy
Easily the best professor in Ohio State's English Department. A role model for any english student looking to teach at a college level. Simply an amazing individual on every level.

Fantastic professor! His class is challenging at first, because he is very intelligent, but don't get intimidated. Stick with it and it will be very rewarding. He is a wealth of knowledge and is genuinely interested in what he teaches. He is also very approachable and willing to help. Would recommend.
Gorgeous hipster guy. Intelligent and interested, would recommend.

Professor Davis is a little intimidating at first, because he's so intelligent, but he's very approachable and receptive to questions.  I think he works hard to unpack material and he's extremely knowledgeable.  He's always highly prepared for class and grades papers fairly/promptly.  His class is the best one I've taken here at OSU.
No Comments

Great professor!  He is very enthusiastic about the subject material, makes the material interesting and understandable.  His class can be somewhat of a challenge, but as long as you attend lectures, it pays off in the end.

For a three credit hour GE this is a rough class with lots of work. First half is heavy on reading with some papers, second half is group project focused. Assignment instructions were unclear at times but Dr. Herman is always helpful and seems like a cool person who engages with her class.

Whatever you do, do not take this class. There is an excessive amount of homework. She grades EXTREMELY harshly and does not offer much grace when grading. Complete waste of time. Did not learn anything.

Dr. Herman is very available outside of class and really does want to help students. Her pre-lecture activities did get somewhat annoying throughout the semester. A large portion of the class was based on a group project.

Lots of lectures, takes attendance every day, hard grader, if you speak up in class and act like youre paying attention she will like you. Find a good group for the projects. Need to give best effort, but its more work than thought. Not horrible but probably wouldnt take this specific class again

PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HER. SHE IS AWFUL. ONE OF THE WORST GRADERS IN MY ENTIRE 4 YEARS HERE. SO RUBRIC HEAVY. SHE DOESN'T OFFER CONSTRUCTIVE FEEDBACK. SHE GRADES VERY HARSHLY FOR A SECOND LEVEL ENGLISH COURSE. DO NOT TAKE HER.

I really liked Dr. Herman. I saw some reviews talking about how she was a hard grader, but that wasnt my experience. I thought she was very fair and if you put in a moderate effort you should be fine! She was very caring and personable and seemed to want her students to really succeed. The class was a decent bit of work at times but manageable.
dont take her class if you want to pass.

Dr Herman was my absolute favorite teacher this semester. She is super nice and wants everyone to succeed. The class is laid out well and as long as you do your work to the best of your ability and show up to class, it was really easy to get a good grade. Only reason I didn't get an A is because I forgot about a few assignments.

Not a single assignment graded by her was above a 95% mark this semester (the high, not just for me) but her averages are generally high, so everyone basically gets a B+ for showing up. But if you want that A you gotta be the best in her lecture, for basically every assignment

Dr. Herman's class was structured really well. The resume writing, cover letter, etc. are all things that students looking for internships would need to do anyway but you get feedback and course credit. She is super accessible and nice but she can be a tough grader. If you put in the effort you get a lot out of this class.

She is one of the best yet toughest professors I have ever had, in any subject. She is easily accessible outside of class and gives excellent feedback. But she is a tough grader, one of the toughest I have ever known. I remember cursing her back when I was taking the class coz she made us work so hard to get a good grade. And uum, yep she is hot XD

Herman was a pretty great prof. The class itself was different from a typical writing course and challenged me often. Herman helped me to develop as a professional writer and explore how writing can be applicable to my engineering degree and leveraged in my career search. Also, shes not "hot" but is well dressed and fun to be around.

Dr. Herman is a great teacher. She cares a lot about learning but as others have mentioned she is a hard grader sometimes. The assignments in this class are not hard. If you show up to class you will do well.

Dr. Herman gives a lot by providing feedback, but she is one of the strictest teachers I have ever had, especially for a English class where grading is vague. No matter how hard I worked, I always seemed to end up with a Cs in assignments due to some petty reason such as referencing/and or citations, or some vague description about missing content.
Dr. Herman is very helpful and willing to help. However, when it comes to grading, she is pretty strict. Rules are rule.
Jennifer was a very nice and helpful teacher.  She made the topics (relatively) easy to understand.  Lots of reading for class(5 books + articles) but not too much actual homework.
She is a wonderful teacher. Do not worry about the difficult online readings, you will discuss them in class. Attendance is mandatory but class is very intersting, you won't be disapointed.

Highley is an amazing professor and cares about your success. He can be a bit hard to read at times but that is his sense of humor. He is always willing to meet with you outside of class and look at your papers! Take his class!

Everyone that I talked to in my class absolutely loves him and was sad to see the class end. He really cares about students succeeding and brings Shakespeare to life. He's really helpful in office hours, but you have to show him that you want to learn not just get an A. He will call you out for not participating but only bc he loves Shakespeare.

Prof. Highley is a wonderful man with a great sense of British humor. I really enjoy his lectures. That being said, he is a really tough grader on his exams, and they're all essay and short answer/analysis. I felt that he took off a lot of unnecessary points on my essays with little to no explanation.

Took AU ’11; I can’t believe Highley has bad reviews. Honestly the best English prof at OSU. He is knowledgeable and helpful, extremely funny, and very understanding of his students when they have problems (both in and out of class). He made me love Shakespeare. Keeps interest and gives a lot of feedback. Recommend.

Took AU '11; I can't believe Highley has bad reviews on here. He is by far the best professor in the English department; funny, helpful, knowledgeable, and completely understanding of his students when problems arise. He works with his students to get them to understand Shakespeare, and he makes it fun and interesting. He is an incredible professor

Highley is incredibly passionate about Shakespeare and has a great sense of humor. The readings can be tedious at times. He grades leniently and is more than willing to offer assistance outside of class. Oh, and he's British. I would highley (ha.) recommend him to anyone. :)

Prof Highley made things pretty interesting. He's enthusiastic about Shakespeare, can be funny (especially with his British humor). We read a lot of plays so at times the work load could be pretty heavy but he didn't grade too terribly hard. I learned a lot from this class.

We read seven Shakespeare plays during the quarter, and Prof. Highley led very interesting discussions about them.  He knows Shakespeare really well, and I learned a lot from his class.  I highly recommend taking Shakespeare with Prof. Highley.

He made Shakespeare fun. At times the lecture seemed to drag, but he always managed to capture our interests in the end. He brought us into the topic in a way that most others haven't before. He was interested in teaching and interested in our interpretations. He was also pretty funny at times!

Boring! He's a nice guy and sometimes funny, but he doesn't know how to connect with students/facilitate discussion. Pretty much shuts down all student comments. Class was really unfocused and jumped around a lot. He grades easily, but I didn't learn anything. He tells you potential exam questions, but they still take a long time!
i just saw your rebuttal to the comments and i have to say YOU ARE FUNNY!!!

Fun class. He's hilarious. Always cracking jokes and making fun of the time period. We had quizzes over the reading material but they were EXTREMELY easy if you read the stuff, and sometimes even if you didn't. Papers were easy and also graded easily. Take this class if you have any interest in London and need the GEC! You wont regret it!!

Dr. Highley is a fantastic professor!  It's rare for a Ren.Studies scholar to be so adept at reading film and looking at current cultural representations of Early Modern figures.  A fairl but tough grader on papers, and will definitely call you out if you bs anything.  I will definitely seek him out again!

Arrogant. He is the only teacher since 6th grade who has made me cry. Claims to want your opinion but basically tells you yours is wrong.  Comes off as if he thinks he knows everything just because he is British. Needs to get off the high horse. I can tell he is an intelligent man, but he portrays himself as if he is better than others.

Highly is absolutely AMAZING. Seriously. Okay, his lectures can kind of be boring, and he goes off topic a lot, but outside of class, he is amazing. I am taking another class with him in hopes of maybe having a more lucid experience, but he's great once you get to know him.

Professor Highley is no doubt the best professor I've had at this university.  Studying abroad with Highley was the chance of a lifetime! He helped me revise several drafts of the same paper...extremely helpful at office hours and his class is interesting! I highley recommend him :)
Highley is funny and nice, but grades kinda harshley. But I did enjoy the class and his anecdotes are pretty amusing and they make the classes easier to go to.
Though the class was pretty boring (and long), it was not hard to get an A.  I went in expecting it to be difficult, (given the material) but the quizzes were very easy.

Highley is a great professor.  He loves Shakespeare and knows more about him than anyone you'll ever meet. Professor Highley can be a tad bit arrogant at times and he has an annoying habit of not looking you in the eye when you speak to him, but other than that, he's great.
Professor Hightly was very unhelpful and very vague with his comments on papers.  I would not suggest taking a class with him if you can avoid it.
he loves his subject, and it shows.  An AMAZING course- i actually looked forward to class twice a week.  I highly reccommend Highley- (pardon the pun), he's hilarious and you'll learn a ton.
I've never had him in class either, but as my advisor he was also NO help at all.  He answered none of my questions and pretty much shoved me out of his office without having accomplished anything.
Highley is a great guy. He helped advise me when my advisor was not available. Really interesting!
Good Professor.  He loved his subject and you could tell.  I enjoyed his class

Who ever thought taking a Shakespeare class would be fun! With Prof. Highley class is always interesting.  His sense of humor really got the class going.  Expect to see a lot of red on your papers when you get them back, he knows what he is looking for
Great teacher.  Very interested in what he is teaching, makes it fun for the class.  Really gets the class involved in discussions.
One of the people who make the OSU Department of English blossom.
he is an okay teacher and is fun in class.  however, he is not a good advisor-- if you go into his office hours he will just stare at you.
He was a great teacher. He knew his material and he made interesting and worthwhile. I definitely recommend his class. If you're looking for a cake walk, this is not the class for you.
Great professor
No Comments

Awesome professor for ENGLISH 2367.06. So knowledgeable about disability studies and english. For an advanced english class, it was easier than I expected. Research paper final is fairly tough. Easy grader if you put effort in. A few participation points but not too crazy.

While the English 1110 classes is standardized across teachers she still tries to make it fun. Some lectures are boring but it's not her fault. Her hands are really tied on how to teach the class. She is fun, engaging and relatable.
Don't buy the textbook (I never used it) and it appears the worst assignment grade she gave a student was a 94%.

Did not follow the grading promises in the syllabus (said things would be graded within a week, its been almost a month)
Did not respond to emails
Very frequently posted assignments with the assignment explanation was in a link that were not accessible to students and did not change the accessibility until the night it was due

Assigns way too much reading. Tell me why I'm being asked to read 300 pages over the span of two days. Weekly journal assignments that ask for your thoughts on things we talked about in class yet somehow there is always something to nitpick about your opinions. Counted 50-100 "um"s per lecture. Definitely thinks he's too good to be teaching.

He lectures for the whole time but often opens it up to the class for thoughts. There are weekly journals and discussion posts. There is also a few larger writing assignments and quizzes. Everything is graded off of effort. As long as you put in the effort and try on your assignments and it shows, you will do fine in this class.

Really really enjoyed the "Themes in Science Fiction and Fantasy" course! Attendance was not required but I ended up going more often than not just because he is so passionate about the topic and I liked hearing the lectures. No exams, just a weekly journal, two short projects, and an essay. He's also very very caring and flexible with deadlines.

If you like long lectures, then this is the professor for you. He lectures for the entire class and often holds his students over. His voice is incredibly monotonous so it can be difficult to pay attention. Although this is a GE course there is a lot of homework. Luckily, most of the assigments don't require alot of critical thinking.
Is not clear with what he is expecting on assignments. Tough grader and is unforgiving if he does not agree with your thoughts .

Long and mundane lectures, yet definitely taught me how to analyze literature in new ways. Lots of hw and papers. Clear grading criteria and direct expectations. Take if you like to analyze many works, and write your own poetry, but be ready for long lectures and lots of hw.

Brewer is one of these professors who projects himself to be "too good" for teaching and too smart for students at Ohio State. It's like he could not care less. I recommend him if you're someone who enjoys being condescended to. If you're a dedicated major, avoid him.

Dr. Brewer is one of the most pretentious professors I have had at Ohio State. He assigns a lot of writing assignments but gives minimal to no feedback. His lectures are boring, unorganized, and you can tell he would rather be anywhere else than teaching. Not the hardest class in the world, but save yourself the migraine and take someone else.

Intro to Fiction with Professor Brewer is a great class. I would say is that as long as you put the work in, then it'll pay off. If you have questions, Dr. Brewer is willing to set up times to discuss essays and whatnot. He also gives great feedback on each of the writing assignments, which he grades with generosity given the writing's nature.

lectures are useless but you have to go, always seems unprepared, pretentious. i learned nothing in the class. grades fairly easily and assignments aren't difficult. really all you have to do is show up to class and watch the movies. but his lectures are like watching paint dry. feels like a waste of time and money.
Great guy. The participation grade can really hurt or help your grade. The books we read are really good and so are all the short stories.

He has a bad rep for being "boring," but I don't think it's fair for him to have a bad grade. Some of his lectures did drag on but his grading was lax, he was constantly available, and discussed a lot of things in class that he was looking for in homework. Nice guy. Had him for intro film and intro fiction. Hardest part of having him is attendance.

Super easy class. Theres a reading journal due each week thats very subjective so its free points. He says participation and attendance affects your grade heavily but I missed at least 5 classes and rarely spoke in class. I didnt read any of the books, just short summaries and I only read a few of the short stories and passed with a B

I showed up to every lecture I could (as useless as they were) and was at a 98% until the final exam which butchered my grade (unreasonable grading) only to end up just shy of an A (92.88). I pleaded with the professor to round up my grade or at least regrade my final exam, Nothing. (Too many As in the class I guess) This professor is a jerk.

I really liked Intro to Fiction. Classes are fun as it is mostly discussion based. I enjoyed the readings. Prepare for a weekly righting assignment, monthly papers, and a final paper. If you like reading, and are good at writing, this class is for you! He is explicit in what is required of you.

Lectures we're super useless. Ditched many times (had friend sign me in). It's film studies, should be fun, but he makes it so boring. In terms of class, pretty easy, no lie. Never did any homework. Final was on Carmen. If you take the class, you'll do fine, but it's just so boring. He also says "um" a lot, to the point where you can take shots.
lectures are extremely long and boring, only 2 papers and a final for a grade, would not take again
This class is incredibly boring. Lectures are long and dry. He'll use way too many examples for one concept. Show up, pay decent attention, take notes, watch the movies, and you should be fine.

I am a film major so I thought I would love this class but Brewer is SO boring. His lectures are too long with dumb partner questions at the end. He always seems very unprepared in his lectures and says "um" after every word. He uses annoying hand gestures and speaks so softly, you can't hear him. My TA didn't seem to know much about film, either.

I feel that other comments specifically on this class with Brewer were harsh.  He's pretty clear with expectations even if the TAs weren't.  Brewer makes it fairly easy to do well and tries to make lectures interesting.

His lectures were a bit boring, but he covered a lot of material in a short time period. He would sometimes look above the students instead of right at them, which is a bit weird. He would occasionally make funny jokes or pop culture references. I felt that the grading by his TAs was incredibly easy.
Ah, do not take this professor for this class. I am senior English major, have an interest in the text that we were reading, but could not get engaged in his lectures.  Save yourself the misery.

This class is truly a bore. Brewer is not interesting and neither are his TAs. The grading is extremely frustrating because the TAs will take points off of essay responses and quiz responses for not making points that were not asked of you in the prompt. It is as if they want you to read their minds. Waste of time. Awful class. Don't take.

Seemed somewhat average.  Grading was completely at the hands of the TA, so I can't really fault him on that (even though I'm doing well in the class, it seemed designed for one not to get an A). Lots of reading. Did give a bonus. Sometimes condescending, but he had his moments. It just was bad to have this class in Gateway....

This is literally the worst class I have ever taken. It is SO BORING, the professor assigns way too much reading prior to each lecture, and the grading is ridiculous. Absolutely NONE of the material is interesting. Brewer is just awful. His lectures are useless, yet you are required to attend. I promise you will regret taking this class.

Extremely boring and seems disinterested in the class. Assigns ungodly amounts of reading, then assigns both a quiz and a midterm on the same weekend. Fortunately all writing is online. Sparknotes is essential to survive the class. Mandatory attendance is a bummer, though  -- you could probably do just as well on assignments without his lectures.

I love this professor. Although his voice is somewhat monotone he tries to make the material interesting and occasionally makes corny jokes and bad movie references. The questions he poses in lectures are the exact same questions he asks on the midterm so pay attention and you will do fine. If your willing to do the reading then take this class.

Class is held in a movie theater.  Lighting is dim and he doesn't keep your attention.  Tons of reading for a gen ed! His TA's will grade you like you're in grad school.  Feedback is sparse and not helpful.  He phrases his questions very vaguely, but expects a specific answer.  Avoid if possible.

This is literally the worst class I've ever taken and I took 8am calculus... Absurd amounts of reading for a GenEd, online quizes that open Fri @ noon & close Sat @ midnight, required attendance for a large lecture class, and unclear grading rubric. If you're looking for a fun,easy gen ed to meet your lit requirement, keep looking; this isn't it.
He was a great teacher, I think I just wasn't into the topic and therefore got bored very easily.

I took H590.03 with David, and he is probably one of the best English professors I've had at OSU. He is a genuinely nice and funny guy who has an INCREDIBLE amount of knowledge and passion for English (especially 18th century British literature). I'm not a big fan of that time period, but he made the class enjoyable.

He is refreshingly similar to the POSITIVE comments on his ratemyprofessors page.  :)  This class is very easy and fun, especially if essay-writing comes easily for you.  It?s extremely funny, kind, and helpful.  Very eloquent as a previous comment said, and articulate but down-to-earth.  Highly recommended!!

Not a very good teacher. Do not take him unless you want to hear him repeat the same questions over and over and over. There was a point in the class when no one would say anything and he would admit to asking the wrong kinds of questions. Very poor lecture abilities. And every paper was a repeat of the last. His feedback is not useful eiether.Avoi

I love this guy. He was all about class discussion and letting us come up with ideas instead of forcing all of his on us. His selection of literature  was relevant to the subject but not the same monotonous crap. I love the way he talks, it's so... eloquent. He's really nice and listens to what everyone has say, no matter how stupid.

This is probably one of the easiest and most fun classes I've ever taken. Sometiems he can be a bit tedious as it seems to take him 100 years to get out a sentence, but overall he's really nice and funny. He's incredibly eloquent so if you don't understand big words, avoid  him. (ha.) Otherwise, he's great! Highly recommended!

Dr. Brewer's witty, free-form lectures are still with me five years later.  He is the finest professor I've yet encountered--he's brilliant, utterly unpretentious, generous with his time and funny as hell.    The writing projects for ENG 531 are among the best and most enjoyable things I've written, academic or otherwise.  Please take his classes.
I nearly fell asleep in this class every time it met.  He hasn't learned how to sustain and encourage discussion like he should of by this point in his career.

He only jabbers and doesn't listen. No chance for forum-like discussion. Focuses too much on his "eloquence" using vocabulary that might distance him from his students. He's supposed to be our advisor! And he was so frustrating.

Very smart guy with a good sense of humor and probably the NICEST, most polite professor I have had at OSU. Class a little boring at times, but I liked listening for his linguistic quirks, like "I don't mean to rehearse this again" and "This scene is delicious." Take his class - he's great.

Brewer was very helpful with everything in the class, but there was just SO much reading. Also, our discussions in class were annoying because he would want us to talk so he would just sit there and stare at us - but when he did talk, the "um"s were out of control.
Helpful, but said "um" before, after, and during just about every word.  annoying quirk, but decent teacher.

David Brewer is a good teacher who really enjoys what he does, in the case of my class the early British Novel. He was a good teacher to all of his students, and if I had to choose between him and another teacher for another class, I would choose David.
Great prof-- very enthusiastic, knowledgeable and prepared.
He's really into the material and fun to take a class with. Interesting Guy.
Brewer is an enthusiastic and encouraging instructor.  We need more of these!

Really great professor, super passionate about writing and genuinely wants everyone to improve. She's super funny and kinda makes everyone get to know each other, great vibes. Feedback is very direct (which I liked), just make sure you're prepared for it.

Greatest professor eeeeeever! I love her. Everyone loves her. She's so understanding, kind, funny, and really cares about your development as a writer. Gives great feedback and creates a super comfortable environment to share your work in. Definitely take a class with her and read her book if you haven't already!

No lectures! I felt like I bonded with everyone in this class, we played games in order to better learn how to include drama into teaching. This was my favorite class of my semester and the only one I would ever be willing to wake up and go to on a Monday morning. Highly recommend!

Professor Boyle was so incredibly sweet, and her classes were so enjoyable. The classes were very long and sometimes a little tedious, but overall it was great. She is really passionate about all her students being successful, and will always help if you ask. She's amazing! Definitely recommend!

I was not a fan of this teacher nor this class. She made this very enjoyable material very much unbearable. Readings were obnoxious and not conducive to learning. Disorganized class structure, yet wanted to emphasize structure in our own future classrooms. Funny. Do not recommend taking her nor this class.

I think maybe she just didn't like me for whatever reason, but she graded me harshly. It is a literature class, but be prepared to be graded like it's a composition class. The material itself is pretty great and if you are an education major, she does give you some good resources for the classroom. A lot of people just taking this for an easy A.

Highly recommend! Decent amount of reading but all really short children's chapter books (Charlotte's Web, Holes, etc.) and you just need to know enough to discuss book events with your group. Mostly small group discussion based class with small responses each week (200 words). No exams, just a final project. Strict on attendance (can miss 2).

Ms. Boyle is such a sweet lady and teacher. She makes class fun and engaging. There is quite a lot of reading (I think 10 novels in a semester?), but it's all children's literature, so they're easy reads. There are no tests or exams. Definitely be prepared to read novels and articles to prepare, but the class itself is quite easy and entertaining.

This class is intense with busy work, but it's also a six-week course. Dr. Squires has the material well organized on Carmen and provides helpful videos/lectures each week. She also responds promptly to emails and is a lenient grader with many of the assignments.

Professor Squires was a great teacher overall. I took an online asynchronous class with her over the summer, and she taught me a lot in a short six-week span. The class did feature a lot of homework (multiple activities due Mon/Wed/Fri), but the work felt meaningful and helped me grasp material that I was unfamiliar with!

Dr. Squires spends WAY too much time discussing her personal life (kids) and trying to incorporate humor such as memes, but this fails miserably. I did not truly learn anything from this class because she was SO unorganized.

Please do not take this class when there are so many easier upper-level English credits out there. She gave 8-10 assignments a week including anything from homeworks, quizzes, discussions, activities, and more. The work is so tedious and absolutely not on-par with a 3 credit hour class. This class wasn't worth it and only caused me so much stress.
Professor Squires assigns a lot, and I mean a LOT, of busy work. She's very knowledgeable about grammar but is very unapproachable when you ask her for help.

I was enrolled in Lauren's English 4572 class for Autumn semester 2021, in order to fulfill a minor requirement. Essentially, Lauren seems like a good person, but the course structure is FILLED with busy work. I would advise taking another class if possible. For reference, there were ten assignments (all worth points) due during week two alone.

Lauren was a great professor. I found the class to be really engaging and not too stressful. She wasn't a difficult grader, even though there were very few grades in the class (the whole class is out of 100 points). She wrote the textbook herself so it's online, free, and interactive, and she posts all her lecture slides online.
She'e one of the most sarcastic professors I've ever had. Went to her for office hours and she basically mocked her. Very unapproachable.

Dr. Squires is an awesome professor. Her ability to be informative but make lectures enjoyable is impeccable. She has an amazing sense of humor. I would without hesitation recommend her for any student of any major. She is in my top five educators at the college level.
OMG what an angel. Seriously. Love love love Dr. Squires and she loves her students, too. If you see her name next to a class offering, jump right on it.

I really, really liked Dr. Squires. She is so helpful and ALWAYS gets back to emails right away. She's a great teacher and you can tell she enjoys what she's teaching. I recommend taking her if you need this class. Dr. Squires knows what she's teaching, and she knows how to teach it.
So so passionate and knowledgeable. Took her for the Brit Lit survey and could not recommend more. If you attend the lectures, you'll do well.

Best professor I have had at OSU, not even close. Her class can get a bit difficult at times, but she cares about how her students do and wants them to improve every day. Take her for any class if you need to, so worth it

Professor Lockett turned a class I was dreading into a favorite! She was interesting and brought humor into her lectures. I ran into her a couple times outside of class and she was always so sweet. Class was hard and required a lot of work, but I recommend it anyway because of Professor Lockett!
Very kind and funny! There are quizzes every week but not too hard, you do have to actually do the readings tho. A final project too! But Dr. Lockett is really sweet and caring.

Professor Lockett is very passionate about what she teaches. Lectures are pretty interesting at times, but she doesn't post slides on Carmen. Her quizzes are insanely detailed. She told our class that the final cumulative "quiz" (worth way more than any other quiz, basically a final) would be about "big ideas" from the class, which was a lie.

I took this class because it's required for my major. I really do not care about medieval history or classic literature, but Professor Lockett made this class so interesting and fun. Even on days where I didn't want to go to class I would because her enthusiasm for the topics always made the lectures entertaining.
Leslie Lockett is an OSU gem. So kind and caring. If you want to get an A in her class, you will.

I loved Prof. Lockett. Some of the content was a little harder than expected to be honest, but she was very supportive and as long as you follow the guidelines, rubric you should be fine. Decent amount of work with this class but its more time consuming than it is difficult.

Leslie was very knowledgeable about a LOT of things, even outside of the course material. It was interesting to hear all she knew and learn from her. The class has quite a bit of work, but she's a fairly easy grader. The class was discussion-based and it made for some engaging discussions.

Dr. Lockett is one of the most amazing professors I've had at OSU. She genuinely cares about student learning and success, and makes even challenging material both interesting and engaging. Classes are a mix of lecture and discussion, and as long as you do the readings, participate, and put forth effort on papers you will do well in the course.

Prof Lockett is an absolute sweetheart. Her paper feedback is more encouraging than constructive, but she is very accepting of all ideas. No electronics allowed and all materials must be printed for class.

Difficult class, but she is always ready to help. She grades easily but expects a lot of effort. Ask her anything about cheese, and she's immediately your best friend. I would gladly take her class again! Kind and caring.
Sweet, intelligent and helpful. Highly recommended.

This woman is absolutely wonderful. She made absolutely everything we did seem important and interesting and was willing to explain more than once if we felt she was unclear. A sweet, kind woman who does an excellent job teaching. I would take any class with her. Don't pass up the opportunity to have her.

Does a good job facilitating discussions. Only gives out reading quizzes if she finds that people aren't speaking up during discussion. Fair grader. Her feedback was really helpful and she makes her expectations very clear. Wasn't a big fan of the stuff we read, but got lots of practice with different methods of critical analysis.

She was extremely helpful and loved to engage her students! You really felt like she was trying to help you and she knew what she was talking about. She was very helpful. Essays were easy, and attendance was "mandatory" but she never kept attendance.

Prof. Lockett was ok. She had a tendency to micro-focus on the most minor details of the text and generally ignored the bigger picture. Class discussions drew on far too long and could get quite boring at times. She doesn't really grade too hard, though. If you're not an idiot, you'll get an A with just a little bit of effort.

I loved Leslie! She always walked into the room with a smile on her face and was incredibly sweet to everyone. She knows just about everything there is to know about Medieval literature and I always felt comfortable asking her questions. I got an A, and felt like I had to work for it, but not too hard. All the assignments were reasonable.

Having her as a prof was one of the most pleasurable academic experiences of my undergraduate career!  Her breadth of knowledge is staggering, her lectures are so helpful for understanding the material, and her sweet disposition and willingness to help made for a wonderful course.  Dr. Lockett's a class act, take her courses if you can.

Professor Lockett is one of those people who brighten your day as soon as they walk in the room.  She is obviously knowledgeable and interested in her subject.  There are great class discussions if you speak up, and she is definitely happy to help you.  My favorite professor I've had by far!

Professor Lockett is very sweet and really cares about helping students understand the material.  She is very knowledgeable and is excellent at creating a comfortable, non-threatening classroom atmosphere.  I would highly recommend her.

Leslie is such a sweet woman. She really cares about her students and will do anything she can to help them understand. Do the readings she assigns and join the discussions and she'll love you. Also, whoever you take for 398 is your English advisor, so if you can take her for 398, do it! She's so helpful, and one of the best professors I've had.

An authority on medieval Lit and languages, she is also a very skilled professor and friend. Go to class, contribute to discussion and do the readings, and you've an easy A. One of the warmest individuals I've met in my academic career, absolutely love Leslie.

Dr. Lockett is an authority on Anglo-Saxon Literature. She is extremely helpful and pliable with those who find the going a little difficult. The quizzes and exams are easy if you keep pace with the workload.
He really cares about his students and wants the class to be engaging and fun for everyone.

Joey created a welcoming, laid-back environment for his English 2261 - Intro to Fiction class. He valued every student's opinion and genuinely cared about what you had to say. Joey made the class very accessible and constantly encouraged students to ask questions over email. Very easy class if you show up and do the reading.

Ferraro has amazing, insightful lectures. He really makes a huge effort to be accessible and fair to his students. Extremely accommodating and understanding. One of the best professors I have had at OSU. Genuinely cares about his students.

Prof. Ferraro is easily the best teacher Ive ever had. His lectures are always interesting and he is extremely accommodating. If you do the readings and pay attention, youll be fine. English 2261 is a stellar class only made better by his teaching, and Id recommend him to anyone.

Joey was the best instructor I have had in college so far. Very clear what the assigned work and expectations are and if you do that, it is an easy A. I would 10/10 recommend taking Narrative Medicine.

The narrative medicine class was the best English class Ive taken here. Joey is big on if you do the work and follow the instructions, you will do well. Hes a super great guy that tries to help in any way he can. You read a lot but the chosen readings are super interesting. No tests or quizzes, just papers and responses. Honestly the best!

This class was by far my favorite of the semester. There was a lot of reading, but it was easy reading for the most part. You could tell that Dr. Ferraro really does love literature. This class is definitely discussion-based, but he tries to make a way for everyone to be able to participate even if they are shyer. I would recommend this class.

She is one of the best professors you can get at Ohio State! She cares about her students, and what they're learning. She doesn't give you unnecessary assignments, everything in her class has a purpose. She has great communication skills, and makes class fun! As long as you go to class and do the assignments, you will be able to get a good grade.

Menefee was such a funny professor! I had her for one of my education content courses so while I had to be in her class I would definitely take another one with her. I will say she is blunt and swears a lot so that may catch people off guard, but she is always supportive and honest which is great when doing lesson plans or group work for teaching

Her class was so fun, and it was relatively small so it was more personal learning. She's very inclusive in the readings she selects and makes the class very fun. I would 100% take this class if you can! Its one of my favorites that I have taken.

Menefee was a great professor. She was so understanding and ready to change her class to work better for the students. You do have to read a book every week, but they're interesting, and you don't even HAVE to read them, I looked at summaries for most

This class is reading heavy, you'll need to read a book each week, but these books are current pieces of lit and are mostly easy to read and comprehend and are entertaining - and I don't really like reading. She's engaging, passionate, and fun, and makes it easy to participate and enjoy class. Not too many papers, and she is understanding usually.

Professor Buehl is a nice guy - there's no doubt about that. However, this semester he didn't grade a single thing until the *FINAL WEEK OF CLASS*. The midterm was so poorly designed he had to curve it 25 points - the average was below 72%. Grading criteria are also extremely unclear.
Easy class as long as your attend and apply yourself, great life writing skills, helpful direction from the professor.
really awesome teacher. really boring. easy A though

Jonathan was a great teacher. He definitely knew his stuff and had lots of experience to help you. However, there is a lot of reading and while projects were helpful, they were also sometimes confusing. He's a tough grader at times for the projects, but his comments are helpful and other assignments balance it out. Class discussion is encouraged.
She is really a good instructor. She gives credits easily and is always willing to help. If you take her classes seriously, you will get good grades.
Do not take her class!
Do not take her class! Unless you do not want to get high scores.

She doesnt know how to be a instructor. This is the only reason I have bad impression about my freshman year. If you are in a small class, be careful. She grades your work partly by personal impression. If you got an low grade, dont send her email you wont get any reply.  Relax, it will not gonna kill you! This was her words. God.
If you do not want to fail 1902, just drop this professor's class
choose someone else. true words

Professor Hewitt is truly one of my favorite professors at OSU. She is brilliant and very funny. Furthermore, she cares about how she teaches and regularly asks for student feedback and is open to changing class methods if students are not learning well with the class structure.

Beth is one of the smartest people Ive ever met. She knows her subject material inside and out, and she encourages the class to have great discussions. Her passion is infectious. She assigns lots of reading, but isnt a tough grader on non-essays. She extends deadlines to make things easier for her students. Shes so awesome. Take her class!!!!!!

Prof Hewitt was a great professor. She genuinely wanted to teach us. The course was more work than probably needed, but the material was intriguing. I took the course in SP20 so COVID made us have to transition lectures online, but she was able to do it fairly well & graded a little easier for the remaining weeks.

Easily one of the best professors I have had (so far) at OSU. Dr. Hewitt is very funny and very helpful if the material from the novels seems hard to understand. I had no problem approaching her outside of class with any questions and she was extremely helpful and very friendly to all of her students. Would definitely recommend her.
Beth is a brilliant, compassionate, and glorious land mermaid. She knows her subject matter so well and truly educates her students. She also has a lot of great anecdotes.

Elizabeth Hewitt could possibly be my favorite professor at Ohio State. She is so funny and really makes class interesting (since it lecture based, she does talk a lot). She encourages discussion and wants everyone to be engaged. If you like to sit on your phone a lot, don't take her class - she hates that. Lowest quiz grade is dropped as well!

Way, way too much effort required. She's a good lecturer and really digs into the material, but her expectations for the students are kinda unreasonable for a 3 credit-hour course. Hewitt expects you to read everything, write on every thing you read about, and extensively participate every week online and in class AND submit a journal every week.

Beth knows her subject matter extremely well, and she cares about the intellectual development of her students. She's easily one of the best profs at Ohio State. If you attend class and keep up with the reading, an A should be manageable.
She is very good at discussions. The downside is a lot of reading in short periods of time.

I've been in higher ed. 7 years and I can unequivocally say Beth is the best professor I've ever had. She's a fantastic discussion leader, an excellent close reader, and an absolutely hilarious person. If you're not into quirky, though, you might dislike her. One of her interests is the history of office supplies, if that tells you anything.

Hewitt is a very intelligent professor. I highly recommend her, but not for slackers. Very specific about how to succeed and holds students to it. Cares for her students and will always meet outside class. Funny. Well worth taking classes from.
Go to class. Take notes and pay attention. Try. It's as simple as that. She's AMAZING. Best class/professor I've had at OSU.

Prof. Hewitt is among the best at OSU. She wants her students to succeed: if you show some dedication, she'll more than meet you halfway. She was incredibly understanding of some family issues I experienced throughout the semester and remarkably generous with her time. She also made me love Melville. If you're an English major, take her classes!
Professor Hewitt is awesome, and she will help you out if you ask. Her lectures are dynamic, and she really cared about us as students.
Quite simply, she's awesome!
Would not recommend.
Really strict on grades, same couple of kids talk in discussion, only ever one "correct" interpretation of works- hers. oftentimes unclear about what is required as assignments. wouldn't recommend

I love Professor Hewitt! This is the second class I've taken with her, and in my opinion, she's the best at OSU.  Attend class, but some effort into the assignments, and do the reading.  She'll do just about anything for students who show a little effort.  And I'm pretty sure she's a genius.

Prof. Hewitt was a wonderful instructor! She is very passionate about this subject and she makes the subject interesting. If you do the assigned reading, you'll be fine. Highest Recommendation for her!

No quizzes in this class- but iscussions every day.  She is seriously awesome though.  As a teacher and as a person.  She really loves what she teaches.  LOTS of reading, but she picks great books (-Middlemarch..) to read during the semester.  Discussions were always lively and we had fun.  I am really going to miss her class!

Professor Hewitt is great at what she does.  She makes herself readily available to help her students. Lectures are somewhat boring but thorough (you could probably pass solely by taking good notes). She gives great feedback on papers. The only downside is that you WILL have quizzes...almost weekly. Don't get discouraged, though; TAKE HER CLASSES!

Professor Hewitt was unique in that she really helped us as students. She grades papers with a strict sense of duty, but she gives the chance for a rewrite. I took a class you would take as a jr. or senor, so at this level, you should be working for your grade. Expect to learn, but expect to work. For serious students.

She gives no good feedback on papers, you never know what you are actually supposed to write about. She is harsh with participation and annoyingly tedious with how she gives you the points. Her lectures make no sense to what you read and sometimes she doesn't even know what she is talking about. Avoid her if you can.

Be prepared to work for your grade. Be prepared to sit through long, boring lectures for your grade. Be prepared to take weekly quizzes in your off-time. Be prepared to get graded harshly, with everything you write put under scrutiny. Sound bad? Well be prepared to have a teacher who pushes and encourages you as well, and is always willing to help.

Definitely a charismatic teacher with some funny quirks. Be prepared to work for your grade and to sit through the MOST BORING AND DULL lectures though. Class consisted entirely of 2 papers and a final exam. However Beth is very eager to help and open to suggestions and discussion on what she wants from you. She's very encouraging. Would recommend.

Hewitt's class seemed to me a case of a great professor plagued by unenjoyable literature. I found two of our novels absolutely dreadful, and some of the supplementary readings were boring as well. However, she is so excited about the material and has a great sense of humor. She definitely knows her stuff and is also supportive and helpful.
Awesome professor. Knows her stuff. Very interesting. Would definitely take more of her classes.
This is what I thought college professors are suppose to be like, challenging and willing to help their students succeed. Class act. Love her. Can't wait to take more of her classes.
A really difficult teacher to figure out. She says one thing but when it comes to brass tacks she means another. Expectations too high (and so so vague) concerning papers. Avoid if you can.

I loved having Dr. Hewitt as an instructor.  She was tough but her class will make you feel like you really learned something by the quarter's end.  Her lectures are intellectually engaging and delivered with a quirky sense of humor.  Go to class, do the reading, and participate (she loves this) and she will do everything she can to help you out.
Prof. Hewitt is lovely! Her classes are interesting and the material we read was diverse and engaging. She grades a little tough, but fair. She's very helpful and an awesome professor!

Hewitt was an awesome professor! I took H398 because it was mandatory, but the books she chose, on the whole, were really awesome (graphic novels, anyone?). She was insightful, helpful, and pretty hilarious whether she meant to be or not.Despite her unfortunate love of Melville, my friend and I have dubbed her "Goddess Beth Hewitt" :)

She's one of my favorite professors I've ever had. The books she chose were a struggle, but the discussion was so helpful. She's incredibly intelligent (sometimes I felt like I needed a dictionary when she spoke) and funny. Though the reading was challenging, she didn't grade hard and gave choices in paper topics. I would definately take her again!

Yes, a lot of comments on papers, so I knew how to improve.  Harder than some of my professors, and I didn't like some of the books chosen for class, but there was a lot of choice with regard to doing the assignments.  Participate in class- this is essential- and she will give you the benefit of the doubt.

Hewitt is incredibly insightful; her guided discussions are enlightening and her extensive feedback on papers made me aware of how to become a better writer. Her class is challenging at times, but she's always willing to help and the end result of the class is definitely worth the work. She's amazing.
I loved Prof. Hewitt.  Clear, understanding prof, interesting curriculum, nice person.
Prof. Hewitt is extremely intelligent and knows her subject matter well. She is a difficult teacher, but is very fair and very worth it.
Prof. Hewitt is very accomodating in terms of due dates and office hours. She grades fairly easily, and her lectures are interesting. Loved her reading selections as well.

Professor Hewitt taught me more than anyone in my years at a student ANYWHERE. She's really helpful, grades pretty easily, doesn't expect too much, is leniant with due dates, but a stickler for attendence. If you want to be actually educated TAKE HER
Hard tests, but grades very fair.  Very clear as far as expectations and in lecture.

Professor Cook is an amazing professor! My class was completely asynchronous and whenever I would email her a question she would get back to me very quickly and give me a thorough answer. She is very caring and whats her students to succeed. I would 1000% want her as my professor again.

Professor Cook is a great professor at Ohio State. My class was completely asynchronous but she always responded to my questions quickly and thoroughly. She was always ready to set up a zoom call for me as well. If you follow the directions you will get a great grade! I would 1000% want her as my professor again.

She's a really good teacher and I learned much of writing from her. I could hardly follow at the beginning of the semester so I emailed her frenquently about everything. She replies fast and that really helps. It's really easy to get high score as long as you read the requirement and her feedback. You don't need textbook, I never open that at all.
Class was interesting and it was nice to get to choose our research/paper topic. Accessible quickly over email/office hours, which is important for an asynchronous class. Very manageable workload.
Course was asynchronous so never really interacted with her, but she was easy and accessible when needed.

Lauren was a very kind professor who seemed to have a lot of knowledge about the topic. I struggled a lot with writing the papers though, and felt that her feedback was essentially "look at the instructions," after clearly explaining that I had already done so. I wouldn't recommend adding this class if you have a heavy courseload already.

Very well laid out asynchronous course! Weekly work involved readings and participating in an open-ended discussion board. Papers and writing assignments given offered a lot of freedom and had a nice progression towards a final paper. Fantastic feedback given for every assignment, and always willing to open up a dialogue. Really cares.
Professor Cook genuinely cared about my success in her class. She always gave extensive feedback and was extremely responsive to emails. It was a joy to take her class!

Lauren Cook is such an amazing professor. You can tell that she genuinely cares about her students and will go out of her way to respond to emails and do the best she can to help out struggling students. She gives amazing feedback and is one of the few professors I have had that actually cares. Take her class if you can.

I made this account just to review Ms. Cook since she was so helpful and caring. The class itself is very easy. You basically just build on a paper the whole semester, but I still struggled conceptually. Lauren offered great grading feedback and went out of her way to respond quickly and thoroughly over email. I would recommend you take no one else

Absolutely one of the best professors in the English department! I put off taking this class for my degree but he made it bearable. He is extremely kind and caring. He brought donuts for our class at the end and was always super wholesome thanking people for participating and making class time interesting. The workload and grading are both fair.

A soft-spoken and funny guy, who really is an expert in medieval literature. The subject is hard to follow, but he makes it as easy as possible. Show up, listen, participate, take notes and you'll do well. He wants you to succeed.

Prof. Jones loves teaching and his subject matters. Classes can be a little dry, but he is lax on attendance, loves talking to his students, and is a very fair grader. There is alot of reading, so it is important to keep up with the work, since much of the grade is delegated to the last few weeks of class. Enjoyable class.
Dr. Jones is a very nice person. He responds to emails right away and is overall quick. Except for grading papers.
Good teacher, has a sense of humor.

Christopher Jones is a very good English professor. I had him at CSCC and he was very helpful. We did fun activities in his class and we only wrote about three papers. Not only that, but the topic for the papers made the project fun to write. He's pretty awesome.
Very helpful in class and in offic-hours.  He really wants everyone in his class to learn and be happy there, and he's got a great sense of humor!

Dr. Jones is phenomenal. He's one of the best professors I've ever had at Ohio State (and best English professor by miles). Very soft-spoken, but hilarious. He grades fairly, and his comments are engaging and thoughtful. He definitely cares about his students and he wants them to do well.

He is the best english professor I have ever had. He is very in-depth when grading essays and is funny and KIND, and understands that students are people. He would never make anybody feel bad about anything. He tells you exactly what he wants from you and is awesome. He knows what he wants his class to learn. I have gotten a lot out of this class.

Great professor. Highly recommended. He understood that the material was challenging and took the class through the difficult stuff, step by step. He sought to engage the class in conversation and deep analysis. You don't have to do too much work; mostly you just have to think hard.

Best college prof I've yet had. Take his class even if the material doesn't interest you--his enthusiasm for the texts is infectious. His dry humor is fantastically witty, if you pick up on it. Also--he's one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. An epic hero, in my book.
Pretty easy going guy. Little bit of lecture every class, but mostly class discussion. Very accommodating. Turned in a final paper late, but he only took off a minor number of points.
Prof. Jones is such a nice guy. He grades very fairly. He is very smart and full of interesting facts. He is also very helpful and funny at times.

Professor Jones is one of the most incredible professors I have had during my time at Ohio State. While he is very soft-spoken and humble in his lectures which can make it tough to focus, he is one of the most understanding, passionate professors at the University. I strongly recommend him to anyone.

I reccommend sitting in the front of the class, because he speaks very softly. You can tell he has a passion for medieval literature. He is very sweet, and I heard from another professor he is from the south. He does do this weird tongue thing however, and if you're fimiliar with Harry Potter, Marty Crouch does this exact thing!

Dr. Jones rocks--although a bit quirkey--he is very helpful--one of "the best of the best" at Ohio State--if you're a medievalist--be sure to take one of his classes--I couldn't have learned medieval latin without him! Class is hard--but that's what we're here for!  Very challenging but very rewarding!

He is extremely smart, definitely knows his stuff. The material is pretty dry, but, you can easily get through the class without reading all of it. His grading is EXTREMELY fair, and he genuinely wants to help students. He has a very strange sense of humor, telling us he would go "Medieval" on our asses. :) I'd reccomend him!

Dr. Jones... not a case of what you see is what you get.  He is quite quirky and seems very shy, but is really funny and gave lots of feedback on papers.  Very helpful, very dedicated.  Highly recommend
Understated craziness. Dr. Jones is great, I hope I get to take another one of his classes while I'm here.

This guy was a quiet riot.  He seems to be perpetually nervous, but he's really got a lot to him.  When I found out he liked Arrested Development I could totally understand his personality after that.  Class is easy if you go and think.  He truly does grade you on your work and only your work.  He has lots of good information, balances it all well.
He is the reason I became and English major and continued on to become an English teacher.  His passion for literature inspired me.  He made it clear that he cared about his students and his work.

Expects a lot from his students but gives a lot in return. Cares if students learn something in his class, not just get a good grade. Funny, caring and goes the extra mile for his students. One of the best at OSU.
Don't let his unassuming manner fool you, he's one of the funniest profs I've ever had.
Very funny and made mideival lit interesting. Hard exams but the material is covered in class.

Expect to learn writing skills through fun class/group activities rather than lengthy, boring lectures. He gives a a ton of valuable feedback and suggestions and is accessible outside of class. The amount of reading and writing was more than I'd expect for a 2000's level course, but it helped improve my writing and I feel less nervous sharing it.

Highly recommend Professor Jones. Very considerate and allows make up work, which is especially helpful because if you're new to some of the content in the course it can be challenging to understand at first. He allows for creative freedom in projects and gives detailed rubrics for all of them.

She was very kind and left helpful feedback for posts and drafts for projects! The first half of the class involved discussion posts and the second was for the project where we wrote our story drafts. The class was very manageable, and the textbook she includes has very useful writing tips. The short stories chosen were interesting and diverse!
Really loved this class, very inclusive and overall great prof
Pretty good class, learned a lot and it was a small size.

Professor Richards was by far my favorite professor this semester. He grades easy, as long as you try and is very understanding of your problems. Attendance does matter in this class because most of the class is student lead and full of discussion. He makes the class very enjoyable and is a great teacher.

I took Nathan Richard's class for my second year writing credit and really enjoyed it. Make sure to participate in class because it is graded, but he is overall a very forgiving grader who wants to see you succeed.

All of the concepts required for the course were outlined in weekly outlines of the material that we would be covering. Usually 1-3 readings (sometimes movies/podcasts/small books) per week, most of which were fairly interesting. He does check if you read the material with weekly comprehension quizzes, so you can't really skip them.

So bad. You basically teach yourself. Had another professor lecture over the same content and it was much better comparatively. Worst professor Ive ever had. He makes no sense. Doesnt teach anything just rambles about nonsense that doesnt matter.
Seth is an extremely chill professor, in all senses of the word. While you can pretty much sneeze and get an A in the class, it is extremely boring. I used this class as a study hall.

The lectures are SO SO SO SO boring. Seth is a nice guy, but he doesn't reply to emails. His lecture slides are stuffed with information which he doesn't present in an easy way at all. However, the class was pretty easy with 2 exams, 3 papers, and 20% of the grade for attendance and participation. I used it as a study hall.
Seth is one of the best instructors I have had, including the ones at OSU and Ohio Northern University. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, do it.

I took Seth for a Religious and Diversity writing class. Overall he's a really nice guy and the class is not difficult. He assigns extremely long readings that you discuss in class the next day, but really wasn't necessary to read them. Not many assignments and he's a pretty easy grader. Class was boring but it's religion so not really his fault

Lee is an amazing professor and I truly enjoyed his class. He is very intelligent and insightful when it comes to publishing. Although he is a nice guy, I would have preferred more structure for class. Grading criteria for work was unclear and his feedback could be more in depth. This was not a major issue, though.

Prof Martin talks a LOT. The first few weeks were easily ninety minutes straight of listening to him talk about nothing relating to what we were working on. Once we got to workshops, he would get easily sidetracked. Feedback he gave was next to nothing. I learned more from my classmates than I did from him.
Brilliant writer, heartbreaking, and such a nice guy!
Not a smart guy. Makes corny jokes and brings windup toys to class. Champions mediocre work. Runs class like a Sunday school. Yuck.

A great instructor, and a genuinely cool human being.  I learned a lot from him; his comments on my stories were always helpful, and he always seemed to know exactly what I was trying to do with my writing.
Very good teacher. He will definitely improve your writing. But you do have to work for it!
I've been taking this guy's classes for three years, and I wish I could take them for three more. He's the gold standard.
Very good teacha!
Easily the best teacher I've ever had.
Just amazing.  So gentle and yet he can tell you exactly what your story is about when writing.  He really pushes you to be a better writer.
Very smart, very eloquent.  Great teacher.  You have to do your work for the grade.

The material was really well organized and the assignments weren't too much. The professor really enjoys spirited conversation about the readings and encourages everyone to think critically and build off of each other. You HAVE to participate in class A LOT to get a good grade though. I learned a lot from her and it wasn't boring at all.

She gives a lot of readings & expects you to read every little bit, but the actual course is interesting. I took her for English 4592. I thought she was going to be a lot stricter on participation grades but if you show up & look interested, she will give you an A. Her lectures were also interesting & it's clear she knows what she's talking about.

I took her Literary Locations class for Austen and Hardy. She is very knowledgeable about the subject and her lectures were very engaging. She isn't afraid to challenge your ideas and make you think about your arguments. The reading was manageable and the assignments were straightforward. Meeting with her outside of class definitely helps.

I took Professor Warhol's class as required for all English majors, and don't know why we had an entire class period devoted to trans and gender politics. She required us to read 50-70 pages and provide a 250 word response between each class. In addition, we were expected to take a midterm and final, while also writing papers. I dropped her class

Robyn was a very interesting professor and you could tell she loves what she does which makes the class more enjoyable. You will be reading ALOT. but alot of the poems and novels are interesting. You have 2 assignments due every week on the reading (its not that bad). You have 2 exams but they are easy if you read the material. Take her!

Great teacher. Books are required and assigns readings out of them. Each week she posts questions on the readings and assigns a page response for homework. Attendance is taken by a sign in sheet and powerpoints are very useful. However, she does gives tests. Midterm and Final are T F and matching a passage with its author, year, and what is happeni

Professor Warhol's Austen and Hardy literary locations class was the most intellectually stimulating environment I've been in during college. She asks thought provoking questions and encourages class discussion to push her students to think for themselves. As long as you do the reading you'll be fine. Wonderful educator and person.

Professor Warhol genuinely cares about what she's teaching, and that shows. Attendance is extremely important to both lectures and recitations. Lots of reading, but manageable. Does the class backwards.

She's pretty great, very nice and genuinely cares about her subject. She does throw a fit if a student gets up and leaves during class (only if they didn't talk to her beforehand). Her lectures are genuinely quite interesting and thorough. The reading assignments can be a bit on the longer side ( the longest is only 50 pages) but it's enjoyable.

The class is structured great, but the professor is awful. Warhol will call out a student for getting up during class for "interrupting", when really she is the one interrupting the class. There is a writing assignment due before every class but they only grade 4 randomly. The readings are various in length, from half a page to a novel excerpt.....

Prof Natasha is a very kind instructor. I took 1901 in last semester, she graded every assignments reasonable and always gave feedbacks to every assignments. In addition, the difficulty of the course is not very hard.

While I took this class purely to fulfil a GE credit, I found myself really enjoying the easy going nature of the professor and the class. It is easy to tell how much professor Thomas cares about her students and the subject matter. Plus we all loved spending class time with her pup Cascade!
I loved having Nikki as a professor! She makes class fun and engaging and is a very caring professor. She has experience in the subject and truly wants her students to succeed!

Professor Ko is a great poetry professor! I enjoyed her enthusiasm in class each day, her efficiency in teaching different styles of poetry, and her experience in the craft. Her class is very fun and knowledgeable!

BEST PROF EVER. She understands you have a lot going on as a student and she is super flexible with deadlines and gives open-ended assignments so you can do stuff you are passionate about and have fun with it. She grades very fairly, so do the work and the readings and you are set! It's a really fun class, not overwhelming at all!

Assignments are easily laid out and she doesn't grade too harshly. Easy to reach and responsive to any questions anyone may have. Come to class with at least one question about any readings, though, and be ready to participate at least a little bit. Deadlines are very negotiable, so don't be afraid to ask for extensions.

Morgan cares about her students so much, SHE WANTS YOU TO SUCCEED! As long as you show up and thoughtfully complete your assignments, you're golden! If you are having difficulties with the assignments or deadlines just communicate with her and she will be understanding!
I love Hannah so much she is so kind and caring about her students and will really take the time to answer questions and listen to any opinion.

Hannah is amazing! She works really hard to make sure all assignments have a good description with no room for confusion. She also is super accessible outside of class and will make sure you get the extra help if you need it. The class is based around 1 paper and 1 presentation but she breaks it down into separate stages, making it very manageable.

Prof Chen was very kind. The online lecture was a bit stale- not much student participation. He was very knowledgable, just wasn't the most entertaining (definitely because it was online)- If WGSST is your major, I think you'll find it very interesting! Easy class with not many assignments. He's super understanding as well- just communicate!
